author: {'steamid': '76561198137352716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 21975, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21860, 'last_played': 1702811690}
review: Je n'aime pas le mécanisme qui fait que contre le CPU, surtout sur les points critiques, tout se passe comme s'il ne pouvait rien rater, et que c'est l'inverse pour le joueur humain. Par exemple, jouer contre le nadal de 2006, qui sur n'importe quelle situation chaude se transforme en machine à aces et à points gagnants en revers (Nadal 2006.....).
developer_response:
Bonjour,

je suis désolé qu'après plus de 300h mon jeu ne te plaise pas.

Par contre, il n'y a aucun mécanisme qui rend les joueurs plus forts spécifiquement dans les moments tendus.

Cependant, le tennis étant un jeu de balance entre les 2 joueurs, si toi tu te tends un peu sur les points importants et donc joues moins bien (eg: en visant moins proche des lignes), alors tu vas permettre à ton adversaire de mieux jouer.

Ensuite, l'ordinateur joue un peu mieux ou un peu moins bien d'un moment à l'autre de manière aléatoire, donc forcément, des fois il jouera mieux dans un moment critique, et c'est ce moment là qui va te marquer, et après tu auras l'impression que cela se produit tout le temps (cela s'appelle le biais de confirmation)... :-)

Dans tous les cas, cela reste réaliste : au tennis, c'est très important de savoir encaisser mentalement les moments où l'adversaire joue mieux.

Et pour éviter de te prendre top d'aces, lis les astuces du point 3 ici : https://www.managames.com/Forum/topic8-6180.php . (en anglais)

Voilà, j'espère t'avoir éclairé un peu...

author: {'steamid': '76561198158425145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1216, 'last_played': 1689870891}
review:
Świetna, realistyczna symulacja tenisa. Mechanika pozwala poczuć się jakbyś naprawdę grał w tenisa, z realistycznym odwzorowaniem zachowania piłki po kontakcie z nawierzchnią w zależności od typu kortu i rotacji, np. bardzo niskiej piłki nie przebijesz inaczej jak slajsem, a będąc bliżej siatki musisz popracować topspinem by nie zrobić błędu. Za to zwrotność zawodnika zależna jest od tego po czym biega i indywidualnych parametrów szybkości i wzrostu (im wyższy tym większy ma zasięg, ale gorszą szybkość i zwrotność). Ogrom parametrów zawodników pozwala zachować indywidualny charakter każdego przeciwnika i daje okazję zbudować swojego tenisistę wg preferowanego stylu gry, np. ustawienie parametru rotacji na wyższym poziomie poprawia defensywę i zwiększa okazję gry kątowej, ale kosztem słabszego przyspieszenia piłki.

Gra jest też łatwa do modowania więc jeżeli chcesz zmienić jakiś globalny parametr (np. zdolność returnowania AI, ogólną trudność wolejowania) to możesz to łatwo zrobić edytując plik tennis.ini, albo ściągając mody z strony gry managames.com i jej bardzo aktywnego forum. Niestety gra nie ma licencji ATP lub WTA więc nazwiska realnych graczy są niedostępne w wersji oryginalnej. Na szczęście problem ten rozwiązują wspomniane wyżej mody. 

Szczerze polecam każdemu fanowi tenisa!

author: {'steamid': '76561198121390045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1685308959}
review:
To be fair, this game is a lot more functional than AO Tennis 2 (on my computers).

[b]Also, as an important plus, the developer is still providing support for this game.  [i]That considerably improved my impression of the game! [/i][/b]  For example, I think switching to "Arcade Mode" is quite helpful, and I believe the comments provide additional documentation that I expect can be helpful to others.

However, I still find it a lot harder to control than the Virtua Tennis games (on the Dreamcast), or even Mario Tennis (on the N64, if I remember correctly).

Also, I had to change the display settings from the defaults in order to play the game (again, at least on one of my computers).

So, it may be a while before I try to play the game again.  However, if you have a good handle on the controls, then I think it should be a fun game!
developer_response:
Hello,

I'm sorry you didn't enjoy my game.

As stated on the Steam store page, this is a tennis simulation, not an arcade game like Virtua Tennis or Mario Tennis, and thus it requires some learning to get the hang of the controls.

To do so, try to play in the Training Club -> Warm Up, with Fast Auto Positioning + Aiming Preview till you get the hang of the controls. (AutoPos & Preview can be changed in Training Club -> Character Sheet)

If it's still too hard, you can change your controls from Simulation to Arcade (still in your Character Sheet).

If you started to play right away in the World Tour, you get a slow player, and Medium AutoPos without Aiming Preview so it's indeed quite hard to begin with. So you can change all that in the Character Sheet of your World Tour player, or even start a new Career with a higher starting ranking to get higher skills from the start.

Lastly, you may want to do the tutorial in the free demo of TE4 : www.managames.com/tennis ; TE4 is harder than TE2013 but the control philosophy is identical.

I hope it helps ! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561199485828049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1679326740}
review:
Game mechanics are way out dated and controller support is very bad. 
Find something else or better use Topspin 4 with emulators.
developer_response:
Hello,

I'm sorry you didn't enjoy my game.

The controller works fine for the match. It works for the menus as well, but it can get a bit cumbersome so it's indeed easier to use the mouse.

For the game mechanics, TE2013 is just the most-played tennis game in PC history, by a big margin, and its mechanisms are still in TE4, which is now the most-played tennis game on Steam since last September, so I'd say the mechanics are fine, but you need to take a bit of time to learn them... :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198079912746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1676952284}
review: Menus, HUD, environment, clarity of options or animations are horrible. It's a game for modding, not a commercial game to install and play.  Not bad gameplay, but if there was Top Spin 4 on PC, no way I had bought this one.
developer_response:
Hello,

I'm sorry you didn't enjoy my game.

However, everything you listed is clearly visible on the Steam Store page, even the menus : TE2013 is obviously a low-production game, old with that. So no one in his right mind would buy it for its production value : it's clearly ages away from Top Spin 4 at 1st glance at any screenshot. :-)

Maybe you shouldn't have bought it in the 1st place..?

Anyway people buy TE2013 1st for the gameplay. Did you have some issues with it ? There are many options to tailor it to your tastes if needed.

And maybe you could try to install a Mod ? It's not hard and can indeed help you get into the atmosphere.

Lastly, apparently, you bought the game without looking enough at its presentation, so your review doesn't make much sense and hurt a little Indie game. Is there any chance you could consider removing it ? Thanks in advance for giving some thought to that.

And if you need any help or have any questions, I'm usually around : https://steamcommunity.com/app/346470/discussions/ . :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198332259054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1687288451}
review:
- 이 게임은 모드가 생명인데 https://www.managames.com에서 '2021 patch by Tennis Experience'를 꼭 설치하고 해보세요. 일종의 팩인데 유명 스타플레이어들과 특유의 모션 및 음성, 중계진, 다양한 복장, 공식 경기들이 재현되어 있습니다. 
- 해외에서는 최고의 테니스게임으로 꼽히는데, 공의 물리가 현실적이라는 점에서 그런 평을 듣고 있는 것 같습니다. 테니스를 잘 모르기에 평을 하긴 어렵지만 슬라이스의 휘어짐이라든지, 탑스핀의 높은 바운드 이런 부분들이 잘 구현되어 있는 것 같습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561199100449486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 91635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58040, 'last_played': 1710604442}
review: This is, without a doubt, the most detailed and realistic tennis game I have ever played. The World Tour Mode is especially incredible, with the extensive calendar allowing for the full career experience. The only tennis game better than this one is the sequel, Tennis Elbow 4. Whichever one you get, you will definitely be satisfied.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996908408', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4923, 'last_played': 1693992730}
review:
I have been playing Tennis Elbow since 2010 on the mac at first. I got the steam version few years back and i can say this game is a blast to play. Here are the following aspects that makes this a highly recommended game
- True Simulation. Most Tennis games offer an arcade experience. Here the unpredictability is higher and gameplay is realistic
- Character/Player Attributes and Levelling up like an RPG. 
- Career mode is Incredible! I play the WTA tour as i enjoy women's tennis and every opponent/AI Player has a personality of their own. Every player's gameplay is different. For example Venus Williams is a power player while Aranta Sanchez Vicario hits a lot of top spin shots. Some players have a game based on serve and volley and some are baseline hitters. Every player dresses different and has different grunts and playstyle. Got hammered by Anna Smashnova? Dread meeting her again in the next tournament? All of this adds to realism and makes you feel you are in the WTA tour! yeah i know! I play my career from 2005, thus lots of legacy names here :) 
- Modding scene is incredible. 
- Developer is a one man army. Such a nice bloke in the forums. 

Playing the game with the Logitech controller on PC is not easy. I cant setup 'RB', 'LB' for drop and lob shots. Also you seem to move slower on controller than on keyboard. For now i'm enjoying playing on the keyboard. I wish the controller setup was better.

Overall this is a highly recommended game. Just go for it, add some mods and play the Career mode!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982620200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1050, 'last_played': 1679599501}
review:
Don't let the terrible graphics stop you from getting the best Tennis game on PC, and arguably the best pure Tennis game ever made.

The difficulty can be tweaked to make every rally a challenge at every level of a career mode. There are mods that make the game look (somewhat) better and look smoother, adding real players from the ATP and WTA rosters. And every single type of court is simulated, as well as tendencies for real life players.

Having played everything from AO Tennis to Top Spin to Virtua Tennis, this is the only game that I can adjust to a point where a tennis match feels like a proper back and forth, without being BSed by an unstoppable AI who cannot make mistakes, or AI incapable of defending basic baseline attacks.

Finally the difficulty and assists can be tweaked to your own taste, and slowly weaned off to make the experience second to none.

review: I just want to give a shoutout to the creator of Tennis Elbow for this game. While other tennis video games allow you to immediately become the champion in the first year, this one actually forces you to endure the grind that most futures and challenger-level tennis players have to face. Even though 4 has come out, I'll continue playing this until the game has been fully developed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080493208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 3879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3879, 'last_played': 1636142231}
review:
When I was younger, and into adulthood, I’ve played a lot of tennis. I really loved the time I spent on the court and because of that affinity for the sport, I've tried out a variety of tennis games over the years. Smash Court, Top Spin, Virtua, Wii Sports, NES (Top Players and Nintendo's own) Hot Shots, Mario...Pong :P, and probably some others have landed on my gaming screen. Some have been enjoyable and provided good fun, be they realistic or otherwise. But I've always been looking for a game that really replicated the feeling of being on the court. Enter Tennis Elbow 2013.

I don't remember how I became aware of this title, but the reviews all seemed to indicate that this would hit the sweet spot on my virtual racket, and after close to 70 hours, I'm ready to share my opinion. First of all, what TE does right is exactly what I was looking for - that feeling of being on the court. As you trade strokes (all the shots you'd make in a real match are here), that sensation of maneuvering yourself and your opponent around the court looking for that opening to put a winner away is fantastic. It's all about timing, positioning, anticipation, shot selection and execution. And the mechanics of executing your shot are subtle and varied, allowing you to really paint the lines when you get in a groove, imparting a wonderfully satisfying feeling of control. As the ralleys play out, there is an ever-present tension as you struggle to nudge the point in your favor - really great stuff. And the AI can be really challenging if you so desire. There are 6 difficulty levels, each containing 10 sub-levels., so it's possible to find that perfect zone for your own skill in order to find the right level of challenge with room to amp things up if you so desire.

The main meat of the game is a career mode where you create a player and start from youth, playing tournaments and training week after week in the hopes of eventually becoming the best player in the world. The way it's structured is that you acquire points to assign to your character through successful performances in tournaments - starting with the lower level tournaments and working your way up the ladder as your rank improves. But it's a balancing act because if you don't rest and play too many tournaments, you'll not have enough time for training in order to improve your (constantly declining) skills, and your stamina will become an issue from overwork. So you've got to take into consideration how much of a work load to take on as you develop your player. And climbing the ranks is satisfying - if, again, you've found that sweet spot in difficulty. Once you start encountering top 50 players, you'll be working for every point and every notch in the world rankings. It can be a bit of a grind because there are so many tournaments available, and playing a full career from beginning to retirement would take untold number of hours.

The game does have some downsides. I believe it was made by a single individual, and the lack of polish in terms of presentation is evident. Everything is very dry - some might say befitting of the sport, but a little bit of spice and flavor could have gone a long way towards engagement. It's got the nuts and bolts, but not the sizzle. The menus/UI are not very intuitive at first either. Once you figure things out, it's no problem, but they could use a redesign. Everything outside the on-court action feels very low budget, albeit functional. And as much as I love the core representation of tennis on the court, there is some room for improvement in one regard - net play. Coming to the net is a little awkward and not as smooth and natural as the exchange of ground-strokes from the baseline.

But, the most important facet of a good sports game for me is the feel of the sport itself in translation to controller in hand, and here Tennis Elbow 2013 really shines as the best (certainly most realistic) example of the game in virtual form in my opinion, net-play notwithstanding. It's consistently realistic and satisfying, and just *feels* like tennis. When you're an up and coming player on the fringes of being recognized and you find yourself up against a top 10 player in the world in a 5th set tie break at the US Open you entered as a qualifier, the tension is very real and palpable. You really feel as if you are on center court and each point is dripping with the tension you'd expect to feel as if you were there. With a little more budget and development resources this could be truly spectacular for a tennis fan. As it is, it's still great, just wanting that for that little extra that would put it all the way over the top. 4/5.

---

So the issue is that you bought the game by mistake. There's nothing especially wrong with the game, right ?
So is there any chance you could delete your review as it's unfair for the game ?
Thanks in advance to give some thoughts about that.

[h2]=============== EDIT 1 ======[/h2]

환불을 받기에는 너무 늦을 수 있지만 여전히 스팀을 묻는 것을 시도 할 수 있습니다.

그렇지 않으면이 mod : https://www.managames.com/forum/topic29-24824.php (또는 다른 하나, 포럼 확인)

또한 친구 요청을 수락 할 수도 있고, 당신을 돕는 것이 더 쉬울 것입니다. :-)

It might be too late to get a refund, but you still can try to ask Steam.

Else, you might enjoy the game more with this Mod : https://www.managames.com/Forum/topic29-24824.php (or another one, check the forum)

You could also accept my friend request, it'd be easier to help you. :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198245441650', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1643229510}
review: While i did enjoy the game for a bit, and its pretty blatant that a fair amount of work was put in this game, I would like to point out that the learning curve of this game is by far, of the 200 or so games ive played, the hardest. Beginner difficulty requires aim, timing, and positioning. So i think that the game is way to hard, or it has some severe control issues. But other than that, if you really are a tennis fan, and your fine with an incredibly difficult game, you might as well give it a try.
developer_response:
Hello,

try to play in the Training Club -> Warm Up, with Fast Auto Positioning + Aiming Preview till you get the hang of the controls. (AutoPos & Preview can be changed in Training Club -> Character Sheet)

If it's still too hard, you can change your controls from Simulation to Arcade (still in your Character Sheet).

If you started to play right away in the World Tour, you get a slow player, and Medium AutoPos without Aiming Preview so it's indeed quite hard to begin with. So you can change all that in the Character Sheet of your World Tour player, or even start a new Career with a higher starting ranking to get higher skills from the start.

And thanks for still recommending the game despite feeling it's too hard..! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198120945931', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 4977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3330, 'last_played': 1711138849}
review:
Moja pierwsza poważna tenisowa gierka od czasów Virtua Tennis 2009, który w swoim czasie był naprawdę przyjemną grą (z naprawdę przyzwoitym trybem kariery), choć dość łatwą i mega arcadową. Tutaj może nie ma jakiejś wypasionej grafiki czy animacji, bo te są dość archaiczne, ale TE2013 może pochwalić się interesującą, realistyczną rozgrywką. Gram od prawie 50 godzin na modzie ITST, bo w sumie tylko ten mi w miarę poprawnie działa, nie mam pojęcia dlaczego. W pewnym momencie poprosiłem o zwrot pieniędzy za grę (byłem totalnie zagubiony, nie potrafiłem w to grać i myślałem że potrwa to wieki zanim ogarnę podstawy), na szczęście było już na to za późno, bo dam sobie rękę uciąć że potem bym jedynie żałował.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2674407781
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2674408258
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2674409318

PS: Team Rafa, Iga, Paula Badosa and Casper Ruud here!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025167529', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 5601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 61, 'playtime_at_review': 4887, 'last_played': 1712377898}
review: Best tennis game bar-none. Old and hasn't seen updates but works just fine as of 11/11/21. Multiplayer can be hard to find a match but the forums on the dev's website are surprisingly active even for this older title. With the career mode mod "Maxou" something this is the complete experience of a tennis game so far on PC. Though I have high hopes for TE4 it is very unpolished and as the dev is only a part-time dev (props for making games while working full time) updates can be slow. All-in-all if you're a TENNIS fan and love playing a satisfying simulation that has very good ball physics then I'd definitely reccomend a purchase on this hidden gem. If you're looking for more "arcade" style tennis (IE: Virtua Tennis) I'd stay away from this one however.

author: {'steamid': '76561198340903829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 7892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1264, 'last_played': 1691753281}
review:
Incluso luego de 8 años, TE2013 sigue siendo la mejor simulación de tenis en videojuegos. Los controles son sencillos pero en la jugabilidad influyen varios factores (superficie, movimiento del jugador, posicionamiento, stats personales). Está la posibilidad de empezar una carrera tanto en individuales como en dobles, en el circuito masculino o femenino, desde torneos Future hasta los Grand Slam. Los continuos aportes (mods) de la comunidad, añadiendo skins, golpes y posturas de jugadores específicos, hacen que TE sea un juego siempre fresco. Tiene, además, una base de datos de jugadores desde el 2000 hasta el año actual en continua renovación, por lo que es posible jugar contra el tardío Boris Becker hasta los NextGen.
Lo vengo jugando desde 2013 y no me ha aburrido en ningún momento.
Recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169343897', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1634252912}
review: Игра офигенная, особенно для 2013 года. Крутой симулятор тенниса с простенькой графикой, но большинству любителей этого спорта графика и не нужна. Ещё и весит 200 мб. Полноценный сезон, море турниров, парные матчи, даже покрытие по отскоку отличается. Новая версия дороговато стоит, поэтому решил взять попроще для начала, чтобы опробовать. Ну и не пожалел)

author: {'steamid': '76561198061640074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1678817331}
review: I bought this game on sale for $10, and it seems like it is one of the best tennis games available. This game is much easier to control than the other Tennis Game I own called Tennis World Tour. All you have to do is move to the ball with the arrow keys and it will automatically hit the ball, so it has really easy controls for beginners. The graphics aren't quite as nice but the game is much easier to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198385638148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 189671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141994, 'last_played': 1707981322}
review: 从2015年开始游玩，至今仍是最爱的一款网球游戏。相比其他各类网球主题的游戏，tennis elbow 的操作还原度、球员涵盖度以及各种赛事、排名的仿真度都绝对是同类网球游戏中数一数二的。可惜由于国内的“墙”，互联网联机比赛在国内几乎无法完成，是一个很大的遗憾。如果能有真人玩家的联机锦标赛（类似于“排位赛”那种），相信热度会比现在还要高得多，也会吸引到更多的网球游戏爱好者前来购买、游玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198063690797', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 252, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1655912425}
review:
Tennis oyunlarına merak saldıktan sonra şöyle bi piyasada ne var ne yok diye araştırdım. Diğerlerine nazaran bu oyun eski 2013 yapımı bir oyun ama gerçekten efsane bi oyun olmuş.
Oyun tek başına sizi çok memnun etmeyebilir 2modu var training match modu ve World tour modu var. Tabi World tourda nadal vs yok lisansız herşey tabi burada devreye en sevdiğim olay modlar giriyor.
Bu oyunda da modlama baya iyi derecede yapılmış 2-3 tane temel ve detaylı mod var. Tüm tenisçiler tüm lisanslar yapılmış hatta öyle bişi var ki gerçek courlarda oynuyorsunuz. Resim olarak koymuşlar arka plana direk orada oynuyorsunuz ve sırıtmıyor baya güzel.

Modlardan bahsettik peki oyunun dinamiği fiziği nasıl derseniz. Oyunu World tour modunda kendi karakterimi oluşturarak oynuyorum. Başlarda gerçekten sıkıntılı süreçler geçiriyorsunuz tüm toplar fault ve out oluyor. Eliniz güçlendikçe daha iyi toplar atabiliyorsunuz. Fazlasıyla zorluk modu var bide onun alt leveli var.
Karakter özelleştirme baya detaylı muhtemelen modla gelen yüzlerce dış görünüş öğesi var. Maç yaptıkça da forehand mi backhand mi yoksa servis vuruşunuzu mu slice mi geliştireceğinizi ayarlıyorsunuz. Deneyim kazandıkça sıralama yükselip daha iyi oluyorsunuz.

Oyunla ilgili şikayet edeceğim konu maç içindeki vuruş animasyonları hatta topun düştüğü yerler aut noktaları vs değişmiyor. Daha topa vururken ne olacağını tahmin edebiliyorsunuz. Belki zorluk yükselince değişiyordur bilemem ama 2013te yapılan bi oyun için oldukça doyurucu ve zevkli.
developer_response:
If the game is too predictable for you, try to change the Controls of your player (in the Character Sheet) from Simulation to Elite.

It'll make the game significantly harder, with a bigger aiming zone on average.

And thanks for the recommendation ! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198043852237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1653073648}
review:
OK, I previously gave a negative review to this game.  What I didn't put into it was time.   I lost my first 18 matches against the computer (at Junior level).  But then I started figuring out how the AI, and more importantly how different shots work.  Don't get me wrong, the learning curve on this game is very, very steep.  But once you've mastered the basic gameplay the genius of this game starts showing through.  

The only complaint I have is that there's a second, equally steep learning curve once you get to the highest levels of the game.  I have no trouble beating players at around world number 50.  World number 25, I'll struggle with but usually beat or be close to beating.  World number 1-5, totally unplayable.  I reached the final of one tournament only to face the world number one, and I went down 6-0 6-0 and only won eight points the entire match.  There must be another gear that I don't know about.  But at least I'm eager to find out what it is now.
developer_response:
Hello,

I'm sorry you have some issue with my game.

What do you not understand exactly ?

The basics are explained here : https://www.managames.com/tennis/doc/Tennis_Elbow-Tennis_Game.html#how .

The main thing to know is that you shouldn't release the strike buttons before hitting the ball, and you're basically good to go. :-)

To get comfortable with the controls, it's recommended to play with the Aiming Preview on for a little while in the Warm-Up mode of the Training Club.

If you have an XBox or PS4 controller, here is my configuration (which is usually easier to handle than the default one) : https://www.managames.com/Forum/topic15-29252.php

I hope it helps and if you have any other questions, I'm here... :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198050997831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 23870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15082, 'last_played': 1654201783}
review:
Tennis Elbow 2013 is the best tennis simulator of all time. 

Lots of tennis games are good, and fun, but to me they've always felt kind of like they are holding your hand.

TE2013 does not.  It's hard in a very fun way.  The depth of skill is incredible, as you can play for 1000 hours and still have more to learn. 

TLDR: Buy this game, then also buy Tennis Elbow 4 when it comes out

author: {'steamid': '76561197980547316', 'num_games_owned': 667, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 6720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 16, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1711471133}
review:
Bought this game directly from the developer a long time ago and got a free steam key. 

This is the best tennis game ever. Not the best by graphics, but by game-play. Also there are mods available that make your entire court look like a TV broadcast, so graphics cannot be a problem if you want realism. It is awesome!

I suggest everyone to checkout the ITST mod, that adds numerous TV broadcast 2D&3D courts (you can switch between 2D and 3D in the options, I like 2D more because it is an actual screenshot of a tv brodcast). It also adds real tennis players with characteristic animations and sounds. it is a must, if you own this game. The installation is simple on windows via windows installer. You can find it by google-ing "ITST mod" and visiting the official forum post where you can find instructions and downloads. You can also join ITST online league if you think you are good enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176896615', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 16204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16200, 'last_played': 1622486165}
review: This is more of a tennis simulator, than any other tennis games I have ever played,  It is very challenging, but once you get the timing issues solved, it plays like real tennis. I ran into issues with controller not working in the steam version, and with the help of the developer, was able to solve that problem by downloading the full version from managames,com,  I have really been impressed by the responsiveness of the DEVELOPER no less, and he helped me until the gamepad issues were resolved.  This has an incredible World Tour career mode, Be sure and choose your player from a long list of players but make sure you choose HUMAN, not CPU.  Kudos to the wonderful developer and I give the game 5 star rating.

review:
Amazing game, probably the best tennis game yet on steam. Be sure to add mods as they totally enhance the experience (they provide an updated roster and most of all the best animations for each players on the tour not like those generic ones that you get on other tennis games).

Gameplay needs some getting used to, but once you mastered it, you won't regret it. Instant buy for all tennis fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044021621', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 20324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4347, 'last_played': 1659943515}
review:
Best tennis game I've ever played.
- Amazing controls. You have absolute control on several strokes.
- Several degrees of difficulty. You can choose among 50 degrees of difficulty between beating easily every computer player (easiest) and being defeated always (most difficult). 
- Amazing realism. Using Maxou patch every player movements are different and quite similar to real players. Federer serves, Roddick serves, etc feel like the real player movements. Even screams feel real.
- World career is incredibly complete. Lots of tournaments, courts, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078138480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 72296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 65, 'playtime_at_review': 10163, 'last_played': 1711939353}
review:
While I do recommend this game for the realism of most matches, and incredibly high customisation, there's a weird thing about what would be "real" players (Djokovic, Nadal, etc) being incredibly difficult to beat, not because they are good, but because they enter some sort of Avatar state on: your game, winning it to 0 or 15 by hitting cannon balls into absurd angles off of 220km/h serves into the corner; their games on break point, absolutely always clutching out aces. Another thing I noticed is that somehow against these guys, when they are on the game you can tell they will in, you simply can't put in 1st serves. It's like the game does not allow you to win, nerfing your character so you lose.

Also annoying: short balls. when you get to them you can't hit properly, hitting a floaty shot back, which the computer can hit through easily. Slices are unreal too, since they barely bounce off of the ground, so you can't hit a proper shot and cannot get there on time almost ever. 

Somehow I only get into these problems against what would be the real life pros. Against everyone else this is not much of a problem, or I can get the match to be competitive. When this happens, it's super enjoyable. I don't like losing obviously, but I lost tons of matches because the machine was just better. When I lose because it looks like the cpu is exploiting some sort of glitch, it's just frustrating. I raged a couple times.

Will keep playing a lot though.
developer_response:
Hello,

thanks for the recommendation despite having some frustration with the game. :-)

I'm going to try to clarify some points.

1) There's no special AI for the best players, and there's no special AI for breakpoints or stuff like that. There's no alteration of your 1st service rate either. All that is only random and then you get a confirmation bias in your mind, and/or you get stressed in such situations and play a bit less well, and thus your opponent plays a bit better ; that's tennis..! :-)

2) The too good return on fast services is one of the worst issues of TE2013. It can happen anytime against almost any opponent. I fixed that in TE4.
However, once you know this kind of return exists, you can catch most of them by quickly going a bit backward right after you have hit your serve.

3) If the short balls annoy you too much, it may mean you stand too far from the baseline. If you don't play with the Danger Zone (or at least the ball impact preview), it should help to turn it on.

4) On what difficulty level are you playing..?

author: {'steamid': '76561198034252158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1662237338}
review: Das Spiel hat leider nichts mit Tennis zu tun und ist ein Rückschritt sogar gegenüber Top Spin Tennis 4. Die Idee,richtig zum Ball zu stehen, ist leider schlecht umgesetzt. Mehr Frust als Spielspaß. ich kann nur abraten.
developer_response:
[h1]Online-Übersetzung von https://translate.google.com[/h1]
Hallo,

Es tut mir leid, dass du mein Spiel nicht genossen hast.

Wie Sie in den anderen Testberichten des Spiels sehen können, wurde es von vielen als die beste Tennissimulation aller Zeiten bezeichnet. Ich denke, Sie haben einige Dinge über die Steuerung nicht verstanden.

Sie haben nicht zu viele Details angegeben, daher ist es schwierig, sicher zu sein, was für Sie falsch ist. Wenn Sie Ihren Spieler jedoch nicht positionieren möchten, können Sie seine automatische Position in seinem Charakterblatt auf schnell einstellen (sofern dies nicht bereits der Fall ist) Fall).

Sonst, wenn es sich nicht nach Tennis anfühlt, liegt es vielleicht daran, dass Sie nicht verstanden haben, wie man den Ball schlägt und Ihre Schläge zielt? Achten Sie dazu darauf, dass Sie den Schlagknopf gedrückt halten, wenn Sie den Ball schlagen, und zielen Sie korrekt nach links oder rechts, bevor Sie den Ball treffen.

Wenn du mir mehr darüber erzählst, was für dich los ist, könnte ich dir vielleicht mehr helfen ... :-)

[h3]EDIT Dezember:[/h3]
Sie haben 30 Stunden gespielt, seit Sie Ihre Bewertung abgegeben haben.

Bist du sicher, dass du das Spiel immer noch nicht magst?

[h1]English[/h1]
Hello,

I'm sorry you didn't enjoy my game.

As you can see in the other reviews of the game, many people acclaimed it as the best tennis simulation ever, so I guess you didn't understand some things about the controls.

You didn't give too many details so it's hard to be sure what's wrong for you, but if you don't like to position your player, you can set his Auto-Position to fast in his Character Sheet (if it's not already the case).

Else, if it doesn't feel like tennis, maybe it's because you didn't understand how to hit the ball and aim your strikes ? To do so, be sure to keep the strike button pressed when you hit the ball and aim correctly to the left or right before hitting the ball.

If you tell me more about what's wrong for you, maybe I could help you more... :-)

[h3]EDIT December :[/h3]
You played 30 hours since you have posted your review.

Are you sure you still don't enjoy the game ?

author: {'steamid': '76561197969906656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1116, 'last_played': 1620562290}
review:
An incredible tennis game.  Lots of competitions and a great career mode.  Great customisation.  You don't need fancy visuals to create a great tennis sim.  If, like me, you not actually good at these games, you can have some success (difficulty settings quite customisable too.)
Reminds me of old 8-bit tennis games which where on the Commodore Amiga.  Visually Tennis Elbow is better than those but it's the core of the game that appeals.  Worth it!

author: {'steamid': '76561199054299720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 136706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68745, 'last_played': 1644256295}

author: {'steamid': '76561198305377282', 'num_games_owned': 823, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1693435246}
review:
I've only played this game .4 hrs, but I can definitively say that this is the best tennis game I've ever played in my life.  The feel is such that you needn't worry a lot about timing the stroke as the program swings the racket for you with proper timing.  So the technique consists of two parts:  one, you have to get positioned properly (footwork is probably the most important part of striking a ball in real life, too.  I, by the way, am an avid player in real life.)  Once you get your avatar in the proper position, you can then choose an 'A' swing or a 'B' swing (which is basically bottom or topspin).  I guess you could neglect to choose an option and then it would hit with a flat stroke.  Once the button is pressed, your joystick then aims the ball.  So basically you're focused on the actual strategy of tennis.  Like really trying to feed off the pace of the ball, there's a certain psychological flow to tennis that this game grasps at and basically achieves.  Of course it could be better (and this company seems to be striving toward perfection).  The game is great.  I'm going to buy the rest of the franchise when I can afford it.  I'm embarrassed that this was on my wishlist for so long.  It had gone on sale a few times...since I had Tennis World Tour in my library, I figured it wasn't worth the money.  Man, I was wrong.  This game is so much better than TWT!  And I don't work for this company so you can believe me!  I got this game for 50% off, but I kinda wish I paid full price just to help out this company.  You won't hear me say that very often.
  Let's be honest:  most tennis games suck.  This one doesn't because they don't force you to do frustrating things like time a stroke--some programs make that simple task so difficult that it is not consistent and basically just frustrates you, in the end.  Rather, this feels like you're in an actual point in terms of the psychology and the actual mechanics of tennis.  It's great!  Truly a fun tennis program!  Go figure.
I say that last thing because I have kinda concluded that tennis software isn't very lucrative and these guys are really working their butts off to make a great game for tennis fans and that says a lot about their company.  So I'm sorry for being so broke in life and waiting so long.  If I had more money, I'd gladly pay full price for your entire franchise to help you guys out.  I hope this review has a commensurate effect.  Good day, sirs!   :)

EDIT:  Upon reading my own review, I think it bears saying that I was incorrect when I said, "[they work assiduously] to make a great game for tennis fans..."  That's the problem--only tennis fans are buying this game because their numbers are less than they deserve.  I should have said that they were working hard to make, "a great game for tennis fans and 'non-tennis' fans alike..."  For those who aren't into tennis, this game, I think, would still be fun for kids to play every now and then for brainless "pong" type fun.  To them, it probably just looks like hitting the ball back and forth, at first.  But once they master drop shot, cut, topspin, serve/volley, etc. they will start to understand how pace dictates play and how fun it is to know how to change pace by changing the direction of the ball, which lends itself at certain times, depending on the angle in which you're hitting the ball and the degree of difficulty one faces when attempting the shot.  That's not how I wanted to say it.  Here's how I wanted to say it:  It's wicked fun making your opponent run back and forth because you control the pace and then slam the ball down an open court because you dominated the point from start to finish.  It's wicked fun!  And this game captures that spirit.  That's why it gets such good reviews.  And non-tennis fans can learn to appreciate that, if they figure it out.  I honestly believe that this specific game will encourage  non-tennis players to organically BECOME TENNIS FANS.  I can totally see where a kid learns this game and truly learns tennis PACE (which makes tennis really fun and interesting)...and then they'll watch the pros on TV and will understand what they're doing.  I honestly believe that this game will appeal to non-tennis gamers and it will actually make them fans of the sport (at least to watch it on TV, if not play it in real life for those who are able).

author: {'steamid': '76561199012177058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 2805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2805, 'last_played': 1600058017}
review:
El mejor juego/simulador de tenis, que ha habido y que va ha haber hasta que exista una compañía que entienda como mierda se hacen juegos de tenis decentes.
Recomiendo bajar los mods para disfrutarlo y jugar con los jugadores de tenis actuales en la cual la comunidad de Tenis Elbow actualiza los movimientos constantemente. Lo mismo sucede con las canchas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060454431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1685487928}
review: the best tennis sim in existence

author: {'steamid': '76561198131669259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 9992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 130, 'playtime_at_review': 2906, 'last_played': 1712252308}
review:
Un juego donde el tenis es lo importante y no los graficos como AO2 o TWT con una jugabilidad arcade mediocre y sin sentido.
Con los MODS de la comunidad lo hacen aun mejor incluyendo jugadores reales con sus aminaciones, sonidos, aspectos y modelos de vestimenta y raquetas. Tambien las canchas del circuito atp, copa davis, challengers, entre otras.

Exelente juego de Tenis independiente hecho con pasión y conocimiento del deporte! 

English:

A game where tennis is the important thing and not the graphics like AO2 or TWT with mediocre and pointless arcade gameplay.
With the community MODS they make it even better by including real players with their animations, sounds, skins and clothing and racket models. Also the courts of the atp circuit, davis cup, challengers, among others.

Excellent independent Tennis game made with passion and knowledge of the sport!

author: {'steamid': '76561198262247283', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4340, 'last_played': 1680470212}
review: When you have the skill level set to Junior, your service stats set at 80% of max, the controls figured out, and you're consistently hitting close to the lines on lots of your first serves, and yet you're only getting between 0 and 2 aces in a best of three match against a John Isner analogue, you know that this game has a problem with balance. Just one problem in a sea of issues that I see. Everyone is just too fast and too consistent; the player character included tbh
developer_response:
Hello,

I just did a test against a Junior-10 player with 75% in speed and 80% in all my service skills, and on my 1st try, I did 6 aces out of 11 serves.

Also, I basically didn't play the game for 5 years so I was a bit rusty and likely could have hit 1 or 2 more... :-p

Here the .dmo to see that : 
mega   .nz/file/4ssDXJIK#dktC01EOSmiXBl9sWOtDPqIBdQLZjyWLOVpI1O_-FAU
(remove the space after mega)

Anyway, if you'd like to hit more aces without being better at timing your aiming, change this line in your Tennis.ini (or your Profile .ini if you have created one), under [Game], from :
AiSlowerReturner=	0
to :
AiSlowerReturner=	0.1
(or more)

Or you can also modify the speed all of CPU players and optionally yours ; to do so, check here : https://www.managames.com/Forum/viewtopic.php?p=94280#p94280 .

I hope it helps ! :-)

And if you have any other issues, don't hesitate to let me know and I'll try to help you.

[h3]EDIT December:[/h3]
Did you try my tips ?
Do you need anymore help ? :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198034039871', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 40053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34047, 'last_played': 1696174855}
review:
The gameplay itself is very good. The single player as far as I remember is good.

But the multiplayer is very disappointing because:
1) Has a very very low playerbase. 
2) Literally at least half the players can't host a game because of port issues.
[strike] 3) There is no auto refresh for the available online games list, you have to refresh manually every time. [/strike] FIXED BY THE DEV RIGHT AWAY


Wouldn't recommend it for playing multiplayer because of the problems above, but if you enjoy single player then it's a great Tennis game to play, mechanics are very good.
developer_response:
Hello,

I'm sorry you have issues with my game. Let me try to help you. :-)

1) Putting a thumb down won't help much with that ; quite the opposite actually... ;-)

2) You'll find here all the tips I know to forward your port : https://www.managames.com/Forum/topic8-9923.php

You'll find specific instructions for TE2013 here : https://portforward.com/tennis-elbow-2013/ (ignore the extra ports for the Steam version, though, as TE2013 doesn't use any Steam stuff).

I played TE2013 with more than 10 different routers, and I have always been able to host. It's only a matter of figuring out your router configuration, which is indeed sometimes really not easy, but unfortunately it's not something I have control on.

3) If you want, I could add an auto-refresh button, but if you find the way to host, it won't be needed anymore... :-)

--- I hope it helps ---

author: {'steamid': '76561198381452054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 23212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17084, 'last_played': 1664302023}
review:
Génialissime ! 
Biensûr des défauts comme l'aspect graphisme, un peu de rigidité lors des déplacements (par exemple quand on se fait lober et qu'on doit courir pour rattraper la balle en fond de court). 
Un jeu incroyablement réalisme de part son gameplay, et ses mods qui font rendent le jeu réaliste par ses gestes copié collé sur les grands joueurs.

Je ne peux que conseiller. Foncer ! 
Super jeu !
Bravo au dev qui travaille seul, et qui a une fabuleuse vision de ce qu'est le tennis.
Bonne continuation à lui, et vous, foncez l'acheter !

author: {'steamid': '76561198136679992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 62632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7, 'playtime_at_review': 40320, 'last_played': 1711557048}
review:
Best tennis game ever. My 600+hours for playing with AI alone. Compare other tennis game AI is best one. They not easy to read or have same pattern, they not mindless hit left and right every single shot like most other game I play. They don't read you mind and run before you actually hit like Virtual Tennis game. 
It challenge but fair and have a lot level to choose so you can slowly raise difficulty.

Gameplay was so realistic.I like that hit the to same direction is okay to do like real tennis, when most game I play is very punishing to do. There are slice, top spin, lob, drop, accelerated shot and all of them have the moment to use.I'm recommend to mapping button with controller, IMO default one is quite weird and hard to play.     

For best experience you should install mod for real player and court. So on top of best gameplay you get a lot of players that already modded their motion and sound like real one. In Career mode you can create new one or play existing player. And is not feel empty, there actual players you known everywhere which is possible because dedicated modder that bring so much players in this game not just a few famous one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198361246059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1687417970}
review:
Pros:
+One of the best tennis games out there.
+You can change a lot of settings on the characters.
+You can save mid-match, which not many tennis games allow you to do.
+You receive a very detailed log for each match you play, very nice for tennis fans.

Cons:
-Wish it had an easier GUI, it was confusing to configure a controller and to adjust the game settings.
-Wish it had more preset players to choose from in order to get used to different playstyles.
-It doesn't allow you change difficulty, it can change depending on how you play, but still wish you could adjust it.

This is probably the best tennis game out there, but it still has a lot of room for QoL improvements, it also takes a while to learn but when you get used to the game, it's excellent. Highly recommended for tennis fans, recommended for anyone who just wants to have some fun.
developer_response:
Thanks for your review ! :-)

Here a couple of tips :

1) You can get the World Tour player into the Training Club by going to World Tour -> Resume Current Game -> Draw Sheets -> Ranking Boards -> Click the name of the wanted player to see his Activity Screen -> click his name again to see his Character Sheet -> Click on the top left icon "Save Player to the Training Club".
Optionally, you may want to first start a new game on a year when that particular player was strong.
And yes, it's a very convoluted way to do that ; in TE4, I'm planning to add a menu within the Training Club's Character Sheet, so it'll be much easier to do it..! :-)

2) To change the difficulty level of your opponent in the Training Club, go to Training Club -> Character Sheet -> Click on the top right arrow to see the 2nd player, then change his difficulty level under the 3D player (it's done like this so you can play doubles with a partner having a different level than your opponents)

author: {'steamid': '76561198068258733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1624118991}
review:
Jogo excelente. Pode não ter gráficos maravilhosos mas a jogabilidade é impecável. 

A configuração dos controles que vem por padrão não é muito intuitiva, mas serve pra ter uma noção inicial do jogo. À medida que vamos jogando vamos identificando nossas necessidades e conseguimos mudar os controles para algo que se adapte ao nosso estilo de jogo.

Quanto à jogabilidade, posso dizer que simula fielmente o tênis da vida real (digo isso como um praticante da modalidade). Inclusive dá pra aplicar as táticas do tênis da vida real e ter sucesso no jogo (e vice-versa).

review: Ótima jogabilidade, realismo e movimentação dos golpes, divertimento garantido, excelente jogo. Talvez seja criticado pelo visual gráfico muito simplório, mesmo assim, para quem gosta e entende de tênis, considero o melhor jogo disponível... Precisaria de atualizações mais frequentes na lista de jogadores e torneios (por exemplo, há torneios como Halle que ainda constam como ATP 250, quando, na verdade, já são torneios da classe 500). Para mim, o jogo fica realmente interessante quando você jogo o modo CARREIRA na dificuldade máxima (INCRÍVEL), tomando o cuidado de reprogramar suas habilidades todas para 100% através de uma reconfiguração nos dados do sistema (isso pode ser aprendido no blog oficial do jogo).

review:
win10 , xbox コントローラーが動きません。

最初にport接続しているとcrush

キーボードでやるも、勝手に打ちます。
方向もコントローラーできませんでした。

マウスでゲーム内設定でJoystick1設定したり、
xboxコントローラー(steam)チェックを外しても動きませんでした。

※後日談あり
developer_response:
[h1]https://translate.google.com による日本語翻訳[/h1]

1）XBoxコントローラーの場合、2つの可能性：
a）ゲームを起動する前にコントローラーを接続してから、[コントロール]に移動し、プレーヤー1コントロールを「キーボード1」ではなく「ジョイスティック1」に設定します。ストライクにこの構成を設定することをお勧めします。https://www.managames.com/Forum/topic15-29252.php

b）代わりに、Steam入力システムを使用できます。 この場合、プレーヤーのゲーム内コントロールを（「ジョイスティック1」ではなく）「キーボード1」にしてから、「スチームコントローラー構成」画面で推奨構成「テニスエルボーシリーズ」を選択します（右クリック それを開くには、Steamライブラリのゲーム）、またはここから選択してください：steam://controllerconfig/760630/1754087404
次に、上記のリンクされた推奨構成を使用します。

2）プレーの場合：ボールを打つ前にストライクボタンを離さないでください。

---お役に立てば幸いです :-) ---

[h1]English[/h1]

1) For your XBox Controller, 2 possibilities :
a) Plug your controller in before launching the game, then go to Controls and set the Player 1 control to "Joystick 1" instead of "Keyboard 1", then it's recommended to set this configuration for your strikes : https://www.managames.com/Forum/topic15-29252.php

b) Instead, you can use the Steam Input system ; in this case, let the in-game controls of your player to "Keyboard 1" (instead of "Joystick 1") and then pick up the recommended config "Tennis Elbow Series" in the "Steam Controller Configuration" screen (right-click the game in your Steam library to open it), or pick it from here : steam://controllerconfig/760630/1754087404 .
And then use the recommended configuration linked above.

2) For playing : do not release the strike button before striking the ball.

--- I hope it helps :-) ---

author: {'steamid': '76561198099397862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 25472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22715, 'last_played': 1602278739}
review:
As a tennis player myself i can say that this is the closest thing to real life tennis. This is the best tennis simulation i've ever seen. Mechanics and shotmaking is really intuitive and realistic as you can play topspin drive, regular drive, dropshot, slice, short slice, slice lob, regular lob and even a banana shot. Also the big thing is the positioning. Like in real life no matter how good you can strike the ball, unless you're in position you can't make a good shot generally. When you're out of position accuracy of your shots are greatly reduced.

The only thing you might not like about this game in 2020 is its graphics but its ok. It was made by one guy as far as i know and you can always mod the game to enhance your experience. I would strongly recommend maxou mod for singleplayer (career mode) and ITST mod for online play.

I highly recommend this game to anyone who likes tennis (even if you don't really know tennis this game might make you a tennis fan). My score is 9/10

developer_response:
As you can see from the other reviews, Tennis Elbow 2013 is one of the best tennis simulations around, so of course for people liking tennis it's worth its price. And of course, if you don't like tennis, it's worth 0 buck so it's good you got refunded.

But is there any chance you could reconsider your review ? Penalizing forever the chances of success of the game because you should have never bought it in the 1st place is really a pity and even damaging to tennis fans around.

And there's already a video on the Steam Store page clearly showing the animations so if it's a show stopper for anybody, they can already decide not to buy the game.

Thanks in advance for your reconsideration. :-)

[h3]EDIT:[/h3]
Here your original review where you stated that "you don't like tennis". I think it's an important information to give to the possible readers, I'm not sure why you edited it out : https://imgur.com/a/7eEphat .

author: {'steamid': '76561198077153956', 'num_games_owned': 4302, 'num_reviews': 481, 'playtime_forever': 5288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5287, 'last_played': 1606373952}
review: Tennis Elbow абсолютно уникальный продукт, и дело даже не в том, что разработкой по сути занимается один человек, а в игре представлен весь профессиональный тур с чуть изменёнными но узнаваемыми фамилиями. Симулятор очень чётко передаёт сильные стороны, типы подач и поведение известных теннисистов на корте. Вдобавок вTennis Elbow реализован крайне удачно режим карьеры начинаешь с фьючерсов и постепенно поднимаешься до величайших достижений на турнирах Большого шлема. По сути к игре есть только пару небольших претензий - при полёте мяча в аут не срабатывает анимация удара, а ведь такие косяки часто бывают в матчах, второе - устаревшая графика, хотя сейчас и красуется надпись 2013 в названии симулятора, но на самом деле это чуть подкрашенная игра выпущенная 10 лет назад. Хотя чё я придираюсь к тому, во что наиграл почти 90 часов. Вдобавок ко всему игра занимает менее 100 Мб на жестком. Пожалуй, (с небольшими оговорками) лучший симулятор тенниса до сих пор. 9.0 баллов.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004456940', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1648711527}
review:
Nul selon moi, beaucoup trop dur à prendre en main même en installant divers mods afin d'améliorer la jouabilité et le gameplay ; je suis un grand fan de tennis mais ce jeu n'est pas fait pour tout le monde !  

Un jeu, c'est fait pour s'amuser et ce "jeu" ne m'a donné aucune sensation positive ou de plaisir.
developer_response:
J'ai discuté avec Xanys par email ; voici quelques précisions pour les potentiels lecteurs :

1)  Aucun mod n'améliore la jouabilité ; un Mod change le gameplay (ITST, pour jouer online), et beaucoup d'autres améliorent l'immersion avec de nouveaux graphismes, courts, sons, animations, etc.

2) Pour bien apprendre les bases, il est conseillé de mettre l'ordinateur sur Débutant, et dans la feuille de personnage de son joueur, il faut régler la Preview sur Tout + Zone de Danger + Visée (si ce n'est déjà fait), et ensuite pratiquer une heure ou 2 en mode échauffement jusqu'à ce qu'on maîtrise bien les déplacements et les différents coups

3) Il faut également mettre l'auto-positionnement sur Rapide (toujours dans la feuille de personnage), surtout si on ne sait pas bien jouer au tennis en vrai

4) Des personnes âgées et handicapées s'amusent au jeu depuis des années, donc même si on n'est pas très dégourdi, c'est possible de prendre du plaisir avec TE2013, à partir du moment où on prend le temps d'apprendre les contrôles :-)

5) Lire la documentation peut bien aider aussi : https://www.managames.com/tennis/doc/Tennis_Elbow-Jeu_de_tennis.html#comment

author: {'steamid': '76561198313966474', 'num_games_owned': 8, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 52494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1537, 'last_played': 1705070903}
review:
I have to say the physics of this game is one of the best in tennis games. But here are some problems of this game that strongly affect my gaming experience:
(1) The operation feeling of pvp and pve is way different. No matter how long you practice by yourself, it doesn't help you form the correct muscle memory at all in pvp mode.
(2) The slice is too effective in this game. It happens frequently that the ball bounces twice within the court even the opponent doesn't want to produce a drop shot. Horrible design.
(3) The pvp is just a serving competition. Once you serve good enough (which is not difficult), it's impossible to break. You don't have many chances to rally in pvp, which is very unsatisfactory. It's necessary to weaken the serving.
(4) The AI is sometimes irrationally strong, doing much human being can't do, making you helpless. Like returning 210 kph serve on the line for 3 times consecutively; like every shot in a rally hits the line; like hitting a counter shot at a impossible position; and of course, never UE... This is a big problem of any ball game, the AI should have some reaction time. We want to play with strong AIs, but we don't like playing with aliens. They shouldn't be much stronger than real Djokovic, Nadal, Federer...
developer_response:
I'm sorry you don't enjoy my game.

Here a few tips that will hopefully help you to enjoy it :

1) The gameplay works exactly the same offline & online, with 2 big exceptions :

a) when you stop to push left/right for aiming, online there's a delay before the aiming zone starts to move back to the center. Doing so, even offline, is considered a mistake because the aiming zone comes back very fast to the center, making your aiming very inaccurate. So you should learn to never stop to release left/right before hitting the ball. Then you'll have an identical feeling online & offline.

b) Your very last instant shots may not be detected ; ie: if you play with a 50ms Delay, then during the last 50ms before hitting the ball, your button press won't be detected. So it's best to play with people near you to have the lowest Delay possible. I think it's a small price to pay to avoid teleporting players and/or unconnected ball hits like in other tennis games.

All is explained here : https://www.managames.com/tennis/doc/Tennis_Elbow-Tennis_Game.html#OnlineGameCreation

2) If you have an issue seeing the length of your opponent strikes, you should play with the impact preview or the Danger Zone. If you already have them, then don't stand too far from the baseline.

3) To get aced less, I quote from the tips here : https://www.managames.com/Forum/topic8-6180.php
[quote]a) turn on the Service Preview (in your Character Sheet) to know where the ball will land, and even the Danger Zone, so you'll have an idea of its speed and effect
b) if like me, you have poor reflexes on the return of serve and get aced like a turtle glued to the court, this tip should greatly help you : press the button down so the auto-positioning will be activated, and as soon as your opponent will serve, your player will begin to move slowly to the left or the right ; for me, it gives a great visual stimulation to which I react about 2 times faster than to the Danger Zone display ; depending of your own reflexes, it may be helping or not ; me, before I was aced about 1.5 times per service game, and after that, only 0.5 times / service game
c) instead of using the auto-positioning trick, you can try to do little left-right steps : it'll give you a little speed bonus ; but it raises the chances to be caught of the wrong step, so don't do too big left-right moves
d) Try change the distance you stand from the baseline ; go farther if you're close, and vice-versa ; the position you'll be the most comfortable depends on your reflexes & own preferences[/quote]
And if it's still not ok, play in Fair mode instead of Realistic mode, so services will be slower and you'll need a bit fewer reflexes.

Alternatively, you could also play with the ITST Mod, that provides a different gameplay experience, including a bit slower services (IIRC) : http://www.intertopspintour.net/forum/viewtopic.php?f=1047&t=19053 .

4) You don't tell at what level you play against the AI. If it doesn't do any error, I'd guess it's at Incredible level. In that case, you could lower its level and play with lower skills for your player, it'd produce a more realistic result.

The goal of the Incredible level is to give a challenge for the best players, not to be realistic. Pro-10 is the most realistic level (up to Master-5 or even 10 if you tune some parameters in your Tennis.ini ).

Alternatively, you can change your Controls to Elite. This will make you do more errors, as well as the CPU. Overall, this control mode is more realistic for experienced players.

---

I hope it helps. :-)

review:
This is by far the best tennis game on the market. I've been playing tennis games since the old NES days and was a HUGE fan of Top Spin. As that series has now tanked and the newest renditions are absolute trash, it's refreshing to see at least one developer making quality tennis simulations. Please, if you're a fan of tennis, do yourself a favor and play this game. Also, if you really want this game to shine, I recommend downloading the ITST mod. You won't regret it.

~~~Rally On~~~

developer_response:
Hello,

what is your issue exactly ?

If it's with the gameplay, there's a lot of options to tune the game to your liking.

If it's about content, I can recommend you to check the Mods ; you might find something picking up your interest here : https://www.managames.com/Forum/forum29.php .

So give me some details, and I'll try to help you. :-)

[h2]EDIT :[/h2]
As you can see from the other reviews, TE2013 is likely the best tennis simulation on the market ; however, it takes a bit of time to learn its controls and enjoy the game ; according to your Steam stats, you even didn't do 1 single step on the court, so that's rather strange. Did you play in Steam offline mode ?

author: {'steamid': '76561198207835595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1604674015}
review:
Edited after developer's reply. Some criticisms moved to the bottom as they are no longer relevant, so that anyone who's reading developer's reply would understand the context more. Any new comment will be marked as "new". Most comments remain the same.

TLDR: Amazingly realistic tennis game for any tennis lovers. Well worth the price. Use the Maxou MOD. Developer is great.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I have been a passionate tennis player for 10 years and this is by far the most realistic tennis video game I have ever seen / played in terms of the positioning, timing and strategy. Everything matters here just like in real life; the realism makes hitting a good shot to get out of a bad situation satisfying, making silly mistakes frustrating. I clap in real life to applaud my opponent when I lose to a good shot - this is how realistic it feels. Also, any tennis lover would sincerely appreciate the realism in the different hitting styles the game shows, although ultimately I believe these do not relate to the stats - you can hit a ground stroke with continental grip and still generate tons of top spin if your stats are right, so to speak.

Overall, this is  the best tennis game that has ever existed imo. It gives you the feeling of playing tennis and you have to respect how the control is on a gaming platform. I trust that once I get used to the mechanism on volley and player movement it will be all fine, ultimately no game can be exactly like controlling your own body. And this is what the game is all about - understanding how it plays and improving your skills.

Graphic is quite bad and you won't find you favourite players here, but the mods solve most of the problems. Some players might want more "gaming" features like "super power shot" or mini-games and they won't find it here - this is tennis and that's it.

Another good thing I like is the difficulty setting has many sublevels - I don't even know how many - but everyone will find one that fits their level.

Bottom line: amazing game for anyone who wants a game that feels like real tennis. If I knew how the game plays before buying, I'd happily pay $30 USD for it, $45 if it has funnier game modes to add some variety. Creator of the game seems to be a very hands-on nice guy too.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
New comment:
Tried the Maxou MOD recommended by the developer. Movement feels way more fluid than the ITST MOD I was using, certain balls you can actually chase them like Murray / Nadal etc., and you get way less ridiculous wrong foot (see my original criticisms for context). Volley seems to feel better also somehow. Another thing I like is the "winner speed" they show in this MOD. I have no complaints about the controls so far because this MOD solves all the problems I had.

This MOD is last updated in Dec2016 so the graphics aren't as good as ITST's, and the sound when you hit the ball is quite bad to be honest. You can very likely improve these if you MOD harder but I don't bother to yet.

I typed a long whining section about players' stats in this MOD as a joke but it ended up being longer than the whole review - just make sure you check and tweak the stats to your liking - Monfils' speed is 61 and Murray is extremely OP - with overall 90+ stats in FH, BH, Serve and Fitness. Some players (i.e. Tomic) shouldn't exist anymore but you can keep them around with all stats at 1 as a joke.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Original comment on the Mod I used:

The mod I've downloaded (ITST) gives the latest ATP players with updated stat & clothes, but it made it impossible for me to play career mode and doubles or connect with any other player so I can't say much about those things. Another small complaint with this mod is my Federer does his first serve with a backhand grip which probably explains why I keep losing against Djokovic and why my eyes bleed so much lately.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Original criticisms:
One downside for me is the lack of clarity in how the timing of clicking each button interacts with each other - e.g. does holding the button longer when serving change anything? What about the time you click the shot button? Does it matter whether you click up / left first, or together, or release one before another? It's intuitive to pick up the game, but when things happen you're not sure whether it's due to the minute differences in your control or RNG. This makes improving your skill in the game harder than improving in real tennis. The most reliable thing you can do to improve is better positioning and choosing better shots. This leads to a big issue for me in playing volley since nothing I do seems to give me a high quality shot, and I get frequently passed by shots that are fast but clearly within my striking zone. My only net points won are when I seriously drive my opponent out of the court - I have less confidence in my volley than when I'm playing volley against three opponents in real life which I hate because volley is one of my favourite elements in tennis. Arguably though, this lack of clarity creates certain "superstitions" as to how you click what buttons would create different effects, which I occasional find enjoyable...because sometimes feeling what you've done means something is more important than it actually working.

Another control-related issues for me that I dislike the most is the mechanics behind player movement. I believe the main basis of movement here is momentum, considering how you start very slow and run faster the longer you keep going towards one direction, and very difficult to go to the opposite direction; this is realistic in terms of how you can get wrong-footed and how you can chase balls. The issue is the game doesn't differentiate your first step with other steps. Any tennis player would know how split step allows you to jump start your motion, or very quickly shift your body weight to the opposite direction (e.g.shifting your weight to your left foot then jump to your right hand side for a forehand). This does not exist in the game, which makes change of direction unrealistically unforgiving - you step to the left by 1mm but the difficulty in going back to the right side is as if you have been sprinting to the left - and I got aced by 2nd serves quite a few times because I try to split step and "adjust my balance". To be fair this is likely caused by my mental habit of leaning left and right in real life and the movement buttons represent actual movements instead of shifting balance. Still, it would be ideal if these mechanisms can be included, or create a sprint / jump button so that sudden change of direction is possible, even though punishing.
developer_response:
Hello, I'm going to try to answers the questions raised in your review. :-)

0) But 1st a little disclaimer : the ITST is a very nice Mod, but it changes a bit the gameplay and thus some things don't work exactly as I intended them to do ; I don't know it well enough to tell you this or that exact point is because of the ITST Mod, but it might be worth to try out the game without it to check it doesn't do better in some of the points you have exposed.

I can recommend you the Maxou Patch instead which does the same thing, but for the World Tour instead of the online mode (so you can't play online with it), but without the gameplay changes (except maybe for a few courts, as each one has its own physics parameters).

1) So the main thing to understand how works the game (especially at the net!) is to play in the Training Club -> Warm Up mode, after have activated the Danger Zone and the Aiming Preview through your Preview setting in your Character Sheet.

2) Like this, you'll see that the earlier you prepare your strike, the more accurate it gets and also the longer or shorter, depending on the type of strike

3) You'll also easily see that aiming left/right too early will send the ball out, and that releasing left/right makes the aiming zone quickly comes back to the center of the opposing court, so it's better to time your aiming so you never release left/right before striking the ball

4) The service works in a similar way for the aiming, but there's no accuracy involved, so pressing the strike button early or late doesn't influence the quality of your serve

5) The documentation explains also all that and many other things : https://www.managames.com/tennis/doc/Tennis_Elbow-Tennis_Game.html

6) The game does consider your 1st step, and gives it a boost ; moreover, doing left/right will also gives you a little speed boost like it does in real life (ie: your player will convert some of his speed to the right when starting to go to the left) ; but you have to do it really very softly, because if your speed is above the maximal convertible speed then you'll get wrong-footed as you have noticed (IIRC, this is where it might feel the most different in ITST from the original game)

7) Your connection issues are likely not because of the ITST Mod, but because of your router or your firewall requiring some configuration (check the doc for more info, and here for a few tips: https://www.managames.com/Forum/topic8-9923.php )

8) And if you have other questions, I'm usually around ! ;-)

PS: thanks for the recommendation ! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198067353487', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5511, 'last_played': 1640243549}
review:
One of the most authentic and addicting experiences you can have on Steam if you enjoy the sport. 

Ultimately this is a game that is very playable from the start but has a very high ceiling for mastery. There are sliders that allow for fine tuning to get the game to a place that is very comfortable but remains challenging. 

If you can get past some of roughness of the interface / player models (mods help with that), you are in for a treat. The CPU does not cheat. There is no court tilt where the opposing player gains speed out of nowhere to hit a questionable ball. The rallies do not go 30-40 strikes long. Aces are very doable. Every play and every strike makes sense when you replay it and I greatly respect that. 

Every player [i]plays[/i] like they do in real life. You have to handle the craftiness of Federer, the relentlessness of Nadal and the fortitude of Djokovic. It can be downright tense but ridiculously rewarding when you pull out that big win.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098291592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2280, 'last_played': 1600639435}
review:
Ótimo jogo, grande trabalho! Parabéns aos desenvolvedores. Para quem ama o esporte como e procura um jogo para passar horas e construir sua uma carreira desde as dificuldades até a ascensão como um profissional da elite do esporte, eu recomendo o Tennis Elbow 2013. O jogo possui uma jogabilidade fluída e uma ampla variação nos estilos de jogo do seu jogador. Você pode construir qualquer tipo de jogador e explorar isso dentro do jogo, além de uma dificuldade que não deixa o jogador frustrado por a IA ser muito forte e nem entediado por ela ser burra demais. Mais uma vez, parabéns para os desenvolvedores!

Great game, great job! Congratulations to the developers. For those who love sports like and are looking for a game to spend hours and build their career from hardship to the rise as a professional in the sport's elite, I recommend Tennis Elbow 2013. The game has fluid gameplay and a wide variation in your player's playing styles. You can build any type of player and explore it within the game, in addition to a difficulty that does not leave the player frustrated by the AI being too strong or bored by it being too stupid. Once again, congratulations to the developers!

[h1]通过https://translate.google.com 在线翻译[/h1]

如果看不到球，则在比赛中按“ Escape”键，然后单击“ Options”，然后可以在其中更改“ Ball Size”。

如果需要，请点击以下列表：https://www.managames.com/tennis/doc/Tennis_Elbow-Tennis_Game.html#strikes 。

在播放器的“Character Sheet”中，您可以激活“Preview”以查看球将降落的位置。

似乎您现在正在享受游戏，因为您已经玩了很多游戏。 您是否有可能重新考虑您的建议，并将其从红色拇指向下更改为蓝色拇指向上？ :-)

[h1]English[/h1]

If you can't see the ball, press the 'Escape' key during a match, then click on "Options" and there you can change the "Ball Size".

If you need it, here the strike list : https://www.managames.com/tennis/doc/Tennis_Elbow-Tennis_Game.html#strikes .

And in the "Character Sheet" of your player, you can activate the "Preview" to see where the ball will land.

[b]EDIT:[/b]
It seems you are now enjoying the game, as you have played it a lot more. Any chance you could reconsider your recommendation, and change it from a red thumb down to a blue thumb up ? :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198822986863', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 14948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9523, 'last_played': 1616200698}
review:
Juegazo de tenis, los golpes están muy bien implementados, te da la sensación de estar jugando partidos reales. No es perfecto, algunas veces las mecánicas fallan y sus animaciones son bastante flojas, la mas evidente es cuando los tenistas retroceden, se convierten en marionetas. De base no es un juego atractivo pero después te acostumbras y se disfruta mucho. Hay que tenerle paciencia porque no te engancha a la primera. Probablemente el juego de tenis más completo que he probado hasta ahora.

Conclusión:
⭐⭐⭐/ 5
