review:
Alors pour où commencer les derniers jours j'ai essayé plusieurs jeux de tennis (AO tennis),(full ace tennis) et je n'ai pas accroché plus que ça alors je continue à chercher et je tombe sur celui-ci tennis-elbow 2013 oui je sais j'arrive un peux tard :) 
Et là je me dis mais il est trop vieux ce jeux mais vue le prix pourquoi pas essayé et là c'est la grande surprise je dois dire que je prends vraiment mon pied une simulation digne de ce nom chaque coup compte pour la gagne j'ai vu aussi que les graphismes repoussent pas mal de gens mais en cherchant un peu super Maxou et là pour un super mod 2016 qui change beaucoup de choses aspect graphique animation public et j en passe pour finir merci aux Développeur pour ce simulateur de tennis.
J'ai vu que TE 4 est en cours de développement je veux bien un liens pour le suivre et pourquoi ne pas faire une donation pour encourager le ou les développeurs.
developer_response:
Merci pour la recommandation ! :-)

Une petite note : ce n'est pas une donation pour TE4, mais une pré-commande qui donne accès au Prototype (qui arrivera très prochainement au stade de l'Alpha et bientôt de la version Anticipée) ; plus d'info ici => https://www.managames.com/Forum/topic15-31716.php (en Anglais)

author: {'steamid': '76561198186281959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 23518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17114, 'last_played': 1647821179}
review:
This is easily the best tennis video game I have played. The AI is much more realistic than TopSpin's AI, and the versatility of shots allows for more nuanced gameplay. The difficulty is incredibly scalable. If you want to be a superstar, you could win every match without dropping a point; if you're going for realism, you can easily have 1-2 hour grand slam matches that end in a heartbreaking 5th set.

I really enjoy this game, and I'll be on the lookout for any later editions of the series.

review: ¿Cómo meto la clave del juego?
developer_response:
[h1]=== Traducción en línea por https://translate.google.com ===[/h1]

Si el juego te pide una clave, es muy probable que no hayas instalado correctamente un Mod. Así que desinstálelo y luego vuelva a instalarlo siguiendo cuidadosamente las instrucciones de instalación.

Si necesita más ayuda, escriba un mensaje aquí: https://steamcommunity.com/app/346470/discussions/.


[h1]=== English ===[/h1]

If the game asks you for a key, it's very probably because you didn't install correctly a Mod. So uninstall it, and then reinstall it following carefully its installation instructions.

If you need more help, post a message here : https://steamcommunity.com/app/346470/discussions/ .

author: {'steamid': '76561198323899825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 49343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1059, 'playtime_at_review': 15914, 'last_played': 1712440977}
review:
Simply put, the best tennis game ever made*. 

The realism, the shots, the learning curve, the difficulty, the precision required to pull off each shot depending on your player's skill levels, is just off the charts insane. You can tell this was made by a passionate, hard-core tennis fan. 

People may complain that the graphics are bad (not what anyone really cares about) or that there are no real players (easily solved with mods) or that it's too hard. Guess what? It's meant to be hard. 

I hate tennis games where all you have to do is move back and forth on the analogue sticks like Tetris and press a button and your character magically hits the ball perfectly, or tennis games where you have to press a button at a specific time to get a perfect stroke, and those types of games are everywhere. Tennis is not about perfect strokes; it's about footwork and positioning -- and that's what TE 2013 does better than any tennis game from so-called triple A companies could ever do. 

The result is glorious gameplay when you understand how to position your character for the perfect connection. And when you do all that and move the AI around the court to hit the perfect winner, it's ecstasy. 

*We shall see if TE4 can live up to, or better, this gem of a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058366164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1565051674}
review:
[h1] Introduction	[/h1]
Tennis Elbow 2013 is, in my opinion, the most realistic, fun and polished tennis game on the market. The gameplay takes a bit of getting used to but once you get it you'll be going up against the likes of Federer and Nadal in no time.

[h1] Graphics 7/10	[/h1]
The graphics are a bit dated and were simplistic even when released but they do the job and can easily be improved by modding the game.

[h1] Sound 9/10	[/h1]
The sounds are top notch and really help with the immersion.

[h1] Gameplay 10/10	[/h1]
The gameplay is where this game truly shines. To me the most important part of the game is gameplay, it's the thing that keeps me coming back for more. The mechanics are absolutely perfect, the level of polish is truly astounding. When I play TE2013 I never feel like the game cheated me out of a point; when I make a mistake I always feel like it was my own fault. Similarly, when I score a point I feel the sense of achievement just like I would in real life tennis! So all in all the gameplay is engrossing, fun, rewarding and polished to absolute perfection.

[h1] Modding 10/10	[/h1]
As a bonus, this game is mod friendly and the community modders do an absolutely fantastic job of overhauling the graphics. I strongly recommend playing this game with mods, the developer even has a list of the most popular mods!

[h1] Support 10/10	[/h1]
The developer is extremely fast to respond to queries and suggestions, not only does he create these amazing games but he takes the time to reply to people, couldn't ask for a better developer or better support.

[h1] Conclusion	[/h1]
This is absolutely, undoubtedly the best tennis game available! But you don't have to take my word for it, the developer has released a demo for you to try out. Make sure you take the time to learn the controls as it does have a bit of a learning curve, but once you get it, you'll have a [b] LOT	[/b] of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198331541413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1564602620}
review:
I like this game, it is pure monotonous fun. The game play mechanics are put together well, but I play on a keyboard so i can't speak for joystick. 

The interface is bad. Considering this is a career game I would expect to see more than just prize money awarded (which has no effect on the game whatsoever). When in a tournament, the ability to return to screens isn't there either. In other words, the interface is pretty bad and hopefully TE4 will have improved on all the issues of this game. The game play itself, however, is in a league of its own. The mechanics involved in playing a match is fantastic. It's one of those give and  take deals, great tennis play, poor interface/hud. 

If this game were $10, i would be extremely happy with the game but the value is what gets me more than anything. This game is not worth $25. Plain and simple. 

For $25 you will be disappointed. I'm gonna keep playing cause i already got it, but i will be thinking the whole time, "man, $25 for this"

To be clear, this is not a negative review of the game. The examples i gave were simply to explain my reasoning for my thoughts on the value. I do recommend this game, but some folks might be better off waiting for a sale or a reduction in price
developer_response:
1) As you said, if you want management & other stuff to do in the career, you should be playing TEM2 ; TE2013 was made to easily play tennis :-)

2) During a match, press Escape -> Give Up -> Continue Later, and then you'll be back to the menus and you'll be able to resume your current match at any time

3) I'm really puzzled by your statement "It is no where near as in depth".

In TEM1, you can't play tennis. TEM2 is basically TE2013 + new physics + improved AI + TEM1 management with some improvements + new menu design + Junior Tour + new little QOL things.

So if you remove the management part of TEM2, you have almost the same depth of gameplay than in TE2013, except TEM2 is more realistic and AI is better ; am I missing something else ?

Also, TEM2 v1.0 has just been released, 6 years & a half after TE2013, and it's $30 instead of $25, so it's kinda expectable it's better than TE2013, at least in some aspects, no..? :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198066736216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 10215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10215, 'last_played': 1562879778}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046673074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1766, 'last_played': 1569246440}
review:
I remember playing one of the first iterations of Tennis Elbow years and years ago, and the game hasn't really changed all that much since its early days. The graphics are better and the animations are cleaner, but the gameplay has stayed pretty much the same. This is a good thing.

The game is designed to be played on keyboard, so play it that way. Positioning is everything, and you have to be in good position to play the ball properly. You can play just about any shot in the book using directional arrows and three keys, and you hold the shot-making key through the stroke, as if you're following through with the shot. 

Once you understand the combination of positioning, playing and directing the shot, you'll realise this is the order of things in real tennis. Set your feet, time the shot, direct it as you're striking the ball. That's when you'll stop thinking about the fact you're playing a game.

Make sure to go online and find the ITST Mod 1.19 for all the real players, animations, sounds and courts. Once you've got that installed, you have the best tennis game on the market for half the price of its competitors.

developer_response:
Online Translation : https://translate.google.com

Virtua Tennis games are arcade games. Tennis Elbow is a tennis simulation. It's normal you need more than 5 minutes to learn its controls.

But if you're a tennis fan, either in real or from TV, you owe to yourself to play Tennis Elbow some more till you can play it well, and then you'll know why so many people say it's the best tennis simulator out there..! :-)

There are several helpers to ease you into the game : the Aiming Preview and the Danger Zone are the most important ones, so be sure to set your Preview to see them both, and you'll have an easier time to learn the game.

review: INJOUABLE AVEC MA MANETTE X BOX POUR PC WINDOW
developer_response:
J'ai essayé de t'ajouter comme ami pour pouvoir t'aider au mieux, mais tu m'as bloqué.

Pourquoi refuses-tu mon aide ?

En plus, ce n'est pas très compliqué de faire marcher le contrôleur, je te remets les infos ici :

Si la manette ne marche pas du tout, alors il faut la sélectionner pour ton joueur dans le menu Contrôles -> Joueur 1 en réglant sur Joystick 1.

Si le jeu ne voit pas du tout ton contrôleur, tu peux jouer avec Steam Input (et donc laisser le Joueur sur Clavier 1 dans le jeu), et c'est Steam qui se chargera de faire marcher ton contrôleur automatiquement.

S'il t'est difficile de contrôler ton joueur, tu peux changer les contrôles pour mettre 1 bouton par coup et cela devient nettement plus efficace => https://www.managames.com/Forum/topic15-29252.php

N'hésite pas à me contacter si tu as besoin d'aide supplémentaire.

C'est quand même dommage de vouloir pénaliser les chances de succès de Tennis Elbow pour un problème qui se résout aussi facilement... :-/

author: {'steamid': '76561197963716185', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 30921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22893, 'last_played': 1686682199}
review:
Tennis Elbow 2013 ist eine sehr schön umgesetzte und Arcadige Tennis Simulation. Sobald man die Steuerung erlernt hat, spielt es sich sehr flüssig runter, gleichzeitig bleibt das Spiel immer herausfordernd, da sich jeder Gegner anders spielt und man die verschiedenen Schlagtypen gut kombinieren muss um langfristig erfolg zu haben. Kein Match ist wie das andere, so dass genug Abwechslung vorhanden ist.

Grafisch ist Tennis Elbow sehr altbacken und der Fokus liegt ganz klar auf dem Gameplay.  Kombiniert mit dem richtigen Mods kann man hier sowohl Online als auch Offline seine eigene Tenniskarriere erleben und eine Menge Spaß dabei haben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084504413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1602704096}
review:
Si tu aimes le tennis, tu vas te dire "mais c'est trop bien enfin on me comprend" il y a tous les circuits ITF, Challenger, ATP 250, 500, 1000, grand chelem et coupe davis! Incroyable !!
Tous les joueurs, les vrais nom sont disponibles en cherchant un simple mod !! Ca prend 3 clics, même les plus faignants vont y arriver.
Si  tu aimes le tennis mais également les bons graphiques, tu trouveras ça nul, donc tu es nul et la vie te décevra presque tous les jours. Car les graphismes c'est comme les femmes et les bons amis. 
Si tu aimes le tennis mais que tu n'aimes pas les jeux vidéos?? Pourquoi tu lis ça... Mets ton petit short préféré, demande 20 euros à maman pour te louer un cours et appelles ton ami Jean Martin de la Poutre pour aller faire une partie !

author: {'steamid': '76561198023891260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 7177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6810, 'last_played': 1630639809}
review: This is for tennis fans, by tennis fans. The depth of detail, from ball mechanics to gameplay simulations of real tennis, is a thing of beauty. It runs on virtually any system and the sheer magnitude of mods rivals Bethesda titles. The character models haven't aged well and the controls could be simpler, but if the word "Federer" isn't a misspelling of "fedora" to you, then this is a must-have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163443179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 254, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1573548554}
review:
I haven't played any other tennis games in the past, but it seems to me this game is the best in its genre. The feeling of the match is very authentic and the graphics are very good even if the game is quite old. You have a career mode and also training mode. You can customize the looks of your characters and various stats like weight, height, speed, etc but as far as I've seen you can't rename them. I might be wrong tho. The only bad looking graphics are the menus UI. They feel like they are from a 90's game at best and they are like a mood breaker but this shouldn't keep you away from having the best tennis fun.
If you like tennis this is the best game you can get on Steam at this moment.
developer_response:
Hello,

in the Training Club, you can change the name of your player by clicking on it.

in the World Tour, you cannot change your name ; you have to start a new Career and edit your name during the creation of your player (still by clicking on the name).

And thanks for the nice review ! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197996460955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1622588245}
review:
Straight to the point, fun, tennis game. It doesn't play like a TV broadcast, but a game with great pacing and good representation of the sport. I haven't played many tennis games, but one of my favorite games of all time is Top Rank Tennis for the original Game Boy because the gameplay was a lot of fun, with a good challenging arc.

Tennis Elbow isn't shiny, but when polished with the Maxou patch (follow the Becoming a Pro guide) is a blast. There are not enough good sports games on Steam, especially out of the racing genre. This was a great pickup on sale.

You can customize your player, start from a young player and work your way up. The Skill level sliders let you fine tune quite nicely for where you're at in your career. The AI adapts to your play even at the level you select, so change your shots! My game crashed right near a winning set, and reload remembered the spot where I left off. Phew...unless you like to quit to cheat :P

author: {'steamid': '76561197966896747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3131, 'last_played': 1629133199}
review:
I am not a tennis buff by any means but this game is still entertaining. I recommend the following way to get into it: first, play for a while with all the visual aids on, so that you get a feel on how the controls work; basically how and when you can make different shots work. After you have it down to a degree, switch the aids off. It's a hugely rewarding feeling when you manage to land tight shots just based on timing and positioning.

You can also play doubles with a friend, make sure to try that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023034399', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1652784853}
review: séduit par les nombreuses évaluations élogieuses j'ai voulu tenter le coup n'arrivant pas à trouver un successeur sérieux à top spin... ce jeux est une belle déception pour ma part... techniquement c'est totalement à la rue, les menus sont ignobles, la jouabilité contre intuitive... le joueur frappe automatiquement la balle si on ne fait rien juste en étant placé (coup safe),les touches permettent de définir le type de coup que l'on veut effectuer, par contre aucun timing n'est demandé. Laisser la touche appuyée va permettre de viser en déplaçant un curseur... difficile de décrire le gameplay tellement ça s'écarte des standards... en tout cas personnellement j'ai pas aimé...
developer_response:
Je pense que peu de monde a pu apprécier TE après seulement 30 minutes de jeu, justement parce que son gameplay est très différent des standards des jeux vidéo de tennis.

Et c'est bien justement pour cette raison que cela donne la meilleure simulation de tennis existante.

Si tu aimes le tennis, que tu le pratiques, ou que tu veuilles découvrir un peu ce que c'est d'être dans les chaussures d'un joueur Pro, je te conseille vivement de t'accrocher un peu, le temps de bien apprendre le gameplay, ce qui requiert facilement 3h à 6h de jeu, tu ne le regretteras pas..! :-)

En ce qui concerne le timing, taper la balle au bon moment n'est pas un problème pour un joueur Pro, donc la frappe est automatique dans TE.

Par contre, garder la balle dans le terrain n'est pas garanti, et là tu as une bonne dose de timing à apprendre pour réussir à viser proche des lignes sans faire la faute.

Une fois que tu seras familier avec la visée, c'est fortement recommandé de débrancher le curseur de visée, qui est là pour t'aider à apprendre les règles de précision, de danger et de visée.

Et le jeu a plein d'options pour configurer le gameplay selon tes goûts.

Si tu as des questions, n'hésite pas à me demander ! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198035024261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 57849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 212, 'playtime_at_review': 23168, 'last_played': 1712236341}
review:
This game is probably the best and realistic tennis game ever. I've played many tennis games INCLUDING top spin. If you mod this game, trust me it's worth it. I play this game in a daily basis.

Sure, the graphics is outdated. But the animations, realism and feel. Is spot on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005722195', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1657843821}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011033852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1557377044}
review:
Geez, this is a good tennis game. Granted, the last tennis videogame I played was maybe 25 years ago, and the last time I played tennis on an actual [i]court[/i] was just as long ago, but Tennis Elbow, like a lot of the other reviews say, really captures the lightning in a bottle of a real tennis match. Forehands, backhands, slices, lobs, serves, everything feels and sounds so damn good here. Extensive customization of your player is available, from clothing, skin and hair to the animations used for the different racquet strokes (a lot of which are modeled after famous players' moves, which is cool), so you can really individualize your little tennis dude or dudette, right down to what kind of scream/grunt/aneurysm you want them to have when serving or hitting a strong shot. All of that is superb.

The UI while navigating the menus is fairly bad. Well... no, it's really bad. (Use the keyboard & mouse for the menus, otherwise you're gonna get frustrated.) Same goes for the graphics. They aren't anything to write home about, but your view of the tennis match is by necessity a birds-eye view anyway, and besides, when the gameplay is this fantastic, who cares? Tennis Elbow nails two experiences simultaneously: the sounds and colors and excitement of watching Wimbledon or one of the Opens on TV and the breathless mental and physical game of tennis itself. Bonus: there's a decent modding community behind TE2013 as well, which you may want to check out as there are UI fixes and other goodies readily available.

Bit pricey, sure, so maybe wait for a sale, but it's absolutely worth it if you love tennis!

author: {'steamid': '76561198856927272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1691622291}

author: {'steamid': '76561198076670400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 40418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 76, 'playtime_at_review': 23694, 'last_played': 1712259843}
review:
Sans aucun doute le meilleur jeu de tennis sur PC auquel j'ai joué.
Très difficile à prendre en main, encore plus à maîtriser, les sensations en y jouant sont néanmoins très agréable et donnent l'impression de jouer au tennis. Le gros point fort par rapport aux Top Spin est qu'on peut faire des fautes plus facilement et même l'IA n'est pas épargnée. Je trouve par contre dommage cette énorme différence de difficulté entre les différents niveaux, et même les sous-niveaux n'y aident pas. Dommage aussi qu'il y ait autant de volleyeurs dans le jeu alors que dans la vraie vie c'est devenu rare.
Sinon, comme j'ai dit, un jeu très très sympa à jouer, qui demande de la patience et de la tactique. Manquerait plus que l'effet mental du joueur pour qu'il soit parfait.

author: {'steamid': '76561198221478960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 137801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38735, 'last_played': 1671204431}
review:
So, I've never really written a review before, so I'll just be giving my thoughts the best I can with this game, since it definitely deserves it1

The impression I got from most other tennis games I played, was that the ball striking had 'predetermined' results in a sense.. That the balls will land in 'certain' spots. However, the impression I get from Tennis Elbow 2013, is that there aren't these predetermined results. You can put any kind spin, curve, angle, and pace on the ball, and a combination of those all together, landing in any spot, if you're skilled enough! It has many opportunities of endless realistic, and entertaining matches and rallies.

Another thing that stands out to me with Tennis Elbow 2013 is the depth. The learning curve is huge in my opinion. If you wish to, you can always give yourself a hard match, no matter how good you are at the game. The difficulty selection of the AI is quite extensive! I'm not sure if it's even realistically possible to beat the max difficulty though, they seem a bit.. /too hard/!

I haven't done much of the multiplayer (there is multiplayer), so I can't comment on that particularly, but the career mode also stands out. The amount of tournaments, including on the pro level, the challenger level, and even the ITF level, is awesome. You can have a character start at the top, or work his/her way up from ITF level. It really is a a great career mode.

So yeah, would definitely recommend this game if you're into progressing a character through a career, or want to try out a tennis game. Definitely the most realistic one out there in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142182090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 14057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9872, 'last_played': 1694147789}
review:
The first couple days I had this game I was like "damn I should try to return this".  A week later I realized that it's the best tennis game ever.  Once you get the controls down, the rallies are easily the most realistic out there.  The game is not perfect, but it's close.  The graphics could be smoothed out a little, but they're actually pretty good.  The only thing that needs a lil help is the interface/menus, but that doesn't affect gameplay so I don't really care.  And this is a super-indie game that's over five years old, so considering that, it's quite an achievement.    

I was really excited about the two new tennis games that came out recently...the screenshots looked amazing.  But apparently they suck, which is a major bummer because it had been YEARS since a big tennis game came out (and if these new ones are bad and don't sell it will be another five years or whatever).  I couldn't bring myself to read the full reviews but I guess I should.  
 
Anyway if they do indeed suck It just magnifies how important this game is.  Those other companies should be taking notes.  Six stars.  I can't wait to see what Mana does next.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981411413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1560113723}
review:
Leicht zu lernen, schwer zu meistern las ich sinngemäß, und ich glaube das trifft es ganz gut. Ich habe noch nicht mal den umfangreichen Karriere-Modus ausprobiert, kann das Spiel aber bereits ruhigen Gewissens empfehlen. Ich habe ein Sportspiel gesucht, welches mir einen relativ leichten Einstieg bietet, nicht zu kompliziert ist, aber fordernd bleibt. Bisher bin ich sehr zufrieden. Da Spielgefühl ist recht unmittelbar, es ist nicht mit Tricks und Optionen überladen, vieles hängt vom richtigen Timing und der "Laufarbeit" ab. Ich spiele regelmäßig ein Trainingsspiel, und wenn ich deutlich gewinne bekomme ich Möglichkeit einen besseren Gegner zu bekommen, und so steigere ich mich Stück für Stück und habe immer eine Herausforderung. Irgendwann geht´s dann vielleicht auf Tour (hierzu gibt es auch umfangreiche Mods mit Originalnamen, Graphiken, Sounds etc.)

Grafisch ist das Spiel natürlich nicht auf der Höhe der Zeit, aber das stört mich nicht, solange das Gameplay stimmt. Ich empfehle einen Blick in die Demo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198221373032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 79722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47832, 'last_played': 1613875466}
review: Overall, this is a solid game that has definitely revived my passion for gaming in the past few years. As of right now, I currently have over 800+ hours on this game and I don't regret it at all, as crazy as that may sound. The gameplay is solid and always provides new challenges at varying difficulty levels and is easy to eventually get the hang of. There's always a play style for any type of player and a great variety of customization. Although many people might say this game is older, it sure does compete head to head with lots of the newer tennis games that have been coming out! A big plus to this game is that there's always someone to help out, including the developer of the game himself! When there's an issue, you can get a response very quickly and it's always super valuable information back, not some typical low quality customer service that most games and companies tend to give nowadays. Definitely worth the buy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198877609732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1675702306}

author: {'steamid': '76561198390460721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 17705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12389, 'last_played': 1661244900}
review:
Personally, I adore this game.
It is not my wish to offend that creators and people behind making this game possible, but for a modern-day game, it's sad for us tennis fans that this is the only tennis simulation game we can rely on to give us realistic rally patterns, immersive gameplay, variety in courts and surfaces and styles of play.

You can say what you want about the games poor graphics but the gameplay its self makes up for it. 

I think one of the best things about the game is, it's so different. I love the Top Spin series and Virtua Tennis series, I even loved playing SEGA Superstars Tennis, but in those games you had a similar pattern on how to win the game, this game is different. You don't 'beat the game' phersay, it's so much more of an accurate simulation that you can spend countless hours on. With Top Spin, Virtua Tennis and SEGA Superstars Tennis - you won the game and then you asked the question, what do I do now? Of course, the replay value on those games is pretty good, but with this game, even completing dozens and dozens of different matches in different tournaments with different players over and over and over again, didn't and still doesn't feel like you are replaying. It is a neverending source of entertainment and fun.

The controls are easy to master, if you're familiar with PC and keyboard, if not, there are options to incorporate controls if need be. There are wide amounts of options you can change which really help the game feel fresh and the fact that there is a new game coming out in the future is great news.

Another thing is the modding capability. The base game itself is good but doesn't really ever feel like it reaches it's potential - and that's where the expansive modding comes in. A fantastic patch to the game called the 'Maxou Patch' is incredible, if installed correctly. It really enhances the game from changing scoreboards to more modern and seemingly licensed graphics etc. There are always new add ons being made allowing you to really change almost every aspect of the game.

Conclusively, I adore this game and you will to. I guarantee you hundreds of hours of pure entertainment and excitement with this game. Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198864416492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1562155644}
review: poor quality graphics; no xbox controller support; stiff player movements
developer_response:
Hopefully, you didn't buy this game for its graphics quality, but for its gameplay..! :-)

So if you can't set up your Xbox controller, it's a big bummer, but it might be fixable. By default, the game uses DirectInput, but depending on your drivers, your controller may only support XInput. So to quickly activate its support, read here : https://steamcommunity.com/app/346470/discussions/0/350544272218350395/#c350544272221069962 .

To check it's working, go to the Controls menu and set the "Player 1" control to "Joystick 1" ; if everything is ok, then under "Joystick 1" you should see the name of your controller.

[h1]EDIT September 2019:[/h1]
I just set up a default Steam Input config for the XBox 360 & One controllers.
So if you prefer to use the Steam Input system, let the in-game controls of your player to "Keyboard 1" (instead of "Joystick 1") and then pick up the recommended config "Tennis Elbow Series" in the "Steam Controller Configuration" screen (right-click the game in your Steam library to open it), or pick it from here : steam://controllerconfig/760630/1754087404 .

You might still need to reconfigure in-game the strikes to your liking, though.

It's really a pity to penalize the game with your review, as it's easily fixable.

And if you need any more help or have any question, you can contact me, I'm around ! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198064106555', 'num_games_owned': 4616, 'num_reviews': 542, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1539708049}
review:
A very good Tennis Simulation. I played several arcade Tennis games before, especially the Virtua Tennis series by Sega and Mario Tennis - still a good Tennis game. 
Tennis Elbow definitely is the more tactical one without losing on the aspect of easy access. 

Check out my Let's Play: 

https://youtu.be/2YDtgnzsaJE

So you can play it in arcade-style as well as in simulation style.
Controller is very much recommended and well supported.
There is a massiv world championship series as well as online multiplayer support. 

I can recommend this game to beginners as well as to professionnel gaming Tennis players. Maybe even real Tennis players for some rainy days at home? Don't get yourself shied away by the age of the game and the surely aged graphics. The substance of the game is still up-to-date.

Recommended!

review: fix your fuckin game!!! the incredible difficulty needs to be reworked because any player you play against on that difficulty gets infinite fucking speed and its literally impossible to hit a winner... every other aspect of the difficulty is okay but i shouldnt have a 7 foot cunt running like usain bolt around the court retrieving all my shots..
developer_response:
The goal of the Incredible difficulty is to be ... Incredible..! ;-)

Or more exactly, it's to give a challenge to even the best players in the world, even if it's not very realistic.

If you want a big challenge, but more realistic, you can lower your own skills and play against the Pro or Master difficulties.

And thanks for your recommendation ! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198055837187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1531666476}

developer_response:
[h1]Online fordítás a https://translate.google.com weboldalon[/h1]

A játék képernyőképeit a Steam Store oldalon láthatja, tehát ha nem tetszett a látvány, akkor nem kellett megvennie a játékot.

Ugyanakkor javíthatja a látványt a Modokkal, például ehhez: https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=en&tl=hu&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.managames.com%2FForum%2Ftopic29-24824.php

A vezérlőkkel kapcsolatban magyarázza meg nekem egy kicsit, mi a baj veled. Ha van konzolvezérlő, akkor javasolom, hogy állítson be egy konfigurációt: https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=en&tl=hu&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.managames.com%2FForum%2Ftopic15-29252.php

Mint látható a Steam áttekintésből, a TE2013 nagyon elismert tenisz szimuláció, tehát érdemes kipróbálni egy kicsit, amíg megtanulja a vezérlőelemeket ? :-)

[h1]English[/h1]

You can see the game screenshots on the Steam Store page, so if you didn't like the visuals, you didn't have to buy the game.

However, you can improve the visuals a bit with Mods, for example this one : https://www.managames.com/Forum/topic29-24824.php .

For the controls, you should explain me a bit more what is wrong for you. If you have a console controller, I can recommend you to set a configuration : https://www.managames.com/Forum/topic15-29252.php

As you can see in the Steam review, TE2013 is a very appreciated tennis simulation, so maybe it's worth you try it a bit more till you learn its controls ? :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198347192228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1338, 'last_played': 1685835368}
review:
Je cherchai un successeur à TS4 que j'apprécie beaucoup lorsque je suis tombé sur Elbow 2013....
La prise en main est pas terrible au début, les fautes sont faciles du fait que la balle n'est pas assistée pour rester dans le cadre comme dans d'autres jeux de tennis où pour faire faute lors de l'envoi de la balle il faut faire fort. Une fois le gameplay maîtrisé le jeu reste assez fun.

Les + :
- Gameplay réaliste
-  ajout de MOD
- Ordi réglable au compte goute grâce aux niveaux et sous-niveaux
- Jeu en ligne 2P2 (pas de jeu en ligne pour Linux, dommage car il c'est mon système principal)


Les - :
- Déplacement dans le menu principal pas très ergonomique (du moins avec une manette)
- Mode carrière un peu "brouilon"
- Pas d'indicateur pour le service (un peu dommage quand on débute c'est bien utile de tout avoir)
- Arbitre manque de dynamisme dans sa voix en dehors des "Faute !" (qui d'ailleurs est énervant lors des services raté où la balle reste dans le filet; pas besoin de le signaler à chaque fois)

À part ça GG pour la qualité du jeu et bonne continuation pour les futurs versions.
developer_response:
Merci pour la recommandation !

De petites choses cependant :

1) Pour les annonces, tu peux les changer en "Réalistes" au lieu de "Toutes" dans les options Audio

2) Pourrais-tu m'expliquer un peu dans le Forum ce que tu entends par "Brouillon" pour le mode carrière ? Cela pourrait m'aider pour la future édition :)  => https://steamcommunity.com/app/346470/discussions/

author: {'steamid': '76561198008324896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 13247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1272, 'last_played': 1705756187}
review:
It's been a very long time now, since I felt that a game is worth a review, and furthermore a very, very positive one. But this game here, deserves all the praise.

I tested it a long time ago, when I was really into Top Spin 4, but back then, I didn't have the persistence to learn it. But after all those years, I got a little bored with Top Spin, and the disappointment of the recently released AO International Tennis and World Tour Tennis, brought me back to Tennis Elbow.

It took me a few days to find a good configuration for my gamepad, and a few more to master my first matches, but from there, I'm really astounished. I think I haven't played a lot of sports games which are as hard to master as this one, but once you're into the games mechanics, there's nothing more rewarding, but to play a hard fore or backhand winner straight onto the line. Well, the graphics and the sound aren't up-to-date, but this is something which is more than compensated by the great gameplay. There's also a big modding community, into which I haven't look ed much so far, because firstly i wanted to learn to handle the game.

If you are a tennis fan, looking for an alternative to Top Spin 4, give this one a try and don't let yourself be detered. Once you're into it, you can't stop to play and you want to become better and better and better.... ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198113862025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 298, 'playtime_forever': 795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1529105930}
review:
Si comme moi vous aimez bien le tennis sans que ce soit non plus une passion, et que Roland Garros à la télé vous donne envie d'un jeu dans cette discipline, Tennis Elbow 2013 soldé à 13€ me semble finalement un choix plutôt honnête et judicieux, même en 2018, et voici pourquoi :[list]

    [*]- Primo, n’étant pas spécialement fan de ce sport, je n’avais ni l’envie ni les moyens de débourser 50 balles pour un jeu de tennis prétendument à jour graphiquement. [i](Je pense à AO International Tennis  – qui est d’ailleurs loin d'être impressionnant avec ses visuels ternes et son gameplay initialement désastreux, qui ne devient peu à peu potable qu'à force d’être rafistolé à coup de patchs, mais sans que ça justifie son tarif exorbitant ni son état à la sortie.)[/i]

    [*]- Deuzio, je n’aime pas qu’un éditeur véreux se foute ouvertement de ma gueule. [i](Et là, je fais bien sûr référence à Tennis World Tour, qui OSE sortir alors qu’il n’est seulement qu’à environ 20% de son développement (de l’aveu même de BigBen https://www.lemonde.fr/pixels/article/2018/06/03/bigben-l-editeur-de-jeu-video-qui-aimerait-enfin-monter-en-gamme_5308944_4408996.html ), tout en balançant sans le moindre complexe du DLC day one alors que le jeu n’est donc même pas au quart terminé – et annonce en prime avec une transparence désarmante que la "réédition" du (même) jeu qui sera vendue l’année prochaine sera de bien meilleure qualité : trop pathétique pour mes petits nerfs sensibles).[/i]

    [*]- Troizio, Je n’ai pas de casque VR – ni la place qui va avec - pour jouer aux innombrables jeux généralement trop "cartoon" qui nécessitent cet onéreux accessoire de bourgeois. [i](First Person Tennis, TennisVR, Tennis Kings VR, Tennis arcade VR, Blobby Tennis; etc)…[/i][/list]

 Pour toutes ces raisons, il me restait deux options : Tennis Elbow 2013, ou Full Ace Tennis Simulator qui semble cool aussi (et plus récent).
Pour ma part, le côté axé simu du second & le prix soldé du premier ont fait pencher la balance, ainsi que le fait que Tennis Elbow [b]supporte les mods[/b]!
Et honnêtement, je ne regrette pas mon achat qui suffit parfaitement à satisfaire mon envie de taper agréablement quelques balles sans autre ambition que de me détendre.

Sans être spécialiste du genre, (je suis même plutôt une nullité d’ailleurs), je trouve que l’un de ses points forts est son gameplay à la fois précis et complet, qui devient assez vite agréable après le petit temps d’adaptation nécessaire.
Au bout de quelques matchs, on prend le truc : selon un timing qu’on assimile rapidement en passant par le mode entraînement, on se positionne par rapport au point d’arrivée de la balle, on MAINTIENT le bouton, tout en VISANT une zone,  et alors seulement, on RELACHE le bouton de tir. (Car si on ne fait qu’un appui bref, le jeu renvoie juste la balle défensive au centre du cour, mais sans visée).
Coup droit, revers, et lift peuvent bien-sur être tentés à différentes profondeurs de terrain, toujours selon l’inclinaison du stick vers l’avant ou l’arrière, et il est également possible de sprinter au prix d’un peu d’endurance.

J’apprécie particulièrement que le jeu soit très configurable dans plein de domaines… Des choses indispensables comme le nombre de sets ou la difficulté, mais aussi la prise en compte ou non de la fatigue, ou encore un choix de contrôles davantage axés "arcade" que "simu"… (le 1er ayant ma préférence, avec une zone de danger moindre, et une précision plus rapide, qui rend les échanges plus vifs & funs comme j'aime).

Visuellement, le jeu accuse clairement son âge : Les persos sont assez tartes, les animations sont datées, mais c’est surtout le design de l’interface hideuse et brouillonne qui pique le plus les yeux… Et pourtant, malgré ça, l’aspect visuel "fonctionne" encore à peu près une fois en jeu.
Et son indéniable aspect vieillot me semble nettement plus pardonnable que celui des jeux "récents" qui se permettent de tourner sur des moteurs pourris en se traînant encore visuellement une génération de retard.
En regardant les vidéos respectives de plusieurs jeux, on se rend d'ailleurs compte que bizarrement, aucun titre récent sur PC n’arrive à la SEMELLE de références comme Top Spin 4 (2011), Grand Chelem Tennis 2 (2012), ou même d'antiquités comme le très arcade Virtua Tennis 3 (2006), et ce, que ce soit en terme de gameplay, de contenu, d'animations, mais même sur le plan sonore ou [B]visuel !!![/b]
Et ça me semble particulièrement scandaleux.

[b]CEPENDANT, Tennis Elbow 2013 a eu le génie de s'ouvrir au mods, dont certains ont le talent de le rendre nettement plus joli ! (Un grand merci notamment à "Maxou" - son travail ici : http://www.managames.com/Forum/topic29-24824.php )[/b]

Alors bien entendu, le jeu n'est pas non plus parfait :[list]

    [*]-Comme je l'ai dit, le jeu de base est assez vilain sans modding
    [*]-Certains écrans sont en 4:3 et on se demande bien pourquoi vu que le jeu est en 16:9 le reste du temps...
    [*]-Le curseur de souris reste affiché pendant les matchs
    [*]-Certains bruitages d’applaudissements sont mal coupés en version vanilla
    [*]-Pas de jauge ni de visée pour le service...[/list]

Je ne m’acharnerai pas trop sur la customisation du personnage qui à défaut d'être géniale, a au moins le mérite d’exister et d'être assez complète.

L’ambiance sonore de base est correcte, contrairement (là encore) à celle de jeux de 2018. (Notamment Tennis World Tour, dont l’ambiance sonore est dramatiquement naze – sans parler des commentaires proprement risibles de nullité de Guy Forget…) Et en moddant le jeu, la qualité de l'audio augmente encore.

Bref, si il est loin d’être esthétiquement sexy en version "nue", ce vieillissant Tennis Elbow 2013 fait finalement très bien le taf une fois modifié - en tout cas pour ce que j'en attends personnellement.
Il propose un mode carrière hyper touffu (si j'en crois le nombre de terrains disponibles), du jeu en double, ou même en 1vs2, du tennis féminin, un paquet d’options, du multi local (y compris en double coop vs IA)… Vraiment complet donc.
Mais à mes yeux, son principal point fort est qu'il est fun à jouer, et généreusement moddable. (Le jeu propose d’ailleurs une démo pour se faire une idée et voir si on accroche au gameplay : très appréciable!)

Si comme moi, vous ne comptez y jouer que quelques heures le temps de faire passer votre trip "Roland Garros", je ne le conseillerai peut-être pas au prix fort. Mais vu la possibilité géniale de le customiser (et comparativement à ce que propose la concurence), eh ben je trouve qu'à 13 balles franchement ça le fait.

[b]MàJ : Les devs sont hyper à l'écoute, et ont corrigé un petit souci moins de 24h après que je l'ai signalé dans cette review! Ce jeu bénéficie donc encore d'un suivi assez exceptionnel, et pour ça aussi, je trouve que Tennis Elbow 2013 mérite vraiment notre attention.[/b]
developer_response:
Merci pour la recommandation !

Quelques précisions cependant :

1) TE2013 est une simu, mais avec des contrôles simples d'accès, mais qui demandent du temps à être parfaitement maîtrisés, ce qui fait qu'il convient aussi bien à des joueurs occasionnels comme toi, que des joueurs plus chevronnés

2) Il n'y a pas de charge ; il faut juste relâcher le bouton après la frappe, et non pas avant, sinon effectivement on fait un coup de défense très faible

3) La vitesse de visée est la même en Arcade et Simu, mais la précision augmente plus rapidement en Arcade (j'imagine que c'est ce que tu as voulu dire :) )

4) Il y avait effectivement un problème de sauvegarde du param Arcade/Simu dans l'écran d'aide, mais je viens de corriger ça. Par ailleurs, tu peux le régler dans ta feuille de personnage, en dessous de ton joueur 3D

5) En difficulté Pro (et même Junior) les échanges sont beaucoup plus tendus et réalistes que dans Top Spin 4 qui est globalement vraiment lent comparé à la réalité

author: {'steamid': '76561198037451071', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 2012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1613486348}
review:
Eu sempre fui fã de jogos de Tênis desde a época de PS1, isso se deve ao fato de ser fã do esporte graças a minha mãe que quase foi campeã estadual, sempre fui fã do Guga, do Agassi, do Djoko, do Nadal, e sempre fui apaixonado pela Sharapova (minha primeira crush), mas acabou que o tênis foi "deixado de lado" nos games, o último que joguei mais ou menos foi Virtua Tennis 4, mas meu favorito sempre foi o de Dreamcast, em que tinha treinamentos baseados em minigames, um modo carreira bem extensivo, em resumo, dá pra perceber que adoro o esporte e sempre fui fã dos jogos, mesmo que recentemente recebemos dois que são muito inferiores.
Então recebi uma dica de um usuário do Reddit, em que me falava sobre esse jogo aqui, o quanto o gameplay é bem focado e até mesmo fiel as fisicas do jogo. Fui atrás da Demo e no começo achei muito estranho e diferente, mas insisti e cara, como me diverti, os controles e as raquetadas influenciam como a bola viaja pela quadra, como a devolução vai ocorrer, não espere super smashes tirados dos arcades mais antigos, o negócio aqui é mais como um jogo de tênis de verdade, estratégia e encontrar um modo de devolver a bola de uma forma em que o adversário force um erro.
Os gráficos são super datados, dá pra perceber que o desenvolvedor colocou todas as suas forças no gameplay a ponto de toda a apresentação do jogo (da capa ao menu) parece meio amador, e é por causa disso mesmo, esse jogo foi feito por somente um desenvolvedor, o que deixa tudo ainda mais impressionante.
Mas ele não está sozinho, o jogo tem uma facilidade de ser modificável a ponto de que até o mais leigo dos leigos pode deixar o jogo do seu próprio jeito, até eu mesmo fiz algumas modificações com meu próprio jogo. Nos fóruns do jogo eles tem uma gama ENORME de modificações, mods para multiplayer, para o modo Carreira (chamado World Tour) em que há uma conversão quase que total do jogo, a ponto de parecer uma transmissão mesmo.
Resumindo, se você é fã de tênis, vc tem que dar uma chance pra esse jogo, pra mim, o melhor jogo de tênis no mercado e uma verdadeira aula para aqueles que tentaram (e falharam) fazer um jogo que remontasse os tempos de glória. (*cof cof* World Tennis Tour *cof cof*)

author: {'steamid': '76561198801431832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1514906636}

author: {'steamid': '76561198015999410', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 18980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18167, 'last_played': 1581500717}
review:
its ok

Okay, so, jokes aside, this game is great. It's the best Tennis game when it comes to gameplay, period. Sure, it may look butt ugly and sort of like some sort of Playstation 1-era Donkey-ass-looking incarnation for graphics, but the gameplay more than makes up for it. 

You get to make your own character from the ground up, you get to customize every single aspect of his game, and you get to grow and develop your character as he plays and partakes in all of the tournaments on the ATP tour! Not only that, but there's also the Olympics and the David Cup to partake it.

There's no story in the game, it's just pure gameplay, and the gameplay is just where it shines. Again, it's the most realistic gameplay that a tennis game can have, and all of its systems are scarily accurate except for a few parts (such as the insane movement speed that the characters can have). 

Buy the game if you're a tennis fan! It beats Virtua Tennis, Tennis World Tour, and Top Spin any day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198141750922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2441, 'last_played': 1597506771}
review:
Si eres fanatico o alguna vez practicaste este hermoso deporte, este es tu juego! Si buscas un juego arcade, estilo virtua tenis, este claramente no es tu juego. El punto fuerte es la jugabilidad, practicamente puedes hacer lo que quieras con la bola, realizar cualquier tipo de angulo tanto en juego como en saque. Si bien visualmente se queda viejo, cuando tomas el mando, realmente sientes que estas dentro de la pista. La dificultad de la IA tiene muchos niveles y subniveles, por lo que no te aburriras nunca. Totalmente recomendado si quieres un juego de tenis basado en SIMULACION.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198002354764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1528525543}
review: Despues de esperar el nuevo tennis world tour (y ver un adelanto por youtube, que no me convencio para nada), me encontre con un video que mostraba este juego con algun parche instalado, que agregaba nombres reales entre otras cosas. Recorde que lo habia adquirido y me baje un parche (maxou) y me dispuse a probarlo. La sensacion que tengo es que es el mejor luego de tenis que probe. Felicitaciones al desarrollador por este gran producto y a la espera de sus proximos juegos, tenis elbow 4 y tenis elbow manager 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040646372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 154176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 413, 'playtime_at_review': 91969, 'last_played': 1712219761}
review:
Мне, как фанату большого тенниса, всегда не хватало качественных игр про этот вид спорта. И если про футбол или хоккей игры выходят с завидной регулярностью, то с теннисом все печальнее. На Tennis Elbow я наткнулся совершенно случайно, абсолютно никаких ожиданий на счёт этой игры у меня не было. И совершенно зря. Наиграв более полутора тысяч часов и не обнаружив практически никаких обзоров на этот шедевр, я понял, что пора написать его самому. Так что если хотя бы одному человеку он будет полезен, мои старания будут не напрасны.

Предлагаю начать сразу с минусов, т.к. именно они первым делом бросятся в глаза:

1.	Скромная графика

Невооруженным глазом видно, что графическая составляющая в TE весьма посредственная. Она проигрывает своему конкуренту  Virtua Tennis 4 и немного выигрывает у Top Spin 2 (последняя часть серии, которая появлялась на ПК в 2006 году). Но и отталкивающей я ее не назову. Пропорции тела сохранены, корты вполне узнаваемы.

2.	Топорная анимация 

Да, в сравнении с той же Virtua Tennis, наш теннисный симулятор немного проигрывает, анимация местами выглядит немного топорно, но в целом тоже на весьма неплохом уровне. В редакторе персонажа можно создавать очень даже узнаваемых теннисистов, благо базовый набор анимаций это позволяет сделать.  А уж если обратить внимание на различные моды... Но о них чуть позже. 

Если закрыть глаза на эти маленькие грешки, можно обнаружить, что у игры огромное количество плюсов, которые перевешивают чашу весов в свою сторону.

1.	Реализм

Отыграв сотни часов в другие теннисные симуляторы, могу с уверенностью сказать, что реализм в TE как глоток свежего воздуха. VT больше похож на аркаду, что он даже не скрывает, TS2 сейчас выглядит очень устаревшим, а обмен ударами картонным и шаблонным. В ТЕ для того, чтобы успешно наносить удары нужно учитывать сразу несколько факторов: подход к мячу, отскок, сила удара, а также уровень скилла того или иного удара. Так что тащить с первых минут не выйдет, большое количество аутов и сеток просто обеспечены. Всё как в реальной жизни.

2.	Режим карьеры

В ТЕ самый глубокий и продуманный режим мирового тура из всех, что я видел. Вы можете выбрать 1 сезон из жизни спортсмена, либо режим из полноценной карьеры на 16 сезонов. Нам позволяется выбрать уже существующего теннисиста/тку или создать самому. А дальше практически все как в реальном теннисе: квалификации, тренировки между турнирами. В игре представлен полноценный ATP, WTA и ITF туры, с Кубками Дэвиса, Федерации, Итоговыми турнирами (передаю привет режиму карьеры в VT4, который вызывал лишь отторжение). Есть возможность наблюдать матчи между компьютером, проверять счёт личных встреч между соперниками, всё прозрачно, тут и чемпионская гонка, подробные статистики. Любители цифр и аналитики будут в восторге. А если у вас своё видение на счёт уже существующих спортсменов или вы хотите добавить своих собственных, то добро пожаловать в текстовый файл, в котором уже вы можете настроить скиллы спортсмена, отредактировать его рейтинг на конец года и многое другое. Жаль, что нет Олимпиад, но разработчик обещает их уже в новой части.

3.	Онлайн-матчи

Разумеется, есть возможность и для интернет-баталий с рейтингом каждого человека, его репутацией. Для комфортной игры лучше выбирать соперника из своего региона и со стабильным пингом, благо вся эта информация тоже предоставляется.

4.	Моддинг

Игра очень и очень доброжелательна к моддингу. На официальном форуме люди делятся своими работами. Чего там только нет: 3Д-корты, одежда, советы и тактики. Но вишенкой на торте я считаю онлайн-мод ITST 1.18, который добавляет в игру новые текстуры, уже проработанных теннисистов, настоящие корты, а также моды для карьеры в WTA-туре для еще более полного погружения. 
 
В итоге мы имеем без преувеличения лучший симулятор тенниса на данный момент. Даже выходящие в этом году AO Tennis и Tennis World Tour со своей графикой и лицензионными теннисистами выглядят жалкими пародиями на теннис на фоне Tennis Elbow, который, кстати, разрабатывается практически в одиночку. Купите, дождитесь скидок или опробуйте демо-версию на официальном сайте, но если вы любите теннис – эта игра просто обязана у вас быть.                                                            
                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                    9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197983905665', 'num_games_owned': 735, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 66805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50046, 'last_played': 1548679096}
review:
Been playing the Tennis Elbow series since TE2009 and have more than a 1000 hours plugged into TE2013.

During my time of playing TE2013 I've played through Virtua Tennis 3 and 4 and 4WT. Smash Court Tennis 3 and Top Spin 3/4. What makes TE2013 so appealing over the years is the gameplay. It is hands down the best gameplay of any tennis game. 

The controls are the best of any tennis game because you are actually able to dictate the spin, the height, the depth and the power of the ball accurately and this is one of the only games that understands the physics of tennis and understand that ball can go anywhere and anything can happen in a rally. There's no predeterminted calculations of where the ball is going to go, it's not going to end up in the same places, there's actual variety presented in the shot you play and how you react to an incoming shot. You can't stand 5 feet inside the baseline and expect to blast winners into each corner with 100% consistency. It follows the semantics of real life tennis so accurately that rallies look authentic.

Yes the graphics need modernizing, TE4 I hope with it being based on Unity and with the developer's excellent track record in allow the game to be easily modded will take that next step in terms of being a complete game. The vanilla version of the game is fine but there is also a wonderful community that have modded so much into the game in terms of character customization items, stadiums, logos that you can get a much more rounded game with them. 

Also, this has to be one of the first tennis games where the animations of players are actually accurate, again down to the system implemented to add custom animations. And those animations actually matter as well in terms of the timing and placement of the shot. It's actually frightening how I think that 1 guy developing this game can create better animations and allow a system in place for easy custom animations to be modded in than modern titles that have been released (AO Tennis and Tennis World Tour) 

I emplore you if you're a fan of Tennis and really want a well rounded experience where you can actually learn a pretty in-depth fun game that has the best gameplay for a tennis game then you need to buy this and support the developer. It is continually updated and the next TE is in development which should improve upon what is already a very very good foundation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298640633', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1525005616}
review:
Et bien non, je ne recommande pas ce jeu, car je ne l'ai pas aimé. En revanche, je serai très attentif à un eventuel Tennis Elbow 2018 ? 

Stockage et mémoire : disque dur 1000 Go + SSD 256 Go, RAM 16 Go
Intel Core i7 Skylake i7-6700HQ 3.5 Ghz
Carte Graphique : GEFORCE GTX970M 3 Go

Jeu, non fluide, balle et déplacement non fluides, malgré affichage détecté en 60 fps ... vraiment bizarre et surtout trés dommage ... le reste semblait parfait même si un peu vieillissant
developer_response:
La raison la plus fréquente pour ce genre de souci c'est que ton PC est passé en mode d'économie d'énergie car le jeu prend très peu de ressources, et en retour cela le fait ramer.

Pour éviter ça, il faut passer le mode d'énergie dans Windows en Performance.

[h1]EDIT Septembre 2019 :[/h1]
Vu que tu n'as quasiment pas joué au jeu, que tu n'as pas voulu de mon aide, et que tu t'es fait rembourser, est-ce que tu pourrais considérer enlever ton avis qui pénalise les chances de succès du jeu pour un problème facilement réparable ?

Merci d'avance pour ta reconsidération ! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198043367667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 602, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1522489215}
review:
I bought this game to play with my brother as it was clearly the most well received tennis game on Steam. I was a bit dubious, especially as the community hub guides recommend modding and ini file changes for the best experience.

However, TE2013 displays a depth of options outside of the gameplay and, even better, both breadth and depth within the control of the gameplay. I actually 100% control shot placement and need to think about all the angles of the court, keeping the ball at shoulder height as much as possible and considering a wide range of shot types to balance both defence and offence. I am somewhat aware of how to play tennis, mostly through watching it more than playing, but the experience overall really makes me feel that I am actually involve in a tennis match. This game is simply far more incredible than I expected. Trust the steam reviews.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014393928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 3303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1655493969}
review:
No soy muy amante de los juegos de deportes, pero este juego merece muucho la pena, te mete en un partido de tenis como ningun otro que haya jugado, y vengo del MATCH POINT DE AMSTRAD y de los ROLAND GARROS  de hace la peeera de años !!! Así que por juegos no serán jejeje.
Los graficos no son del otro mundo, pero no se que tiene este juego pero te engancha. 
AVISADO QUEDAS. 
El sistema de puntos y habilidades le dá un puntazo, para que te especialices en el tipo de jugador que quieras.
Cada jugador tuyo y la IA  tiene una forma de jugar, sacar y cabrearse distinta !!! mola.
No puedes jugar en el torneo que quieras solo cuando tengas experiencia podras jugar los Grand Slam y torneos mas grandes.
Los nombres no son los reales pero hay mods que lo arreglan a fecha de hoy sin problemas.
RECOMENDADO ??? POR SUPUESTO QUE SI !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998568769', 'num_games_owned': 671, 'num_reviews': 828, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1520566906}
review:
6/10

Finally, I'm reviewing Tennis Elbow 2013, for all the potential players that are still on the fence about this five-year-old game. One of my close friends is an avid tennis player, and when I saw that the game had an online cooperative doubles mode, we decided to give it a go.

The mechanics of tennis themselves seem to be quite solid in the game. You can position your serves, either going for broke with a Roddick-style slam or going easier with a spinning second serve. You can make lobs, drop shots, or charge the net for serves and volleys. One thing that is important to know about the gameplay is that you don't hit the button to hit the ball (I played using an XBOX 360 controller). You move into position, hold the button corresponding to the shot you'd like to hit (even if the ball isn't yet there), and then move the stick around to position the shot. If you are in the right place, your player will automatically hit the shot. Therefore, the quicker you get into position (and/or the slower your opponent's shot), the more time you have to punish them with your placement, just like in actual tennis. It's really a genius system.

Another positive aspect of the game is the character customization. Not only can you change the physical and fashionable characteristics of your character, but you can actually choose moves from your favorite tennis players. Do you like Nadal's intimidating stance prior to his return? You can have it. Federer's backhand? Go and be beautiful. Isner's serve? Go frighten children.

Not all is rainbows and butterflies in the world of Tennis Elbow 2013, however. First of all, the menu is absolutely terrible. It takes an unnecessarily long time to do anything, and relevant settings are sometimes scattered across a few pages. I couldn't find much in the way of choosing difficulty - the player seems to be able to adjust the difficulty between matches or something, but the details of this are pretty obtuse.

Most of my time with the game was in playing 2 on 2 doubles vs. AI matches with a friend. Though we might've lost the first match we played, we had no problem winning every match thereafter. Without a good way to adjust the difficulty, there wasn't really much left to do. We tried a singles match against each other, but player serves in the game are so tremendously fast that it just became a guessing game. Additionally, the game pits you against the same two AI opponents every time, a woman in a pink skirt and a vaguely ethnic man. We took to calling them "Nancy Kerrigan" and "Vijay Singh."

I don't regret the time I spent with the game, but do feel that the game might not be worth it unless you can get it for around 7-8 dollars. I got it on sale at 16 (the normal price is 25), and I can't say I feel great about that price. The character customization and mechanics should absolutely be adopted by other potential tennis games that might be able to create a more complete experience.
developer_response:
1) I designed the menus for myself and I don't like to lose any time, so once you get familiar with them, you'll see they are very fast to navigate ; although it's true it's a bit hard to locate everything at 1st, especially as the game got a lot of new options from user requests ; so for the sequel, I'll do a big rehaul to put everything in a way that will be more friendly to newcomers.

Quick tip : press the right button to go back the previous menus

2) To customize your opponent and his partner, just go to the Character Sheet menu, and press on the top right icon to see the additional players :
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1324375138
This is explained in the manual here ("Character Sheet" paragraph) : http://www.managames.com/tennis/doc/Tennis_Elbow-Tennis_Game.html#menus

But you're not the 1st one to have difficulty finding the additional players so for the sequel, I'll add an intermediate menu to show & select the 4 players when you click on "Character Sheet".

3) And in that 2nd player Character Sheet, you'll find the CPU difficulty level, just under the 3D player :
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1324378948
Quick tip : if you play a coop doubles online, it's the Host who defines the opponents ; if you play in vs mode, each user defines his partner

4) If you have an issue returning your opponent serve when playing online, be sure to set the Skill Mode to Fair ; this will slow down the serve and should help to get into the game. If it's still too fast, you can agree with your friend to manually lower both of your service skills in your Character Sheet

5) I hope this helps and maybe you could give the game a 2nd chance now that you know how you can set up the CPU players.
And if you need any additional help, I'm very often around ! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198116124263', 'num_games_owned': 669, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1520767198}
review:
I hesitate a bit because of the bad graphics but after a few hours I can honestly say that it's worth it. I only played Virtua Tennis 4 and Top Spin 4 before. While the other 2 games have much better graphics, a deeper career mode (top spin 4) and overall a better presentation I'd say that Tennis Elbow 2013 is probably better than the other 2 on the court when it comes to playing tennis. The controls take a bit getting used to, because it uses a different control system than the other 2 games. Instead of releasing a fire button just before or at the time you hit the ball, you have to keep the button pressed until your player performed the hit. But after a while you get used to it and the game starts to feel more realistic than Top Spin 4.

I would still rank Top Spin 4 easily better in almost all regards, and Tennis World Tour which comes out in a few months might top this game. But currently I can recommend Tennis Elbow 2013 because it's the best Tennis game on PC and actually feels like a simulation and it also has a career mode, although it could be a bit more in depth in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015025169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2727, 'last_played': 1527512493}
review:
réservé aux spécialistes surement,  jeu de réflexe exclusivement,  0 plaisir pour moi, l'IA en facile est injouable pour moi, c'est pire que la premiére version, rien pour les non-initiés, c'est dommage...
Manutoo m'a contacté pour que je modifie mon commentaire! pas de modification, j'ai bien joué aux 2 versions, Manutoo ne respecte pas le droit d'expression mis en place par steam, c'est bien dommage!
developer_response:
Je pensais que tu t'étais trompé de jeu de tennis, vu qu'il n'y a pas de niveau "Facile" dans le jeu ; il y a "Débutant", "Club", puis "Junior", "Pro", "Maître" et enfin "Incroyable".

Par ailleurs, il est quasiment impossible de perdre en niveau "Débutant", et il y a une aide à la visée, un déplacement automatique rapide et la zone de danger pour aider les non-initiés au jeu, donc cela ne correspond pas du tout à la description que tu en fais.

Pour finir, il n'y a pas de 1ère & 2ème versions : il y a eu Tennis Elbow en 1997, puis TE2004, TE2005, TE2006, TE2009, TE2011 et enfin TE2013. Donc là, c'est la 7e version (ou la 3ème génération pour les puristes).

Mais si tu as effectivement passé 45 heures sur TE2013 sans arriver à y jouer et que donc cela ne t'a pas plu, tu peux bien évidemment le dire... :-)

Cependant, je peux donc te conseiller de mettre l'ordinateur sur Débutant, de brancher la Zone de Danger & l'aide à la visée si ce n'est déjà fait, et de pratiquer une heure ou 2 en mode échauffement jusqu'à ce que tu maîtrises bien les déplacements et les différents coups.

[b]EDIT:[/b]
Tiens, tu as gagné 22 matchs en mode carrière : http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198015025169/stats/346470/?tab=achievements .
Cela me paraît incompatible avec "l'IA en facile est injouable pour moi", donc je pense toujours que tu t'es trompé de jeu... ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198023404364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3538, 'last_played': 1520094739}
review:
Awesome tennis game. If you like tennis and sport simulations, you will love this one. It is well worth 23€.

I played Top Spin 4 a lot on xbox 360 (4 careers of around 5-10 years, with different playstyles). I also played Virtua Tennis and other arcadish titles, yet not as much as Top Spin, as I prefer realistic simulations.

But this game is far ahead any of its competitors. In terms of realism and gameplay, they don't play in the same league (no pun intended).

The UI and the graphics are poor, even considering how old the game is. But who cares? A simulation is not about fancy arts, it's all about the feeling. And Mana Games outreached that goal. How you hit the ball, how the ball reacts depending on court surfaces, ball spins, running inertia, positionning before hitting the ball... all of this feel extremely close to reality. It makes it even more enjoyable to win tight games.

I have yet to try the multiplayer mode, as I don't think I can take any pleasure online for now (I'm far from being good enough). But the career mode is great. It is very complete in terms of competitions as well as character progression: it's highly rewarding to finally be able to reach grand slams qualifiers after losing so many futures first rounds! 

You should also consider that, even If you don't like too much realism, you can still set options to make the game less realistic (although it would be such a waste, imo). The same goes for graphics: there's a mod that greatly enhances the main (only?) flaw of Tennis Elbow ("Maxou Patch" that is). And where the gameplays proves that this game was made by tennis players, the game versatility (open to mode, wide variety of difficulty/gameplay option) proves that it was made by a gamer-friendly dev team... or at least a smart one!

Now, although I personnally think that's the best tennis game out there, I still believe this could get better. For instance: money. We win a lot, but it's useless. It would be great if we could use it to hire staff: coach, physical trainer, physiotherapists, physicians, nutritionists (no more gluten Novak!), and so on. And it would be the opportunity to add a wound and long term fatigue feature.

Also, choosing racket strings tension and rackets would be a nice realistic feature as well, but probably extremely hard to implement (as it would significantly impact ball physics).

There could also be a "morale" factor, which would affect all of our skills in the same way fatigues does. And it would increase if you play home or if you're famous enough to get cheers everywhere you go, but decrease with a few defeats in a raw or some random events.

Ok, I'm clearly daydreaming here. But I read on various fora that a sequel was on the way... I hope it's true and that some new features are going to be added! 

PS:  It works perfectly with a PS4 gamepad, after a bit of tests and configuration.


[h1]tl;dr: if you like sport sims, I highly recommend you try this underrated gem.[/h1]
developer_response:
Thanks for the nice review ! :-)

A good part of the things you'd like to see is in Tennis Elbow Manager, and thus will be in TEM2.

It won't come in TE4 because it'd be an overkill and come in the way for many players. However, TEM2 matches may be playable, although gameplay may differ from TE4.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184134433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 12305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1027, 'last_played': 1623355995}
review:
Si vous êtes un fan de tennis et de réalisme n'hésitez pas ce jeu est fait pour vous !
Un des plus gros avantage de ce jeu est la physique de balle, c'est bête dit comme ça mais elle quasiment
parfaite, par rapport à tout les jeux sorties sur consoles tel que top spin 4 qui elle est trop lente et ou le mouvement
semble scripté (balle qui se téléporte dans la raquette du joueur).
Si pour vous les graphismes sont indispensable à la qualité d'un jeu, ici ils ne sont pas beau mais suffisant pour
profiter du jeu.
Le mode carrière est très complet grâce a tout les paramètres disponibles à la personnalisation du personnage
même s'il n'y a pas réellement de sponsor, fan etc comme on pouvait le voir sur top spin 4 par exemple.


Mais ce qui fait de ce jeu le meilleur jeu de tennis de tout les temps (oui on peut le dire)
ce sont les mods proposés:
-les animations des joueurs les plus connus réalisé à la presque perfection
-les terrains des grands chelems, master 1000, atp 500, 250, challenger, coupe davis...
-les tenues des joueurs s'étalant sur toutes les marques connus allant de Joma jusqu'à nike
-les sons pour chaques surfaces (pour chaque grand chelem également)
-les sons des joueurs (cris) et même de l'arbitre de chaise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162705475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 92248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 791, 'playtime_at_review': 27130, 'last_played': 1712417005}
review:
几年前买的游戏，闲得无聊的时候会拿出来玩上一会儿一直玩到现在

先说说我认为的优点：
1.这个游戏对于球路的模拟是非常逼真的，球员的击球动作和球的运动感觉上也非常的连贯。

2.此外玩家还可以自己往游戏中打MOD，可以让球场看起来更加的真实。

3.有人说这个游戏画面简陋，但是我倒是喜欢这种简单粗暴的感觉（姑且把他算成优点哈哈）。

4.同时我也能感觉到电脑是有战术变化的，当比分领先的时候会打的主动，落后的时候会有崩盘的可能，AI加入这种波动更会让人觉得你是在跟一个真正的网球选手在打球，这点是绝对的加分项！

接下来说说我想吐槽的地方：
1.AI还是不太科学，难度上去之后AI反应太快了有没有，220km的发球说return ace就return ace，然后对面一个200km的发球我就得飞出场外，以及各种神预判和神变线，克里赞都能打出纳达尔的水平。

2.以及极个别的球员动作不连贯的问题，人没动球动了这种事情偶尔是会发生的。

3.另外估计这个游戏玩的人不算多，联机玩的话延迟也是非常的醉人。



总的来说是那种零食类游戏，想玩的时候来两把，不想玩就把他扔一边，但基本不会有彻底弃坑的想法。可这类游戏的固有性质也就注定了他玩法的单一，时间长了肯定也会疲劳。

期待一个精良的续作！

评分 8/10
