review: non funziona il gampad come impazzito che fare?????????????????
developer_response:
[h1]Traduzione online di http://translate.google.com[/h1]

Qual è il tuo controller?
Se si tratta di un controller XBox one, potrebbe essere necessario eseguire questa manipolazione: http://steamcommunity.com/app/346470/discussions/0/350544272218350395/#c350544272221069962.

Altrimenti, basta andare al menu Controller e cambiare Tastiera 1 in Joystick 1 per il Giocatore 1.

[h1]EDIT 1 giugno 2019:[/h1]
Ho appena impostato una configurazione di input Steam predefinita per i controller XBox 360 & One.
Quindi, se preferisci usare il sistema Steam Input, lascia che i controlli di gioco del tuo giocatore su "Tastiera 1" (invece di "Joystick 1") e quindi seleziona la configurazione consigliata "Tennis Elbow Series" in "Steam Controller "Configurazione" (fai clic con il pulsante destro del mouse sul gioco nella libreria di Steam per aprirlo), oppure selezionalo da qui: steam://controllerconfig/760630/1754087404.

Tuttavia, potresti comunque dover riconfigurare gli scioperi nel gioco a tuo piacimento.

[h1]EDIT 1 giugno 2020:[/h1]
Qualche possibilità che tu possa provare quello che ti ho detto?
Lasciare una recensione negativa per il gioco penalizzerà per sempre le sue possibilità di successo, mentre quasi non hai giocato e non hai provato la soluzione che ti ho dato.
Quindi c'è qualche possibilità che tu possa riconsiderare la tua recensione?
Grazie in anticipo per il tuo riesame. :-)

[h1]============= English =============[/h1]

What is your controller ?
If it's an XBox one controller, you might have to do this manipulation : http://steamcommunity.com/app/346470/discussions/0/350544272218350395/#c350544272221069962 .

Else, just go to the Controllers menu, and change Keyboard 1 to Joystick 1 for the Player 1.

[h1]EDIT June 1st 2019:[/h1]
I just set up a default Steam Input config for the XBox 360 & One controllers.
So if you prefer to use the Steam Input system, let the in-game controls of your player to "Keyboard 1" (instead of "Joystick 1") and then pick up the recommended config "Tennis Elbow Series" in the "Steam Controller Configuration" screen (right-click the game in your Steam library to open it), or pick it from here : steam://controllerconfig/760630/1754087404 .

You might still need to reconfigure in-game the strikes to your liking, though.

[h1]EDIT June 1st 2020:[/h1]
Any chance you could try what I told you ?
Leaving a negative review for the game will forever penalize its chance of success, while you almost didn't play and didn't try the solution I gave you.
So is there any chance you could reconsider your review ?
Thanks in advance for your reconsideration. :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198003197465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1516744331}
review: Как убрать авто удар. Я бегаю, а он сам отбивает. Как это убрать. Пока что диз. Вам не нужно напрягаться. Просто перемещаете игрока по полю, а он сам отобъет мяч.
developer_response:
Online Translation : http://translate.google.com

If you don't press any button, your player will do a safe strike ; this produces an easy ball that goes to the center of opposite court and your opponent will often take advantage of it (except if you play in easy difficulty setting).

So you should press the buttons and aim before hitting the ball.

There's no way to disable the auto-strike, TE control scheme lets you hit the ball very late, till the very last 0.05 second, instead of having to release the button 0.5 seconds before the hit.

So at 1st, it's a bit hard to learn it, but once you get good at it, you'll see it couldn't be any other way and it's better to simulate real tennis than what most other tennis games do.

For other issues, it's hard to pinpoint exactly what went wrong without additional details, but uninstalling everything ( + deleting folder), then reinstalling everything + following carefully the Mod installation instructions should fix most issues.

If you have don't have all Modding cloth items, it might mean you just have the original game without Mod applied ; so you may have installed the Mod in the wrong folder, or something like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086741345', 'num_games_owned': 3163, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 6644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4502, 'last_played': 1524851928}
review:
Tennis Elbow 2013 is one of few games available on PC that actually covers tennis. From the screenshots it looks like a decent indie tennis title with aged graphics and a funny name. But is that all it is? Or are its looks deceiving? This is what I think of Tennis Elbow 2013.

 This game surprised me in the best of ways. After taking a keen interest in the sport earlier this year and following the WTA, I wanted a good tennis game that I could play here on Steam. I didn't know of this title until I saw someone mention how great it was on reddit and I decided to take the plunge and purchase it. And boy was it worth it. 

After struggling to get to grips with janky controls and being dismayed at the UI ripped straight from developmental hell in the 90's I was ready to write the game off as a bad purchase. But I persevered with it. I was losing matches and being humiliated but I was...enjoying it. I got used to the controls and began to appreciate the weight and depth to its mechanics. This isn't just an indie tennis game. It's a serious simulation. 

The controls are not easy to learn and the help screens confuse you with strange key mapping but once you learn about the different shots you can use and bind them to more natural keys, you'll soon be bossing it on the courts. You'll have to learn to time your shots or you'll be hitting balls into the centre of the court leading to inevitably being picked off. During rallies, you'll have to carefully position for certain shots or you'll mis-hit them. I wouldn't exactly say it's easy to learn but it's definitely difficult to master. Luckily there are a number of difficulties, six of them, each with a subset of ten levels. You can switch difficulties on the fly, even during the match, so the game is as easy or hard as you want it. 

The game really comes into its own in its main mode; the World Tour. You can pick an existing player or create one yourself and rise from a rookie to a Grand Slam champion. There is great customization for you to create the player you want and you can assign some starting skill points into different attributes for your player. This ranges from the power in your forehand and backhand strokes, whether you have a good serve or not, speed and stamina and specialization shots such as the drop shot and lob. Once your character is done it's time to play tennis. 
  
 Having only played Top Spin 4, I'm not an authority on tennis games but this World Tour is excellent. There are dozens of different tournaments to play in with each week on a variety of different surfaces. It's all a bit overwhelming but in a good way. As a rookie, you'll have to enter the lowest tier tournaments and work your way up, playing against a roster of 1000 players. You'll even have to play qualifier matches just to compete, just like in the real sport. You earn XP every tournament and the better you do, the faster you'll improve. It's excellent when you finally make a name for yourself, not to mention satisfying. 

This is the best representation I've seen of tennis in a game, but apart from the mechanics on the court, it's incredibly bare-bones. In Top Spin 4 you had little random events that would require a little input, such as opening a local night club or attending events. This game would improve a lot with a similar approach but the great gameplay more than makes up for that. The graphics are very dated, even for an older game, and the aforementioned UI is truly terrible. Which brings us to the last thing I'd like to talk about. Mods.

This game is highly moddable and the number of high quality mods available for it enhance the experience. With mods that simulate both ATP and WTA tours with character likenesses, real names(different but recognizable names in the base game,) custom courts, scoreboards, stat sheets and new UI mods, the world is your oyster. 

All in all, this game is the best tennis game available right now. While its hard to play at first, once you get into the game you'll be hooked. But if you aren't a tennis fan, this game probably won't be for you as it's all about what happens on court and nothing else. As a tennis fan, this is one of the best purchases I've made, I've had many epic matches and I'll be sure to enjoy many more. A wholehearted recommendation from me!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006750838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2187, 'last_played': 1658505077}
review:
Dudes and Dudettes, this is a top Tennis sim. I went straight into career mode, and there's so much content, you won't believe it. You can pick and choose between hundreds of tournaments each year (Yes you age as a player; Age 15-till you retire), and each surface reacts differently (Clay, slow and high bounce; Grass, fast and low bounce; etc).

But most importantly, the controls adapt perfectly to whatever player you want.  Ground strokes, baseline, serve and volley, you name it. My waifu (Yes, I made a girl) is a serve maestro. And for the first time ever in a Tennis sim, I can thunder aces down with reckless abandon. 20, 30 even 40(!) aces a game are not uncommon. She suffers elsewhere with her game obviously, but with a cool head, I can defeat opponents without them even getting their racket on the ball.

Totally mod friendly, this is the closest PC gamers will get to smelling the grass at Wimbledon.

Game, Set and Match.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967557984', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2861, 'last_played': 1505263330}
review:
Pros: 
It's the only only tennis game 
Controls are not very difficult to master

Cons:
Graphics are primitive but slow.
Lag playing in single player. I play Doom more smoothly than this game!
AI is horrible. CPU can go from hitting balls out all the time to serve returning your powerful and well placed serves like a cannon in the line. 

This is a $5-$10 budget title, not a $25 game. Unfortunately the only tennis game worth mentioning on Steam. I miss GST and TopSpin...
developer_response:
1) TE2013 takes so little resources that some PCs trigger the energy economy mode which in turn makes the game runs poorly ; to avoid this, set your energy power plan to Performance

2) It seems you have Modded the game, and some Mods are known to make the game runs poorly in some tournaments ; so if you have installed a Mod, check the topic of that Mod for some help

3) An user reported such issue lately and it was Windows Defender doing stuff in the background (again because TE2013 takes few resources Windows think it's alright to start other stuff at the same time)

4) Lastly, there are some issues with Win10 and/or some hardware configuration ; a lot of possible causes and their fixes are listed here : http://www.managames.com/Forum/viewtopic.php?p=223453#p223453 .
In short, it gives : be sure that your video & sound drivers are up to date ; play in a native resolution ; play at 60hz ; switch between Exclusive Fullscreen Mode and Fullscreen Window (at game launch)

5) To avoid be annoyed by the long returns of the CPU, you should make a couple of steps back after your serve, it'll get much easier to catch these returns. But it's true the CPU does this return a bit too often, and I'll work on that for the sequel..! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198124930291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 4617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2220, 'last_played': 1705825293}
review:
Very very underrated game.

For a tennis fan, this game is a must have!
Sure, the graphics aren't great ( even 10 years ago it'd be showing it's age ) but the gameplay is superb.

The game itself follows the real tennis circuit ( the compitition names have been altered because it doesn't have ATP approval ) and me being a stats lover, I do love how it keeps track of your career in immense detail.

As you'd expect, the player names have also been changed to avoid legal issues, however there are mods around to have the correct names put in.

It's a pity that this developer doesn't have support of the ATP and some money thrown his way for an engine update and a few guys to help him code an updated version.

The price although steep, is worth it, the gameplay more than pays the asking price.

I love this game, and I recommend it 100%.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971060071', 'num_games_owned': 1405, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 925, 'last_played': 1509720373}
review:
I don't know whether it's just me, but has this game got harder? I have been playing it for a couple of weeks after a little break from it and I can't win a match, even in the challenger events.

Don't get me wrong, it's a good game, but the difficulty seems to have been ramped up. Virtually every person I play, no matter their ranking or stats, turns it on every time and produces a forehand or backhand winner against me, or aces me with a 181 km serve. It's rather annoying.

Still, I would recommend this to anyone who likes tennis and, I can win a few games while playing the real thing anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088894606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 3166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2597, 'last_played': 1500159516}
review: Хороший теннис,не аркадный и не легкий,если поменять управление и подогнать его под джостик играть станет намного приянтей и проще, с хорошей физикой ,но не идальной, в ожидании следующей версии,на данный момент это лучший теннис на pc.
developer_response:
Online Translation : http://translate.google.com

You should practice aiming with the different strikes in Warm Up mode and with the Aiming preview on, it'll help you to understand how everything works. With a bit of training like this, you should be able to volley and do all the other strikes from the baseline. :-)

Also, you should not hit the ball too low (which happens if you stand very far from the baseline), else you might do a fault.

review: Grandísimo juego, refleja fielmente la experiencia de un partido de tenis. Enorme variedad de golpes y modos de juego adictivos. Con mods, es una obra maestra del tenis. Recomendadísimo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019247213', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 8182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4925, 'last_played': 1560173651}
review:
Bon ok les graphismes et certaines animations sont complètement à la ramasse, il n'y a aucune cinématique, pas d'entrée des joueurs, rien non plus entres les points, les jeux ou les sets, rien nada ! 

Mais bon dieu le gameplay et les sensations une fois qu'on y joue.... 

C'est pour moi le jeu qui se rapproche le plus du tennis réel, et de loin ! (et j'ai 12 ans de tennis derrière moi) Oubliez Top Spin et autres bousins, ou nan, comparez plutôt une vidéo de Tennis Elbow 2013 avec une de Top Spin 4 par exemple et jugez par vous même.

Une fois un mod installé pour avoir le vrai circuit ATP (vrais joueurs, équipement réel, animations etc... Je recommande vivement le mod de Maxou ATP 2016) le mod carrière devient vraiment très complet, je crois que tous les tournois y sont (grand chelem, atp 250/500/1000, challengers, futurs etc...).

On peut soit créer son propre joueur, soit en prendre un éxistant et commencer sa carrière à l'année souhaitée. Vous voulez jouer Nadal alors qu'il n'a que 15 ans lors de son entrée dans le circuit, vous pouvez ! Le classement et les joueurs présents évolueront au fil des saisons en intégrant les joueurs réel à l'année précise ou ils sont entrés dans le circuit.

La difficulté est ultra paramétrable, plusieurs niveaux divisés en 10 sous niveaux chacun, si vous voulez du challenge vous en aurez.

Bref la simulation de tennis numéro 1 sur le marché, dommage qu'il soit si peu connu...

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197983893412', 'num_games_owned': 623, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3237, 'last_played': 1688222527}
review:
A hidden gem worth playing.

While the graphics department is not spectacular, everything else is very well crafted... control options are exaustive, career mode is neat and the physics are interesting. Shots mechanics takes a bit of time to get use to (have a look at the manual, it gives detailed explanations on serve options and other special shots) but once familira, they work very well.

On top of this, the game is extensivelly moddable, and the community has done some spectacular work to recreate a full rooster of real-life players and venues, both for the single player career and multiplayer

author: {'steamid': '76561198190669587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3686, 'last_played': 1616843670}
review:
Gioco molto divertente e avvincente anche contro l'AI.
Il problema, a parer mio, è che per "guidare" l'incontro in modo che sia "movimentato",
il motore decide, ad esempio, che almeno un turno di servizio a set, le prime debbano uscire tutte o quasi e che ci sia uno o due doppi falli se si forza anche un minimo,
Ho provato a mettere 100,100,100 come valori di servizio, ma la regola rimane.
Bello ma un po "truffaldino".
developer_response:
Online Translation : http://translate.google.com

The rules for the service success are explained here : http://www.managames.com/tennis/doc/Tennis_Elbow-Tennis_Game.html#service .

If you don't want to miss you service you should use the 2nd Button, to do a 2nd serve.

The success of the serve is a dice roll, like in RPG games. Like this, it allows a realistic percentage of success on the serve. In tennis games where you have total control of your serve, it's too easy to get nearly 100% of powerful serves in, which is very unrealistic.

If you want to raise the success rate of your serve, lower its power but keep its precision and consistency to 100%.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016763575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1536468679}

author: {'steamid': '76561198058394396', 'num_games_owned': 1722, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1659260605}
review:
I bought this not expecting anything special, but I was wrong.

If you look past non existing presentation, and poor UI design, you will find very exiting, challenging and realistic tennis simulation. Graphic are nothing to brag about, but for small team, and I guess with almost non existing budget, this is very much expected and you should not base your purchase on that. What this game offers is very good and deep gameplay, with lots of difficulty levels, so you will always feel challenged. Also the career mode is great with lot of tournaments to keep you around, it would be better if you had options to do something beside playing matches (like spending money on something, meeting with fans etc.), but for what it is you will not find better on Steam right now.

So to conclude, this is very good game, and you should give it a chance, especially if you are a tennis fan. You will not be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041583954', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1590666652}
review:
Alors la j'aurais pas cru, quel plaisir une énorme surprise pour ma par ça fait un bail que je lorgne dessus et je regrette pas !!!
Un petit Résumé ?? Aller pourquoi pas!
TE2013 le descritif est claire et en plus ne ment pas, il y a énormement de contenu en plus j'ai installer un mod avec les MAJ de 2016 les vraies Nom de Joueur et Competition (oui dans le jeu Original il y a pas, meme si ont reconnais ^^ mais c'est mieux quand meme avec les vraie :p)!!
commencer ou vous voulez tout en haut ou tout en bas avec tout les tournoi qui sont present je peux vous dire qu'il y a de quoi faire j'ai jamais vue ça 0_0 !!
Mais alors le gameplay dans l'histoire! Il y a 3 modes jeu Arcade, Simu, Elite et la prise en main peux vous dire qu'il faut jouer un minimum pour commencé a kiffé, puis il y a plusieur Lvl de Difficulté de Débutant a legend (je crois ) moi je joue en Club pour l'instant c'est juste après débutant et je tombe en demi contre Milos Raonic 6/1 premier ste pour moi et 6/4 et 7/6 pour lui le kiff perdre contre un top 10 les points et wildcard pour un gros tournoi que du bonheur ^^
Bon il y  a plein d'autre personnes qui ont laisser des messages bien construtif sur le jeu (mieux que moi meme ) !!! 
Si vous aimez le Tennis franchement c'est bon investisement sur ceux bon jeux a vous tous ++

author: {'steamid': '76561197993937738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1038, 'last_played': 1650206852}
review:
First... I LOVE THIS GAME !
So why !? Everyone needs some arguments, right !?

From my knowledge, in sports games and especially tennis games on PC, It's the best physics and gameplay that I ever practiced.

It's definitly not an "arcade game", you have to be patient and if you were involved in "Virtua Tennis" and you loved it, give up because you will be frustrated.
If you appreciated "Top Spin" (wich was, in my opinion a very good mix between arcade and simulation), this game is so far and good than it !
I can assure you, if you are involved in tennis in real life (practicing it or supporting it as a fan), you will be so please to challenge it !

Your body position for placing good and well the tennis ball is very important as... in real situations, you will not able to put some punching and definitive shots in every situation !
Build a strategy against some different players with typical skills, customize your player skills with your personnality preferences, all is made for feeling as you will be in a real tennis match with some complicated situations... in your chair !

The game is very immersive, you have to be concentrated (I play it in with all simulated and that's a huge difference) but don't worry, you could choose the numerous difficulties easily and step by step.

So... are the graphics OK in 2017 !?
Well, there are a lot of addons for this game and you will be able to update it with a lot of beautiful and stunning free mods.
For the moment, I didn't felt the necessity to update it because, in my opinion, It looks good and first, the gameplay is very challenging and that's the most important for me... and maybe you !?

One of the best sports games that I ever played... definitly !

author: {'steamid': '76561198014750237', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 12643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12202, 'last_played': 1660321436}

author: {'steamid': '76561197975383803', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 19229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3408, 'last_played': 1597772716}
review: Gameplay excellent (réaliste et exigeant), IA bien foutue, vous ajoutez un mod pour améliorer le tout ( sons, graphismes...) et vous obtenez le meilleur jeu de tennis sur PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041104205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 5780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4281, 'last_played': 1649004415}
review:
First of all, to the best of my knowledge, its the only tennis game on steam.

Then, if you go beyond the graphical aspect (not really beautiful, nor well animated) it is very pleasing and can be customized from an arcade feel to hardcore simulation settings.

One recommandation: as soon as you beat the computer a bit too easily, rise the difficulty level to have a new challenge and a more tactical game.

I played too long in a low level and was loosing my interest into this game and now that I have rised the difficulty just a bit, it's rewarding again to win a game.

Very well done for an indie game.

NB: regarding the graphical aspect, many mods exist that make the game far better in this aspect

Update: Still playing it in 2018, Steam proposed it to me for a steam award nomination so I roled for it !

author: {'steamid': '76561198067490289', 'num_games_owned': 9248, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1080, 'last_played': 1648569156}
review:
最新MODの導入により最高のテニスゲームとなります。
選手やボールの挙動が現実的で良い意味で重みがあり、ちゃんとラケットで打ってる感覚が味わえます。
操作は直感的にプレイ可能だが、間合い取りや打つタイミングが結構シビアで、慣れないうちは思い通りにボールを打ち返せない。
初心者用にアーケード挙動の設定も用意されているが、他のテニスゲームと比較するとそれでも難しいと感じるぐらいシム寄り。
しかし、そのシビアさこそがこのゲームの最も楽しい部分であり、スポーツの醍醐味です。
難しいが理不尽ではないので、何度も練習して感覚を掴めば、徐々に高難易度のCPUに勝てるようになると思います。
オンラインについては、人が少ない上、上手い人が多いので中途半端な腕前だと余裕でボコボコにされます。しっかりCPU相手に練習を積みましょう。
実際の面白さに影響はありませんが、少し残念な箇所としては、UIがPS1、プレイ画面がPS2並のグラフィックなので、もし次回作が出るとしたらPS3のレベルぐらいにはして欲しいと思います。
最近、テニスゲーム自体が少し地味でマイナーな部類になってしまいましたが、
Tennis Elbowは明らかに傑作です。スポーツファンの方は是非買ってプレイしましょう。

author: {'steamid': '76561198260434827', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 28665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15801, 'last_played': 1626007982}
review:
EDIT : I'll keep updating the review whenever i remember a good or bad point. I'm adding neutral points (it may be a pro or a con depending on the situation and your preference).


First of all, my steam hours is not true. I brought this game years back on the mana games site and I played like 1000+ hours.

Tennis Elbow 2013 is a tennis simulation game devoloped by mana games. It has character custamization which can be compared to a RPG game. It has a very deep learning curve unlike anyother tennis game, so dont execpt to hit amazing winners and win in the first few hours. every stroke matters, the way you position matters, whether you hold down the strike button or not matters. I'l l tell you one thing, when you create that angle from the right side corner of the court to the left end corner of the court for an animalaistic winner....its AWESOME.

Pros :

-character custamization
-career mode is HUGE 
-easily moddable (can play with real pro players on real courts)
-no issues in multiplayer execpt for very rare lags (Damn turtles) 
-you can host a game and even be in another room (it will give you a sound when someone joins) 
-replayability (played 1000+ hrs and still not even slightly boring till now and wont ever be for me)
-Website dedicated for tournements with other players (ITST)
-dev is active and actually punishes toxic players
-community is really kind towards newbies
-nice ranking system with reputation
-can run on any PC easily
-AI has LOTS of diffuculty levels to choose 
-large variety of shots (fake drops, defensive and offensive lobs, topspin and power shots just to mention a few)
-split screen (I've played with friends...its good and really fun to play)
-the ball's physics (no game can replicate the real life spins as good as this game....the way the ball passes and hits the backboard when you ace... the ball's spin when you slice etc)

Neutral :

-Reputation (It may help you find fair players but at the same time it doesn't mean a player with bad reputation is not a fair player and vice versa)
-Elite mode in game (Its really unforgiving...you made that slight positioning or timing mistake? that ball is gonna fly out before you know it just like in real life)
-graphics (doesn't bother me but may bother some of you)

Cons :

-occational lags 
-small community, 80 to 100 at a given time (hopefully growing)
-character movement (can feel weird or clumsy at times)
-cant remember all the pros :P

The ranking system is ELO based :

400-799= club

800-1299= junior

1300-1999= pro

2000-3499= master

3500+ = Incredible

New player (plays like ****)

Club (can hit shots and getting familiar with the system)

Junior (can hit decent angle shots and rips an easy ball)

Pro (More consistant than junior, good with positioning, can create good angles from most of the court)

Master (Very consistant, almost never makes an unforced error, starts to anticipate where you hit and already moving)

Incredible ( never played one before so no idea but obviously can kick anyone's a**)

Total noob? no problem. The AI's lowest difficulty is probably worse than you (no offense :P)..Master or even incredible? no problem..the AI's higest difficulty will prolly give you a good fight or may even win you. 

Those who are complaining about the graphics (Ironically some own pixel graphic games lol) please play virtua tennis 4 or some game you like ;). All aside, I have 1000+ hours and i just turned master and I can easily say this is the best tennis simulation or mabye one of the best simulation games ever. Honestly if this game had more players, i wouldnt need anyother game on steam.

last thing..If you want someone to play or any doubts you have please feel free to add me.

Game, Set, Match friends ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970631666', 'num_games_owned': 4445, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 893, 'last_played': 1642628318}
review: Si te gusta el tenis este juego es EL JUEGO. Complicado de controlar y tecnicamente desfasado pero la sensacion de estar jugando un partido de verdad es indescriptible. Los nervios del saque, intentar apurar al maximo los golpes, la tension de los momentos finales de un partido...todas esas sensaciones las transmite el juego. Por mi parte recomendable al maximo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093517856', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 5930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2043, 'last_played': 1674599175}
review:
If you have played tennis (in real life), you will like a lot this game. This game is not for casual tennis players like Virtua Tennis, this is a pure simulation game.

Is you like overwhelming graphics overall, dont spend your money in this game

With ITST Mod 1.18, this is, by far, the best tennis game i ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151384033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2737, 'last_played': 1679259867}
review:
Si te gusta el tenis, si lo practicas, si quieres realismo y una física bien desarrollada, si quieres escapar de lo arcade y entrar de lleno en un gran simulador de tenis....este es tu juego!. No te dejes engañar por su superbásica interfaz (parece que vas a jugar a un juego de los 90) ni por sus modestos gráficos, este es el mejor juego de tenis del mercado, sin lugar a dudas (sobre todo para aquellos que practicamos tenis). Cómpralo cuando esté en oferta y quedarás totalmente satisfecho.

Lo único que mejoraría sería la volea. Cuando dos jugadores se ponen a volear el uno con el otro la sensación de simulador de tenis se pierde, ahí se ve que es un juego. Aparte de eso, quizás el que sea más probable mandar la bola a la red...simplemente para darle más realismo, rara vez se estrella la bola en la red. 

Cuando los creadores de este juego saquen la nueva versión con nuevos gráficos y las leves mejoras que he comentado, será sin duda el juego definitivo de tenis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010596601', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 2011, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1900, 'last_played': 1513938129}

author: {'steamid': '76561198099455897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1485375191}
review: Absolute crap along with the manager game bundle, yawn boring.
developer_response:
According to a lot of the reviews on Steam, TE2013 is the best tennis simulation ever. This crafting took a lot of effort & love over several years.

If you're not much into tennis, unfortunately you might not see why Tennis Elbow is so good, but at least you might be able to see there's a ton of options to tune the gameplay to your liking.

If you tell me what you gave you problem exactly, I may be able to advice you some settings to enjoy the game more.

For example, you should turn on the Aiming Preview which helps to get into the game, and if you're a Virtua Tennis fan (ie: you like arcade tennis more than simulation), set the Controls to Arcade, and chose to play right away with a high ranked player to enjoy powerful and easy tennis from the start.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079749647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 793, 'last_played': 1485874506}
review:
Tennisspaß pur!! 
Mit der Mod PATCH MAXOU 2016 nochmal viel besser. Meiner Meinung nach die beste Mod für die Offlinekarierre. Für den Onlinemodus gibt es da andere. 

Deswegen bezieht sich mein Review auch nur auf das Game mit der Maxou Mod. Vanilla hab ich gar nicht ausprobiert.

Mit der Mod sieht das Game auch ganz in Ordnung aus. Für mich ist das grafisch völlig in Ordnung. 
Die Steuerung ist mit etwas Übung schnell gelernt bleibt aber bei schwierigen Bällen anspruchsvoll, genauso wie es sein sollte. Controller sollte aber genutzt werden, da dies genaueres Steuern ermöglicht. 
Leider gibt es manchmal ein paar Sound - und Musikfehler ab meistens ist es gut. Sonst habe ich eigentlich nicht viel zu beanstanden. Das Menü ist halt auch mit Mod nicht wirklich schön aber dafür gibt es mehr Einstellungsmöglichkeiten. 
Gerne hätte ich im Karrieremodus mehr Möglichkleiten, wie Trainingslager und speziellen Trainingseinheiten zum Üben aber dies ist jammern auf hohem Niveau. 

Fazit: Für jeden Tennis und Sportfan absolut empfehlenswert. Gelegenheitsspieler haben es etwas schwerer mit der Steuerung aber da es viele Einstellungsmöglichkeiten beim Schwierigkeitsgrad gibt, gewinnt man auf niedrigster Stufe auch ungeübt mal ein Turnier. 

Die mod findet ihr ganz einfach im Netz und das Installieren ist wirklich easy. 

Zur Steuerung findet man Erklärungen auf Englisch im Handbuch. Wichtig ist, dass ihr immer versucht richtig zum Ball zu stehen! Also erst zur richtigen Stelle bewegen dann den Button für Schlag o. Slice o. Powerschlag gedrückt halten und dabei den Analogstick in die Richtung drücken  in die der Ball gehen soll . Wenn ihr z.B. Stopbälle oder TopSpin Schläge ausführen wollt so müsst ihr in der Grundsterung entweder noch nach unten oder oben drücken. 
Also bei einem Stop im linken Feld nah am Netz wäre die Reihenfolge: richtig positionieren -->  Button für Slice gedrückt halten und dabei leicht nach links drücken (Button gedrückt halten aber Analogstick nur kurze Richtungsanzeige) --> Button für Slice immernoch gedrückt halten und dann zusätzlich den Anlagostick nach oben gedrückt halten. 
Ich habe die Tastenbelegung aber geändert und habe die oben und unten Befehle auf die Schulterbuttons gelegt. Somit müsst ihr nicht alles über den Analogstick machen.  Übrigens der Spieler schlägt immer egal ob ihr drückt, also nicht wundern. Dies sind aber nur Notschläge. Viel Spaß

author: {'steamid': '76561198057420444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4012, 'last_played': 1593968659}
review: Tennis Elbow 2013 demeure le jeu de tennis récent le plus réaliste et offre une reproduction des sensations du court très aboutie. N'espérez ici pas planter des amorties de fond de court ou des points gagnants en bout de course... il vous faudra construire vos points et vos matches "comme en vrai" ! La possibilité de faire progresser le joueur et d'élever graduellement le niveau de difficulté permet de maintenir l'intérêt du jeu, même après des dizaines d'heures à échanger des balles. A recommander aux amateurs du genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039329115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1605968514}
review: On the surface it resembles a 1980s arcade game with a clunky low-res user interface, the actual internals are remarkably detailed and thoughtful.  I was actually looking for something that resembled a tennis simulator and if you are patient enough to tweak some game and camera settings.. you will find that it can be used to hone timing and on-court reflexes, even to the degree of game strategy.  The split-second timing and decisions in-game does reflect and appropriately affect the strength and effectiveness of the shots,  It also quietly offers a few simulation functionalities that are not found in other tennis "games", such as, full game recording, multi-player (split-screen), multi-player (online), real-world pro-player character/stats.. Highly recommend for people who are looking to improve their tennis in the real world!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047227670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 12099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6427, 'last_played': 1569007920}
review:
Ever watched a tennis match on TV and said "if I could play as well as he can I could be so much better because I see how he should play but he doesn't?" Well, this is the tennis simulator where you can see how well you understand the game of tennis. 
The rallies are realistic, the shot placement matters, the tactic matters, patience matters, the way you build your player matters.
Sometimes I just feel like hitting a heavy topspin forehand that hurts my opponent. This is the game that can make it happen.

To wszystko powoduje, że TE to pochłaniacz kolejnych godzin. A twórcy już zapowiedzieli kolejną edycję. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198104657218', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1054, 'last_played': 1489266564}
review:
[h1] Tennis Elbow 2013 6.5/10 [/h1] 

Jedna z najlepszych gier tenisowych na steamie. Niestety, głównie przez to, że gier w tym gatunku jest tutaj niewiele. Na plus opcja kariery, pełna większości liczących się turniejów singlowych i deblowych, dobre odwzorowanie poziomów (wyższe pozomy są niezłym wyzwaniem), możliwość modowania. Na minus zdecydowanie multiplayer, gdzie brakuje graczy, oraz brak oryginalnych nazwisk zawodników. Oczywiście wszystko można samemu zmodować, jest kilka patchy dodających prawdziwe nazwiska. Największym minusem jest jednak cena, najtaniej kilkanaście euro, głównie ze względu na brak konkurencyjnych gier tenisowych.

Dobra gra, ale widać że to tytuł z 2013 roku, grafika nie rzuca na kolana, sam gameplay szybko staje się monotonny. Dla fanów tenisa zdecydowanie warty polecenia tytuł, dla pozostałych mimo wszystko szkoda wydawać kilkanaście euro na grę która znudzi się po paru godzinach.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076842069', 'num_games_owned': 1154, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1477832891}
review:
I was really excited to play Tennis Elbow, I loved all Virtua Tennis games and enjoy watching Tennis too. I knew from the videos the game looked bad, and I know not to be shallow when looking at games, but the fact that its poorly optimised, and still doesn't allow me to play it at 1080p without it crashing just isn't good enough. I tried to play the game 3 times and it crashed each time  when I changed the visual settings of the game. I have a 280x so it should work okay with the graphics for this game.

After finally accepting my fate at 480p, I got into playing it, its okay, the menus are clunky and ugly, it takes to long to start a career, the sounds are awful, and the gameplay boring and repetitive against the computer. Sadly after wanting this game for so long and finally getting it when it was 45% off, I decided I would refund the game as I was so disappointed in what I had purchased. I hope the dev continues to develop the game and make it better, but I rather play an older ps2/wii game than this.

Find my quick review on the game here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AhdAVHuvIxI
developer_response:
1- If the change of video resolution crashes in-game, you can change it using "Launch configuration tool" that pops up when you launch the game from Steam

2- You messed up the settings and turned off the 3D courts, which shows the ugly old 2D courts ; this mode is there only to allow Modders to add photo-realistic courts to the game

3- You should read what's on screen (or read the manual) because you have to keep the buttons pressed when you strike the ball, else you're not playing Tennis Elbow 2013 and just keep sending the ball in the middle of the opposite court doing weird thing with your player, like you did in your video. There's even a pop-up in your video that tells you to do that and you ignored it... :-/

4- It's "long to start a career", which is like 2 or 3 minutes, because you have options to configure it. So now it's bad to give choices to the players to configure the experience to their liking ?

Maybe you should have asked for support instead of writing a hasted negative review, I'm always around to help...

[b]EDIT[/b]:
I chatted a bit with Paddy, and it turns out he used a controller in the menus, thus the reason it was a bit slow to setup things. The menus are fully usable with a controller, but it can get a bit cumbersome so I recommend to use the mouse if possible, and pick the controller only during the matches.

For the gameplay, Paddy should have turned on the Aiming Preview which helps to get into the game, set the Controls to Arcade (being a Virtua Tennis fan ;-) ), and chosen to play right away with a high ranked player (still being a VT fan) to enjoy powerful and easy tennis from the start.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082421846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 84266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22956, 'last_played': 1671904467}
review:
[h1]Tennis Elbow 2013 is a great game focused on simulating tennis, the way it's played in real life.[/h1]

The gameplay is designed to mimmick the tennis played by the pros on tour. All players have a set of stats spread into different categories (like Forehand, Backhand, Volley, Service, Movement and Special Shots) accompanied by a specific playing styles (Defender, Power Baseliner, Volleyer etc). All these attributes will determine how powerful and precise your player is and also how many errors they make. The aiming system takes some time to get used to, but you can easily configure the difficulty most suitable for you and practise in the Warmup Mode.

The graphics, reminiscent of the early 2000s, are the only downside of the game, while sounds are realistic (and different) for every surface.

Career (or World Tour) Mode is extremely detailed, with tournaments every week of the year (including Davis Cup and World Tour Finals championships), full rankings, head to head and other in-depth stats. You can create a new player or choose from the huge list of recent tennis stars and legends, from both the men's and women's tours. 

Perhaps the best aspect of the game is the huge ammount of mods made by a dedicated community on managames.com. You can add clothes, animations, courts, players or even completely overhaul your World Tour in order to perfectly simulate real life tournaments (for example ATP Patch and WTA Mod).

[h1]I conclusion, I would recommend this game to any tennis fan looking for a realistic gameplay experience and in-depth simulation, at the expense of beautiful graphics.[/h1]

[h1]10/10[/h1] [spoiler]I played way too much.[/spoiler]
Update 11/2016 - Still fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051255717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 7023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3989, 'last_played': 1619101166}
review: Un gioco fantastico e realistico , lo consiglio a tutti gli appassionati di tennis e statistica , c'è la possibilità di modificare come un editor anche i nomi o i valori dei tennisti , molto meglio di altri titoli con allenamenti insulsi o cartine di poco gusto , in questo gioco tutto essenziale  e realistico , consigliato vivamente ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198003679143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 7718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1043, 'last_played': 1653946827}
review:
Nach 16 Stunden Spielzeit möchte ich ein erstes Fazit ziehen (ohne Multiplayer)...

Positiv :

- Der Karrieremodus bietet enormen Tiefgang mit ausgedehnten Rollenspielelementen
- 60 Schwierigkeitsgrade. Ein "zu leicht" oder "zu schwer" gibt es für 99% der Spieler nicht
- Die Animationen beim Aufschlag und dem Grundlinienspiel wirken authentisch und nachvollziehbar
- Dieses Spiel ist kein Arcadespiel sondern eine anspruchsvolle Simulation 
- Der Mod-Support ist beim Umfang und der Qualität erstklassig und sorgt für zusätzlichen Realismus
- Die KI spielt einfach nachvollziehbar Tennis und eine "dumme" KI gibt es in dem Spiel daher nicht
- Auch ein 10 Jahre alter Rechner schafft hier mühelos 60+ FPS.
- Simple Steuerung per Tastatur oder Gamepad (dringend empfohlen)
- Zutiefst beeindruckendes Gameplay
- Man erlebt Höhenflüge und Tiefschläge im Karrieremodus und geht durch ein Wellenbad der Emotionen

Neutral :

- Die Mechanismen der Steuerung können einen Spieler überfordern. Vorallem dann wenn er wenig Geduld hat
- Der Lernprozess kann sehr lange dauern wenn man den Tiefgang dieser Simulation unterschätzt

Negativ :

- Unterirdische Menüführung und Menügrafik im 90´er Jahre Stil
- Die Soundeffekte sind eine absolute Frechheit (All-in-Mods verbessern das deutlich) 
- Die Spielermodelle/Spielertexturen sind nicht auf dem heutigen Stand der Technik
- Die Animationen beim Volleyspiel wirken abgehackt

Noch ein paar Worte zu den All-in-One-Mods die meiner Ansicht nach unverzichtbar sind...

Es gibt 3 All-in-One-Mods für Tennis Elbow 2013. Sams Megapatch 2013, MAXOU ATP 2016 und ITST 1.17. Letztgenannter Mod konzentriert sich ausnahmslos auf den Multiplayer und bietet daher keinen Offline-Modus und somit keine Offline-Karriere.

Für Offline-Spieler, und dazu gehöre ich, gibt es also "Sams Megapatch 2013" und "MAXOU ATP 2016". Erstgenannter All-in-One-Mod wird nicht weiter entwickelt, letztgennanter wird aber weiter entwickelt und schlägt meiner Meinung nach "Sams Megapatch 2013" zwar nicht im Umfang aber in der Qualität und ist daher meiner Meinung nach der beste All-in-One-Mod für Tennis Elbow 2013. 

MAXOU ATP 2016 bietet :

- Fotorealistische 2D-Courts und weitgehend gut gemachte 3D-Courts
- Etliche reale ATP und WTA-Tennisspieler über einen Zeitraum von 26 Jahren (1990-2016) 
- Deutlich realistischere und vielfältigere Soundeffekte als in der Vanilla-Version
- Den kompletten Terminkalender der ATP inkl. aller dazugehöriger 2D/3D-Courts (auch für WTA nutzbar)
- Zusätzliche Einstellungsmöglichkeiten in den Menüs 
- Wird immer noch weiterentwickelt

Fazit :

Wer den Tennissport liebt, eine tiefgehende Simulation und kein Arcadespiel spielen will und bereit ist sich mit Geduld in die Mechanismen der Steuerung einzuarbeiten und für den Gameplay über Grafik steht der findet hier für knapp über 20 Euro eine echte Perle der Spieleindustrie. 

Es sind zwar "nur" 16 Stunden die ich bislang mit diesem Spiel verbracht habe aber Tennis Elbow 2013 hat mich total gefesselt und ich kann nicht aufhören dieses Game zu spielen.  

Absolute Kaufempfehlung !

author: {'steamid': '76561198101101348', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 9259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7245, 'last_played': 1693796691}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024270997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 251, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1505452921}
review:
Amazing tennis game !

Maybe the best in terms of sensation and realism ! Positioning themselves, anticipate, take risks, manage physical effort, manual aim... You play a human !
The learning curve is long, and we discover lot of subtleties over time.

So, yes, at the packaging level, it's not Top Spin, for sure ; but I guarantee you that the gameplay of Tennis Elbow surpasses it !

His only problem is the fact that it is a niche game for niche players who love a niche sport, and it therefore affects the online and the probability of steadily finding players.

Beyond that, TE has this advantage of being easily modded, and some mods allow almost photorealistic rendering, with real courts, real players with real stats, etc...
The AI is solid and may give you challenging and strong opponents.

My best advice is that you watch some videos on Youtube (especially with mods), and test the demo of the game at this address :
http://www.managames.com/tennis/game_en.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198116348594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2735, 'last_played': 1593100541}
review:
Probably the best tennis sim ever. Been twenty years since I saw one with the good of a career mode. Just like the graphics, not a lot of flashy stuff, but great simulation of events and tracking history. The gameplay is great with pleanty of skill levels to advance thru.

If you pick this up and have an issue with the controls just stick with it. Use the training club and leave aids on until you get the hang of it. The holding buttons works well to create errors as well as great winners.

A must have for tennis fans who have been looking for solid gameplay and career mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992177909', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 71145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 22, 'playtime_at_review': 10681, 'last_played': 1711773343}
review: I love this game, the gameplay is amazing, the best tennis "simulator" ever, made for players. If you play tennis, you will know what i'm talking about. BUT  i think online experience is no good enough, i never can create a host, changed computer, ISP, operating system. Even i changed my location, im living somewhere else now, and i having the same problem... Anyways i still playing as a guest. I RECOMMEND THIS GAME.
developer_response:
Opening the UDP Port depends on your Router, not on your OS, not on the game, so I can't do a patch for that.

You had written to me "OTHER PORTS TO PLAY ONLINE, CANNOT OPEN UDP4321" (yup, in all caps), and I answered you it was already possible to change the port in the game, if you wished to do so.

The documentation refers to the Portforward site to help you configure your Router (from here http://www.managames.com/tennis/doc/Tennis_Elbow-Tennis_Game.html#network ), but some Routers are especially hard to set up.

All the tips I know about that issue are linked from here => http://www.managames.com/Forum/topic8-9923.php .

If you can't join other games as well, then it might be an issue with your Firewall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198717043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1634327088}
review:
Technische Versäumnisse machen dieses Spiel in 2016 zum Flop.

Die Grafik ist ok, aber die Animationen teilweise komplett daneben, passen nicht zum geschlagenen Ball. Ich sehe eine Verschlechterung zu Jimmi Connors für Super Nintendo, das ist klassisch und funktional.

Die Menüführung ist einfach eine Frechheit. 1998 wäre das vielleicht noch akzeptabel gewesen.

Die Steuerung ist eine verpasste Chance. Warum schlägt der Spieler von allein, wenn man keinen Knopf drückt? Die schlechteste Entscheidung aller Zeiten.

Das, zusammen mit der gefühlt nich korrekt umgesetzten Gamepad Eingabe, bei der man sich immer fragt ob man noch selbst seuert oder die Figur grade wieder im auto-play Modus bewegt, macht ein präzises Spielgefühl zunichte.

Die ständigen Sound Aussetzern haben ihr übriges getan und lassen für mich leider nur eine Note 4- zu.
developer_response:
As most of what you said can be seen in the video and the screenshots on the Steam Store page, why did you buy the game in the 1st place ?

Maybe you should play a bit more the game to see what is enjoyable about it... There's a lot of options to tailor the gameplay to your likings ; for example, you can set Auto-Pos to Low and your player will almost not move automatically anymore.

The player automatically hits the ball so you can prepare your strike till the last instant, which makes the game more dynamic and realistic. If you play more till you reach a good level of difficulty, you'll understand it was a good way to simulate tennis (if you know real tennis) without making a too complex control scheme (ie: having separated controls for legs & arms).

[h3]EDIT:[/h3]
I noticed you have bought the game again this year but still almost didn't play it.

I can recommend you this Mod which helped many people to enjoy the game more : https://www.managames.com/Forum/topic29-24824.php .

author: {'steamid': '76561198040062168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 10360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 907, 'last_played': 1705500823}
review:
Mientras nadie demuestre lo contrario, el mejor juego de tenis que encontrarás en Steam y mucho más allá. Tennis Elbow puede echar para atrás a muchísimos jugadores casuales, que se acercan al tenis pensando que este puede ser un juego divertido y reconfortante. Evidentemente quién jugó mínimamente a tenis en una pista real, sabe perfectamente que el tenis es muy sufrido y frustrante. De eso se trata Tennis Elbow. 

Nadie piense que tiene delante un título arcade. Tennis Elbow es sin duda el juego que más se aproxima a la realidad de un partido real. Esto no significa que un jugador casual no pueda jugarlo. De entre sus múltiples ventajas está un sistema de levels absolutamente a la medida de cada uno. Varios niveles de "profesionalidad", combinados cada uno con 10 subniveles más. Realmente puedes encontrar la medida a tus dedos habilidoso o más bien torpones. 

Por supuesto y como vengo repitiendo, es un juego absolutamente de sensaciones. Piensas como un tenista, tanto en la pista como en el escalafón, puesto que además de un soberbio simulador de juegos, tiene la ATP al completo y más, rankings y torneos, Copa Davis, los grandes, los master 1000.... Realmente una delicia en cuanto a pistas y eventos. 

Si hay que sacarle un pero, serían dos. Su interfaz es simplemente práctica, y para nada bonita, y al jugador nuevo le puede resultar un tanto liosa. Al tiempo, agradeces su sencillez. En segundo lugar, y ligado al primero, el juego se ve espartano. Tenis Elbow es larga saga tenística y como tal, no hizo demasiado por renovar ni sus menús, ni su gráfica. Esto no quiere decir que se vea mal. Con su nivel de realismo y sensaciones, para nada notarás que necesitas los logros gráficos de EASports en este título. Incluso con un poco de mods, la cosa se torna más gratificante. Ya en mmuchos juegos, la interfaz gráfica dulce, es su único argumento. Aquí tienes Tenis, del bueno. 

Si te gusta el tenis, su dinámica, sus historias, este es tu juego. Sino te gusta, pasa de largo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970999635', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 5963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1131, 'last_played': 1582410321}
review:
Waouh, you should see this game. It has been released in 2013 but the menus are ridiculously ugly and misleading. Super Nintendo games were in average way better in that area.
So it is a tennis game, the gameplay is the most important. Some interesting ideas are introduced, they make sense.
Now I have one word to summarize a game: FAULT!

Aiming is stupidely difficult, it is comparable to the full manual mode in Fifa. Services are for the great part, random based.
You can miss an important shot, even with very good placement, just because of a random.
Yeah it is realistic, but very annoying.

Compared to Top Spin 4, the difference is obvious: points are not lasting very long here, the random engine will provoke a fault pretty quickly.

Let's finish by the graphics and the sounds. The graphics are catastrophic, worse than a Korean free2play. The sounds are correct and realistic, but I can tell you, you will laugh at the music in the menus, ridiculous.

Let's hope that Top Spin 5 finally arrives and ships on PC.
developer_response:
[h1]EDIT Juillet 2020[/h1]
Bonjour Vilmir,

vu le nombre d'heures sur le jeu, j'imagine que tu as quand même pas mal apprécié TE2013, surtout que j'ai vu que tu l'avais conseillé dans des avis sur d'autres jeux de tennis.
Est-ce que tu pourrais reconsidérer ton avis négatif ? Là, tu pénalises les chances de succès du jeu à tout jamais, alors que tu pourrais peut-être plutôt soutenir un peu un jeu Indie qui a ses qualités, même s'il est loin d'être parfait ? :-)

Merci d'avance d'y réfléchir !

================
[b]EDIT[/b]:
Vilmir posted that after a couple of hours of playing, and now he's up to nearly 30 hours, so he's enjoying the game but likes to trash it anyway... :-/
================

1- Everybody can see & hear this game by checking the video & the screenshots, including the menus & the GUI, on the Steam store page, and if they think it's horrible, no one is forcing them to buy the game... ;-)

2- If you're correctly positioned and prepare your strike early enough, your shot will never end fault

3- Aiming is not too difficult, but it can be a bit tricky at 1st, so you might want to turn on the aiming preview (in your Character Sheet) to learn how it works ; you can let it on forever or turn it off once you'll be more accustomed to it

4- Experienced Tennis Elbow players can make rallies that last a long time, with few errors ; example, highlights of last online Grand Slam final here => https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xByaDVbQ3J4

5- Serves net & long faults are from RNG, but if your player have good serve skills, you'll be able to put more than 75% of serves in, if you aim left/right correctly

author: {'steamid': '76561198060399865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1510, 'last_played': 1471687619}
review: El mejor simulador de Tenis que sigue habiendo a dia de hoy. El modo carrera es brutal y fiel reflejo de la realidad. El unico "pero" que le pondria es la interfaz del calendiario a la hora de elegir torneos. La veo un poco pobre. Por lo demas muy bien.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983977630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2604, 'last_played': 1473624123}
review:
This is by far the most realistic tennis game I have ever played for PC or console. First thing, the learning curve is very steep, especially if you are coming from a game like Top Spin. The controls will feel very different at first and will take some time getting used to. The game is unforgiving when making mistakes. You may want to remap some of the buttons to make it easier or make the controls more like Top Spin/Virtua Tennis.

The campaign mode is extremely in depth. It is like a real tennis career starting from the bottom unlike other tennis games. You begin playing Futures tournaments and have to qualify for Challengers and Tour level just like real players. That alone makes it a good challenge and have a lasting appeal. Also, if you want real player names and real tournament names, mods are available for the game. If you a tennis fan, you will enjoy this game. Hopefully the developer will produce a quality sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007007905', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 6941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5854, 'last_played': 1494961964}
review:
Игра у которой был потенциал и который разработчики успешно про....ли
В глаза сразу бросоается, что проект низкобюджетный: графика и анимация словно из начала 2000-х годов
Но это можно было бы простить, если бы у игры был качественный геймплей, но увы.
1) Физика до крайности примитивна и нереалистична
2) Интерфейс - это наглядный пример того, как делать не надо. Он ужасен. 
3) Неудобное управление, местами даже отвратительное. Особенно плохо реализовано при игре у сетки или на отскоке
4) Расчет выносливости/усталости это вершина некомпетентности. Разработчики всеръез считают, что бить по мячу также затратно как и носиться по всему корту за мячом. Ну да, конечно.
5) Траектории мяча порой вызывет удивление - "какого х...а эти электронные болваны могут то, чего в жизни не способны сделать лучшие из лучших! Да это вообще нарушение законов физики."

Короче если ваши нервы вам дороги, то обходите стороной. Хотя потенциал у этой "игры" был.
developer_response:
0) You managed to play 109 hours in a game you hate ? (not a single pros in your review)

1) It's only the best physics available in a tennis game. Ever.

2) GUI is simple & efficient once you're accustomed to it (but ugly :P)

3) It seems even after more than 100 hours in the game, there are still things left for you to learn

4) Hitting the ball isn't as tiring as running. Hitting accelerations is noticeably tiring, so you can't hit accelerations all the time which forces you to think about how to use them, and if you play normally you'll get way more tired from running than from hitting the ball.

5) I'm not sure what you mean, but the ball always follows physical laws ; there's mishits that produce bad strikes, though, maybe it's what you were talking about...

6) If you want to improve the visuals of the game, check the Mods created by users, some are pretty nice

author: {'steamid': '76561198040538550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 3696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1708994742}
review: Ce ne sono di più belli da vedere. Ma se mai in vita vostra avete preso in mano una racchetta, anche solo per una volta (nel mio caso parlano 10 anni di pallinate), vi accorgerete che questo qui è il miglior gioco di tennis in circolazione.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043515041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 7621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4013, 'last_played': 1630703850}
review: The game mechanics are fun and it is definitely the best tennis game on PC I have ever encountered all thanks to the long career mode. Names of the professional players have been changed due to lack of license from ATP and WTA. This can be fixed with Sam's Megapatch which is the only mod you need for the game for it to give you the 9/10 tennis experience. The vanilla game is 7/10 so the mod is recommended to get the full experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155460127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 114332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29226, 'last_played': 1698654726}
review: The best tennis simulation I've ever played on PC. The gameplay itself is very realistic, but the best way to play the game is with a MOD, it really makes it awesome with real-life courts and players and outfits and more!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993837602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 10289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7175, 'last_played': 1593311657}
review:
Installé avec le Sam Megapatch... et les deux combinés fait de Tennis Elbow le meilleur jeu de tennis que je connaisse. Si on excepte les graphiques un peu en retrait, c'est le seul jeu de tennis qui permet de vivre une carrière complète de tennis, et en plus on peut choisir sa période pour faire face à ses joueurs préférés.

De plus, la gestion de la difficultée est une des meilleurs qui m'ait été donné de voir dans un jeu de sport. Fini les matchs à sens unique à cause d'une difficultée trop facile ou trop dure. Ici, l'ajustement de la difficultée est si bien faite qu'il existe forcément un niveau correspondant à votre maîtrise du jeu.

Je conseille vivement !

author: {'steamid': '76561198018930063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1468164904}
review:
Très bon jeu, très addictif. Dès qu'on a pris le coup de main, on peut lacher ses coups et on s'y croit vraiment.
Libre aux joueurs d'augmenter la difficulté à chaque match, rendant le jeu encore plus immersif.
Il y a de quoi passer de longues heures à gravir les échelons de la gloire!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034099433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1466006767}

author: {'steamid': '76561198102741218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 8680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4149, 'last_played': 1598225124}
review:
Best tennis game on pc
In terms of Gameplay it is MORE REALISTIC than TOP SPIN 4 trust me i play tennis in real life.
Only backdraw is the graphic, but you can download a patch from managames.com

author: {'steamid': '76561198196994882', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 17440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 36, 'playtime_at_review': 1776, 'last_played': 1712253449}
review:
ВАМ ПОДХОДИТ ЭТА ИГРА, ЕСЛИ:
- Вы игрок, любящий хардкорные симуляторы. Сложные.
- Вы игрок, любящий ставить перед собой планку на развитие
- Вы играли в теннис или хотите начать в него играть
- Вы считаете, что визуальная составляющая игры - не главное
- Вы любите проекты, для которых существует большое коммьюнити, предлагающее множество прикольных модов

ВАМ НЕ ПОДХОДИТ ЭТА ИГРА, ЕСЛИ:
- От словосочетания "R9 Fury X" у вас появляются нездоровая дрожь в конечностях и желание продать друзей на органы
- Вы хотите "нагибать" налево и направо
- Вы любите аркадный геймплей и быстрые результаты
- Вы считаете, что лучший из Квейков - тот, который выпущен последним
- Вы не любите теннис.

ИМХО, это лучший симулятор тенниса из существующих.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116993929', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 11653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4917, 'last_played': 1690063057}
review:
Puede parecer un poco tosco en una primera impresión, pero cuando lo pruebas ves que es un juegazo con todas las letras.

Tiene una simulación muy lograda, dentro de las limitaciones del juego. No esperes que el jugador se lance a por una bola lejana o que salga de las 4 animaciones que tiene para los golpes, pero la simulación es 10/10. Cuenta además con varios niveles de dificultad, y estos, con 10 subniveles cada uno.

Es muy fácil empezar a jugar, tiene un sistema de ayudas muy bien implementado donde puedes ir desactivando poco a poco cada una de ellas que te ayudan a hacerte con el ritmo de los partidos y oponentes distintos.

Supone un gran reto jugando en el modo carrera si se ajusta la dificultad lo suficiente pero sin pasarse. Si te pasas, es MUY MUY DIFICIL.

Cuenta además con una comunidad modder que hacen un trabajo brutal editando los nombres de los jugadores, porque aparecen tipo 'PES' (Nenad Djakavec o Ruben Nodol), con ropa y raquetas, pistas, marcadores, etc.Todo lo referente a mods se puede consultar en el propio foro de ManaGames e incluso aclarar tus dudas con el creador del juego, digno de admiración.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993101561', 'num_games_owned': 1311, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1584593110}
review:
What a great game! I waited until it was on sale for $15 and it's absolutely worth it. The control when striking the ball is remarkable. Plus there are tons of tournaments and many, many configurable options. By far the deepest tennis game I have played, and I haven't even gotten into online play or modding.

If you're into tennis games on the PC, you can't go wrong with Tennis Elbow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172060601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 53199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5012, 'last_played': 1710538038}
review:
Tennis Elbow 2013 really is the best tennis sim out there and every tennis fan should give it a try.
I've played many tennis games like "Top Spin 4" or "Virtua Tennis" and those games can't give you a true tennis experience like this one. Once you learn controls, that I have to admit are hard for new players, this game is pure pleasure with its complex physics and career mode and fun to play in long or short bursts. I almost have 100 hours invested in this game and still can't get enough especially when you install great mods like ITST.

Must buy for every tennis fan!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198273859803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1459683281}
review:
首先呢，这的确是一款精心设计的游戏。正如@Ferelasong 所说，这款游戏仿真程度很高，有很多自定义参数，很多mod，还有个很真实的tournament系统。这都足以说明这个制作者的用心之处。

但是这个游戏的缺陷也是很明显的：
1. 恶劣的游戏界面。这个很多人说过了。但实际玩了才发现原来游戏界面（UI）更加地丑，2000年左右的水平。
2. 完全不用户友好。作者竟然还敢在简介里写“easy and intuitive learning curve”我也是醉了。反人类的击球方式（击球+下方向键是上旋……），纷繁的参数设置（没错，我指的就是tournament的那些参数），但最要命的是莫名其妙的击球瞄准。你必须得一直按着你的击球键直到把球打出去，不然就是软绵绵的safe strike，这期间你还得忙着按方向键调整球的去向，一不小心就会打出界。当然了，你也可以阅读制作者提供的manual来学习怎么玩，但是需要另外看个22页英文文档才能开始玩？？？游戏里竟然没能好好地引导用户怎么玩？？说实话，这样玩很累，我还不如亲自下球场。
3. 奇怪的难度设置。在tournament中，你设置了高难度的话，无论你在什么等级的比赛，每个对手都是费德勒纳达尔，你没有高的能力值是打不赢的。但我期望的难度不是这样的啊摔!! 这难度不应该是AI难度吗？？？要是变成能力值差距的话你在游戏初期也没有打高难度的机会了。
4. 截击的方向难以把握。除非球刚好在你面前，不然基本都会打偏，因为你按方向键移动的同时也是在按击球方向。

哎，反正我是不愿意折腾这个了，谁爱折腾就玩去吧。我还是回去无脑地玩VR好了
developer_response:
2. Having to press the button on strike, instead of releasing early like in other tennis games, allows to prepare your strike till the very last instant and thus gives a more dynamic and fast experience, where you have time to manage your positioning, which is closer of what you have to do on a real court

3. In tournament mode, you have to select a tournament that matches your current level ; but even in low tournaments, new players can be very talented : it's like in real life !
If you don't like that, you can start at a higher ranking (ie: 100 or 30) and there the opponents will have a more stable level, and your player will also start significantly stronger

4. Practice volley in Warm Up mode ; after 10 or 20 minutes, you should get the hang of it

author: {'steamid': '76561198049511070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1504160874}
review:
First off, yes, the graphics aren't very good. Sometimes the players move a bit awkwardly and the overall look of the game (UI in particular) is quite dated. Seeing this initially turned me off from the game, but it seemed like people really enjoyed its accurate gameplay. I had previously played Virtua Tennis 3 on the PS3 and later purchased and enjoyed Top Spin 4 because it was less arcade-y. But Tennis Elbow 13 blows both out of the water in terms of precise gameplay that really simulates tennis.

There are a number of things about it that I really like, but the most notable is the realism when it comes to unforced errors. In most other tennis games, it's either impossible to make an unforced error (other than double faulting) or it's ridiculously difficult and will only happen after your player is extremely tired. This means that you can paint the lines on basically every shot without any risk involved. In this game, you have to precisely aim your shot and if you aim too close to the line, you may miss. If you're in an awkward position when you do it, there's a much bigger circle of uncertainty around your aimed shot, so you can easily miss if you go for too much.

Some people might have issues with the lack of licensed players, but I personally find the obvious knock-offs absolutely hilarious. Riccardo Fidirir, Nenad Djakavec, and Ruben Nodol will never fail to make me laugh. (Plus, I think there may be mods that you can download to make these accurate)

There's also a ton of granularity when it comes to skill customization and opponent level (4 levels, 10 sublevels per level). Overall, I would really recommend this game to people who want a true tennis sim. The graphics don't really bother you after a bit because the gameplay is so good and immersive (the satisfaction of struggling to beat an opponent, but then succeeding 4-6 7-6(4) 7-6(5) is fantastic). However, if you want a more arcade-y game with great graphics, Virtua Tennis is probably the way to go.



For anyone who is planning on getting this game, I really recommend using a gamepad. I personally use a PS3 controller connected to my Macbook via Bluetooth and have mapped the D-pad for movement, the X button for topspin, the square button for slice, the circle button for an accelerated shot, and the triangle button for a defensive lob. I find that it works very well. (Normally, I prefer to use the analog stick for movement, but you also use the movement input for shot aiming, which requires a lot of precision. Thus, I use the D-pad, which I got used to pretty quickly)

author: {'steamid': '76561198079972933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1448763365}
review:
Definetly best tennis simulation on PC. Maybe graphics are not from the top-shelf, but all other aspects create an unique experience. Tennis Elbow 2013 got great career mode game, where you can play as future star of tennis, climbing up the ranking and trying your skills in more challangeing tournaments. But the most fun is the game itself. Great physics and mechanic of gameplay delivers feeling known from real game. Computer player are perfect imitating stye of play of real players. Tennis Elbow 2013 have also a lot options to configure, so you can easily customize the game to your neds.

Pure recommendation, one of the best sports game, best tennis game ever!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036153744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 943, 'last_played': 1448593954}

author: {'steamid': '76561198116662923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1629, 'last_played': 1535235348}
review:
S'il ne brille pas par sa qualité graphique et le beauté de ses animations (il n'y en a pas), Tennis Elbow saura vous séduire par son contenu. Non pas qu'il y ait beacoup de mode de jeux, mais énormément de joueurs et joueuses sont présents sur plusieurs décennies, ainsi que de très (très) nombreux tournois, des Futurs au Grand Chelems.
Reste la jouabilité, élément central du jeu. Sur la construction des points et le réalisme des coups on est sur un très bon jeu, sans être vraiment parfait. Je regrette le manque d'animations du joueur qui rend l'ensemble un peu rigide. Je regrette aussi le traitement des vollées qui donne envie de fuir le filet.

Bref, loin d'être parfait on reste sur un très bon jeu indé avec de bonnes sensations. Le mode carrière très complet et la base de données élèvent clairement la qualité globale du soft. En ce temps de disète vidéoludique sur le tennis, Tennis Elbow remplira parfaitement ce vide.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060339236', 'num_games_owned': 4829, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1483594732}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067576872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1095, 'last_played': 1489327502}
review:
Takes a bit of getting used to in the beginning as it's not like Virtua Tennis.  But when you get the hang of it, you can do a wide variety of shots anywhere you want depending of course on how the balls returned to you.  This is probably the most authentic experience that I got from a tennis game.  I'm still practicing on perfecting my drop shots and lobs.  Also this is a great game to play whenever you want a stress reliever or simply just wanna kill some time.  

However, It does take some editting in the game folders to get the game working the way you want.  And you can also edit the players and tours in the data folder.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033423161', 'num_games_owned': 1319, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 36695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36013, 'last_played': 1554548873}
review:
Tennis Elbow 2013  一款專為網球愛好者打造，兼具休閒與擬真的網球模擬遊戲！

別被它看似古老的界面和粗糙的畫質嚇到，TE2013的精隨在於它對真實網球比賽的刻劃，遠超過其他市面上的網球遊戲(雖然根本沒幾個...)。  不管是發球、抽球、切球、放短或是高吊，都模擬的很有水準，對於有打過網球的朋友，更能體會這遊戲的用心！

再來，TE2013對模組的支援非常棒，在官方論壇上就有許多優秀的模組，在各方面都彌補了遊戲在畫面和球員動作上的不足，更有大型模組把整個ATP巡迴賽整個搬進遊戲中，包含近千位真實球員及數十個真實球場，讓玩家可以體驗完整的球員生涯！所以我推薦一定要裝模組。

另外TE2013也提供連線遊玩，可以和線上玩家對打或組成雙打對抗ai (但是因為亞洲玩家不太多，常常只有歐洲房ping太高玩不了，但連線對戰真的很有feel)。

操作上對入門玩家可能會有點困難，需要一段時間熟悉，但當你發現苦練之後，從原本只能勉強回幾個弱球，到輔助全關還能滿場飛的和ai對攻幾十個來回，真的頗有成就感。

Tennis Elbow 2013真的是個用心之作，不管是對喜歡看網球還是喜歡打網球的朋友都非常推薦，一起來感受網球的樂趣！

An in depth tennis game for all tennis lovers !

推薦Mod: 

ITST 1.19 (連線對戰為主)

Sam MegaPatch 2013

phucnguyen0209

PATCH MAXOU

author: {'steamid': '76561198007154600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1445853690}
review:
A lot of sports games claim to "get it right" or as "authentic" as possible.  Well, Tennis Elbow 2013 does just that with flying colors!  From the player and court graphics, the controls (with a controller it's obviously easier), tournaments, tennis skills, stat tracking and evolving your player all are accomplished and well done in my opinion and I'm sure you'll agree if you like tennis.  As far as the game play goes, it's not in the slightest convoluted to control your character and it's easy to learn, yet takes a long while to master it.  That goes a long way in replayability as does the online play and tournaments.  The play is smooth and never laggy and it's seriously the BEST tennis simulator I've ever played and I have been playing tennis games since the NES days!  It has everything a tennis game player would want and more!  It's well worth the price of the game and it's a damn great game they put together for us to enjoy!

Overall Rating: 9.5/10
