author: {'steamid': '76561198059948329', 'num_games_owned': 1451, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1111, 'last_played': 1527266224}
review:
大概很多人没有听说过这款游戏，不过实际上Tennis Elbow(以下简称TE)是在资深网球游戏爱好者间最受欢迎的两款游戏之一了(另一款是Top Spin)。与TS相比，TE的画面、人物动作和建模、界面UI都显得很简陋，不过它在拟真性上的努力足以掩盖它的缺点。

1.TE对跑位和角度控制的要求非常高。如果没有跑到合适的击球位置，会造成下网或出界;击球角度过大也会造成出界。
2.默认的击球方式有平击球、削球、加速球三种，加速球速度最快，但是会消耗更多的体力(当体力下降时会损失击球精度、加速球力度、最高跑速等)。另外配合组合键可以做出短球、吊高球、浅球(小斜线)、上旋球等等动作，可以说TE在击球方式上还是挺丰富的。
3.TE有非常真实而完善的赛程系统，以及丰富多样的比赛场地(当然TE还做不到红土赛场中的滑步动作这样的小细节，比较遗憾)。另外，球员的能力有很多参数可供调整，在生涯模式中，可以通过训练来分配提高参数，但是打比赛会减少参数，最终你会发现能力值都是有限的，需要合理的规划。
4.3种操作难度、6种AI难度可供选择，其中每个AI难度又分为10个级别，来帮助玩家逐渐提高自身水平。据说要打赢最高操作难度下的最高难度电脑，起码得练习个半年到一年。
5.除了能力参数外，球员的击球风格、服装、外貌、动作、声音等等都可以自定义。游戏里表面上看不到真实球员，但事实上是可以选很多真实球员的，只是名字做了些改变，比如李娜改名为了Nannan Li等等，一些球员在游戏中的动作也是比较贴近现实原型的。当然，官网论坛上提供了非常丰富的mod，包括球员自定义选项、真实球员模组等等，还有联机专用的mod。可以说mod极大丰富了游戏的可玩性。

想了解更具体的游戏特点的话，可以查看下游戏手册，上述我提到的只是一部分。

我们知道网球游戏相比篮球和足球等游戏而言并没有受到太大重视，Top Spin和世嘉的VR网球都迟迟未能有续作的消息。TE也是个老游戏了，不过它多年来都有在进行更新改进，直到今天TE已经是趋于成熟而相当具有可玩性了。本游戏推荐给所有网球及网球游戏爱好者，只要你不在意它过时的画面。

author: {'steamid': '76561198107803309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1440528221}
review:
[i]Key supplied by developer for review.[/i]
[h1]======================================[/h1]
[h1][b]Tennis Elbow 2013[/b][/h1] (Read on for the full review!)
[h1]======================================[/h1]

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
Whether in short bursts or long durations, this a tennis sim with depth that will keep you engaged and challenged.

[h1]======================================[/h1]

[h1][b]Pros[/b][/h1]
+Depth
+Realism
+Longevity
+High skill ceiling

[h1][b]Cons[/b][/h1]
-Graphics: Probably the game's worst but most insignificant fault.
-Controls: A bit clumsy, hard to learn, but intuitive once grasped or mastered.

[h1][b]Neutral[/b][/h1]
+/- Sound: Works, minimal, true to life, but low quality.

[h1]======================================[/h1]

[h1][b]Introduction[/b][/h1]

Welcome to Tennis Elbow 2013, a tennis simulation featuring painstakingly realistic physics at the expense of graphical fidelity. It supports warmup, practice, campaign, and multiplayer modes, via double or single matches.

[h1][b]Gameplay[/b][/h1]

The gameplay in Tennis Elbow 2013 is fast and fluid, but the controls may leave you scratching your head at first. I spent a long time trying to figure out how to not hit the ball straight to the center of the court before figuring out there's a default shot that is performed even if you don't take one. So not only did the default kb+m controls not seem to allow me to take actual shots, but when using a controller, I was under the impression the shoulder buttons would, but they did not. Then I tried using the face buttons, and everything changed.

So in TE13, in order to get the ball where you want it, you have to move to get to it, move correctly to take the correct type of shot, and also move to aim the shot once you start to take it. If that sounds like a lot to deal with in a split second, then you are correct, but it is so much fun getting it right and the amount of precision with which you can crush your enemies with once you lock it down.

As stated earlier, there are a variety of gamemodes. The AI is quite competent, featuring various levels of difficulty as you ascend the ranks. If it does particularly well or poorly against you, you can opt for higher or lower difficulties. The scoring is...well, like tennis, and the hitboxes for the racket are good. There is an RPG factor here with the extensive character customization present, where you can even select your character's preferred playstyle.

I should also briefly mention that the animations are actually pretty nice, and there are quite a few. I don't care for the backpedaling animation, though. At any rate, it is a game that isn't especially fun to learn, is fun to play, and is very fun to learn to do well and play well with.

[h1][b]Graphics[/b][/h1]

So you're not going to see the shadows and leaves falling off of trees. There will be no sunshafts or lens flares. You won't see much lighting at all, actually. You won't see everything fluttering slightly in the breeze. The character models even, are pretty poor. The physical build isn't too awfully bad, but the lack of lighting and shading and quality textures especially stands out on them, and the UI...the UI is straight out of the 80s.

The graphics aren't bad exactly (excluding the UI,) everything is functional and represents what it is supposed to. They just aren't good. In any way. They would be bad if you consider anything not having good or amazing graphics bad, but in the end, this is a game about playing tennis. Even more, it's a simulation focused on tennis. You don't need flashy effects when you hit the ball, or cinematic angles distracting you. You just need to see yourself, your opponent, and the ball going between you two.

[h1][b]Audio[/b][/h1]

The audio quality in Tennis Elbow 2013 is a bit low. There won't be any unrealistic uproar of a crowd 10 times bigger than any crowd ever present, nor any exaggerated effects involving fire and lazers when you hurl your ball 10 meters into the ground creating a crater amidst an explosion. What you get is simple sounds that are there when they are supposed to be. They are realistic in that sense. Hit a ball with a racket, you hear a ball being hit with a racket. On the other hand, the recording quality and the sounds themselves could be much better, but again I must stress that this is a sports sim and not a walking simulator meant to immerse you in deep story and compelling visuals and audio.

[h1][b]Conclusion[/b][/h1]

So, it gets one component majorly right, and two others, sometimes very important ones, very wrong. "What gives?" you might say, "since when is getting just one thing right good enough?" Well, I will tell you. It's enough when it is this damn fun to experience, however, I should also point out that the game is very capable of being modded, and many people have created packs featuring better/different sounds, player models, animations, courts, etc.

What you will get if you purchase this game is a very real feeling of playing actual tennis. In that regard, the game is nearly perfect. So in conclusion:

I recommend Tennis Elbow 2013 for any enthusiast, at full price.

If you just "like tennis" like me, I still think it is worth full price, but you might consider a sale.

If you're just interested in getting a competitive or realistic experience, or grabbing any sim that exists, but don't especially love or even like tennis, I would recommend it still, but on sale.

[h1]======================================[/h1]

[i]If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Original_Curators_Group#curation]Follow Original Curator Group[/url][/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197994410207', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3679, 'last_played': 1616439431}
review:
This is by far the best tennis simulation i have ever played, Dont be put off by the lack of graphical fidelity because where this game shines is the mod support that really adds to the developer's solid base game with realistic animations,courts and player models. The learning curve is rather steep at first but after practice the game is magnificent and with continued mod support keeps improving. Thanks to the developer also who is very helpful on the games forum.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198162351264', 'num_games_owned': 1232, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 6847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3010, 'last_played': 1447892995}
review:
Although it is obvious that the graphics are outdated and that there are no pro superstars to play with by default, however this game brings to the table one of the most realistic tennis simulation experiences out there. There is a high level of complexity and it is not a simple three or four button game. There are button combinations which makes you do specific shots and player positioning actually matters in this game, which is something you wouldn't see too much in a game like 'Virtua Tennis 4' where you just hold a single button and you playing automatically positions him/herself perfectly to the ball.

Thankfully, the files are easily moddable which means that it is possible to bring in tennis superstars if you wish and change other things like tournament settings.

I would only recommend this game if you are a big tennis fan and want a complex tennis simulator where you want to be able to have full control of your shots and player, and to also be challenged.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000847338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1659031048}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049661528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 22868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1137, 'last_played': 1630898273}
review: If Virtua Tennis and Top Spin are like Call of Duty, then Tennis Elbow is like Arma. Realistic, hand crafted, and honest to what it portrays. No video game makes the tennis more real and challangeing. You can't walk in and expect to start winning everything. If you do a world tour it will take you time to build your character up to adaquate level to be able to compete. Also the system isn't arcady, it will certianly take some getting use to. However if you want the most honest tennis experience then look no further than Tennis Elbow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023930985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 704, 'last_played': 1528057715}
review:
When I had the urge to play a tennis game, I was sorely dissapointed at the lack of options on PC. I decided to take a leap with Tennis Elbow, and I'm glad I did. This game is incredibly addictive! It isn't the prettiest game, and the sound leaves much to be desired, but the basic gameplay mechanics are incredibly solid. The game just feels right to play, and it is contantly challenging. 

I will say that it is an absolute must that you mod this game. The flaws in the vanilla version make it very difficult to ignore the low production value of this game. I use Sam's Megapatch for offline career mode, and it is fantastic. Definitely better than what I expected.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198200890977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1433992690}

author: {'steamid': '76561198107674043', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 5859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5839, 'last_played': 1497040405}
review: Super simu !
developer_response:
1) Tu peux facilement éditer les joueurs si tu penses qu'ils sont trop forts sur certains de leur coup.

2) J'imagine que tu as pris un Mod, parce que Nadal dans le jeu d'origine ne peut pas servir à 230km/h (sauf peut-être en niveau Incroyable-10)

3) As-tu essayé de mettre les contrôles sur Elite ? Le jeu devient ainsi beaucoup plus exigeant pour toi et le joueur IA ; cela diminue le nombre de super contres.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129746487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 565, 'last_played': 1486788757}
review: This is a wonderful game, the best tennis simulation I have ever played. If the graphics were fully modernized, this would be a  five-star game well worth a premium price!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017192120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 2460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 815, 'last_played': 1444580649}
review:
Do you like Tennis? If the answer is yes, this game can be ok for you.  Easy to play, difficult to master. In my book this means longevity, replayability and tons of fun! 

The game can be played single player (for example career mode) or multiplayer (competitive play). 

Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198170216523', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1518047165}
review:
Great and realistic, very recommended specially cause you can mod the game at your own taste.
Gameplay: you can miss a shot and hit shots to net, different from other tennis games, where you only hit and hit and ball never go out. Player has a current stamina (more usable for world tour play)
Training club: you can choose your player and set the abilities.
World tour: is very complete and according to the real ATP tour, you can start as a teenager promise, and you can play in futures and little tournaments, or a top player and play majors and Masters1000.
 Everything can be modded, since has an open engine, you can create:
courts, animations (requires 3ds Max 8), outfits, rackets, tournaments huds, icons, mostly everything.
Very good playabilty in online.
Very recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033944717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1532381242}
review:
Actualmente el mejor juego de tenis.
Los gráficos y animaciones claramente no están al nivel ideal que se esperaría. Pero la jugabilidad y las mecánicas utilizadas son perfectas para un buen juego de tenis.
Ojala las grandes desarrolladoras aprendieran un poco de esto, porque si este juego tuviera calidad AAA y algún que otro modo de juego mas; seria el juego definitivo de este deporte.
Muy recomendado, y con una dificultad muy ajustable, desde muy fácil  a INCREIBLEMENTE difícil con muchos puntos intermedios.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055980278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1433144926}
review: Me parece un juego penoso, lento, descabellado, infumable, con el odioso indicador de dosnde va la pelotita...una pena
developer_response:
You can of course turn off the visual helpers ; to do that, go to your Character Sheet and lower your preview.
For the game speed, TE2013 is likely one of the fastest tennis game around, with a ball speed that is very close of the reality ; but to see that, you have to raise the difficulty level, as in lower levels, the players aren't much powerful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055859486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 49841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15260, 'last_played': 1709212236}
review: La migliore simulazione di tennis alla quale abbia mai giocato. Un gameplay estremamente realistico, una modalità "carriera" entusiasmante, uno sviluppo delle abilità del giocatore basato sull'acquisizione di punti esperienza, e un'ampia gamma di opzioni e livelli di difficoltà tra cui scegliere. Il tutto arricchito dalle modalità di gioco multiplayer e co-op. Che cosa si può volere di più?

author: {'steamid': '76561198016711280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1622589301}
review:
A játék nagyon jó. Mondom ezt úgy, hogy előtte a Virtua tennis 4-et toltam (ezt a GFWL miatt buktam). Mindenben veri azt, kivéve a grafikát. Ez kicsit szimulátorosabb. Magyarul sokkal könnyebb elbaszni egy ütést, de így nagyobb a kihívás és a játékélmény. Gond nélkül támogatja a gamepad-et és van multi is, bár ezt még nem mertem kipróbálni, mert még sok gyakorlás hiányzik. Ha szereted a teniszt, akkor ez a te cuccod. Ne hagyd ki!

This game is better then Virtua tennis 4 (except for the graphic). Buy it and beat me if you can!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025151351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1576018992}
review:
When I first loaded this game up I thought, what on earth is this, very old fashioned layout, really annoying music. Just proves looks can be  deceiving because this is by far the best tennis game out there. Very realistic and great customization. Only caution I may give people is the controls take some getting used to, it's not like Virtua or Top spin tennis where you can just button bash. On this game you have to time your shots, along with the movement of the player. 

If you can persevere with the controls Tennis Elbow 2013 proves to be the best Tennis game out there, well for the time being anyway. Highly recommended!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982995489', 'num_games_owned': 1680, 'num_reviews': 397, 'playtime_forever': 2625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1623782679}

author: {'steamid': '76561197981467536', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1707081141}
review: Tennis Elbow je nejlepší simulace tenisu, se všemi klady i zápory, které tenis nabízí. Někoho může odradit grafické zpracování, ale to hned napraví nepřeberné množství módu pro single i multiplayer. Převážně pro multiplayer je geniální mód "ITST" (hoďte si do googlu Tennis Elbow ITST :), kde si můžete vybrat asi ze 60 hráčů ATP a hrát s nimi proti ostatním hráčům, to je asi ten nejlepší tenisový zážitek jaký vám jakákoliv počítačová hra může nabídnout.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062627631', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 19327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1596, 'last_played': 1560523139}
review:
Ребята, это шедевр!! Я играл в разные симуляторы тенниса, но этот оказался лучшим из всех.
Карьера 10/10- полное погружение, это нечто. Все как в реальной жизни, вся кухня с очками, турнирами, рейтингами.
Графика нормальная, глаз не режет, все красиво, все по делу.
Физика игры, вот тут разрабы реально постарались, плохо подошел к мячу лови аут, ударил с низкого отскока плоским ударом лови в сетку, все настолько четка, что я иногда при ударя дергаю плечом, сразу вспомнил как сам играл.
Едиственный недостаток это бедное наполнение кортов, но это меня не волнует, главное сам процесс игры+ есть ведь моды, их пока не смотрел еще. Ну а русский язык тут не нужен и так все понятно ;)
Вердикт: Великолепно!!(как говорил мой тренер по теннису)
10/10. Лучший симулятор тенниса который я видел.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067235452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1375, 'last_played': 1495900386}
review:
I got this game based on some positive comments from Steam and other sources, and I think that it's worth the price.

First of all, you have to bear in mind that the graphics is not on a very high level, in fact it's nowhere near the average level of gfx in games produces by "professional" studios. If you played Virtua Tennis 4, and expect something simliar I must disappoint you  -  the difference is graphics is huge.

However, in terms of pure gameplay, I think that Tennis Elbow can defend itself. Matches are quite realistic, and you can choose from a quite wide arsenal of shots. The game offers a variety of options, altering the match diffculty from easy ones (with shot indicators), to more realistic ones. You can participate in tour, creating your player (or choosing one of existing ones), slowly building up your position in rankings, and improving your skills. Each time you enter the tournament you can decide if you want to play singles, doubles, or both (if allowed by ranking).
If you are a tennis fan (and I don't see any reason to buy this game if you are not), then there is a real chance that you will like it.

Pros:
- realistic gameplay
- you can set the various difficulty levels, as well as adjust amount of games, if you don't like long matches
- good career mode

Cons:
- fake tennis players names
- graphics quality (if you care)
- I have experienced troubles finding online games

author: {'steamid': '76561198029505620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1557019578}
review: Best tennis game ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973935979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2019, 'last_played': 1434250626}
review:
This is easily the best tennis game I have played (console or PC). Some might find that odd, considering the UI and game visuals seem a bit dated. I didn't say it was the prettiest. It isn't, but it's also not terrible, either. The core gameplay is what makes this the best tennis game I have played.

The controls are excellent. They take a little getting used to and become second nature after a bit of practice. The available strikes in the game can be mapped to your preference. They are as follows:

o Normal Strike
o Short Strike
o Top Spin
o Slice
o Drop Shot
o Defensive Lob
o Acceleration
o Short Acceleration
o Aggressive Lob
o Safe Strike

The game also supports modding and has a strong community that have been modding the various iterations of the game over the years. Several mods add all the real players, statistics, animations, sounds, courts, etc. They also update the UI visuals, which is a nice touch. At this time, there are two major mod packages which seem to have most of the 'best of the best' mods from the community in a nice tidy package:

o Sam's Patch - solo World Tour play with all the real pro players (visuals, stats, animations, courts, scoreboards, etc). 
o ITST - online play with all the real pro players (visuals, stats, animations, courts, scoreboards, etc). 

This is strictly tennis. You won't be knocking down bowling pins in mini games for example (not that there's anything wrong with that). You will either be playing quick matches, trying your hand at an extensive career mode, or playing against others online.

If you really like tennis, this game is a no-brainer. If you are very casual, I would suggest that you download the 14-day demo that is provided on the developer's website. It even lets you play online. This should be more than enough time to see if it suits you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030391458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 1269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1559192171}
review: Ich habe - so glaube ich - so ziemlich jedes Tennis-Spiel für den PC ausprobiert, das es seit 1995 gegeben hat. Keins ist bisher in Sachen Spielbarkeit an Jimmy Connors auf dem SNES und Top Spin 4 auf der Xbox 360 herangekommen. Dass die Zeit der Sportspiele auf dem PC vorbei ist und nur noch die Konsolen mit gescheiten Titeln versorgt werden, damit hatte ich mich fast schon abgefunden. Und dann taucht plötzlich dieses - den Screenshots nach - hässliche Entlein Tennis Elbow 2013 auf. Spielbarkeit! Das war das Stichwort in den Reviews hier, das mich das Spiel sofort hat kaufen lassen. Nach dem ersten Schreck (wirklich hässliche, wenn auch zweckmäßige Menüs, eine Spielgrafik wie von 2000) und den ersten Ballwechseln stellte sich bei mir eine große Zufriedenheit ein. Jeder Schlag ist hier möglich, wenn man ihn genügend übt. Realistisch ist das trotzdem - man muss schon richtig stehen und das richtige Timing haben, sonst landet der Ball weit im Aus oder kommt nicht einmal ans Netz. Zwischenfazit nach wenigen Spielstunden: Wer 4K, Lens Flares, Motion Blur, Cutscenes und das ganze kurzlebige Blingbling braucht, wird garantiert einen Heulanfall bekommen. Wer kein Grafikfetischist ist und sich nach der guten alten Zeit sehnt, in der noch die Spielbarkeit an erster Stelle stand und Grafik das Mittel zum Zweck war, kommt mit Tennis Elbow 2013 voll auf seine Kosten; absolute Kaufempfehlung!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971972173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 6855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2887, 'last_played': 1540660515}
review:
Best Tennis game ever produced. Don't let my Steam playtime fool you. I've owned and enjoyed this game since way back in 2011 (from the previous incarnations - and free udates to 2013) and must have hundreds of hours logged playing this. No idea but it would be a lot of hours.

So what it doesn't look like Virtua Tennis. It's the gameplay that counts. Years ago I'd given up trying to find a decent tennis game that accurately portrayed rallies and wasn't a simple move and hit the ball console kiddie playing toy. Then I googled about and found this. Not only was the actual gameplay superb but in addition there is a role-playing element where you can improve over time the stats of your player in career mode.

To some of the new players that think they have wasted their money with this game: well yes graphically it's not amazing and the gameplay may be hard at first, but perservere and you will be richly rewarded with an amazing Tennis game that will keep you going for years. This is one of the few games I've ever played that I consistently come back to. It's been a permanent fixture in my gaming since I started with it 4 years ago. There is no other game that I can say the same thing about.

To the few people that have given this a thumbs down after only playing 2 hours or less they need to take a good internal look at what they are looking for in a game. Have they been brought up on photorealistic graphics over gameplay? That is sad for them, because if they don't perservere a little with this game they are not only cheating themselves out of the money they paid for it but also the incredible game this will open up into if they just show a bit of patience. Once you improve at the game, your character improves, you won't give a hoot about the graphics. No 3d photo realistic graphics could possibly play this type of ball realism. it would have to be done 2d like this for it to work in my opinion.

Also, if you don't like the fact that the tournaments are not licenced etc - there are 2 very good large mods out there that alter this game considerably. Go look for them. They're easy to find and install.

I recommend this game 10/10. But on the other hand, if you would rather play some childish console button bashing no skill involved garbage with pretty graphics like the big studios produce - stay  away from this. This game doesn't want you anyhow.

Edit: I've got back into this recently after a layoff from it. I just want to add this:

The AI in this game is nothing short of amazing. That is the crowning glory of this game. The programmer must be some kind of genius to have created such an AI that is so realistic. Plus there are so many skill levels that if you are having difficulty then you can adjust it to how you want so anyone can enjoy this game.

For the people that slag this game off ---- I honestly feel regret for you. Many of you have expressed that you love tennis games and have played many over the years, yet this one is rubbish. If I think back far enough, I remember I too had difficulty with the controls at first. But seriously if you persevere then you will be rewarded with what is arguably the best Tennis game ever produced. I am serious on that. Please give it another try for your own sake - if you like tennis games THAT much.

I have played sooooooooo many nail biting tennis matches thanks to this. It is so realistic. I honestly cannot see this tennis game being bested ever as the majority will not give this game enough time to discover how good it is.

I would also add this: When you buy it, download the Sam mod to update for better graphics and realistic players. The developer couldn't add these due to legal restraints. Once you get to that stage with the Sam mod then the game will reward you back hours of gameplay. Again I state, I have been playing this since about 2010 and it has become a permanent fixture in my gaming time. I have over 200 games in my library on Steam. This one is one of the best.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992952406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1180, 'last_played': 1622492107}
review:
Brilliant game with terrib.. eh, functional graphics and menus.

This is more like an oldschool hardcore sports game on PC so it means if you have time and patience you'll probably slowly learn to tame it. Master it? Probably never...

A tip, try to remove the visual aiming as fast as you can, it will help you tremendously once you feel ready to play online.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991111777', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1588451437}
review:
Il y a 5 ans, j’avais testé Tennis Elbow 2013 pendant 2 petites heures. Cela m’avait suffi pour avoir un avis négatif assez tranché sur ce jeu. J’ai eu l’occasion de discuter récemment avec ManuTOO, le développeur, qui m’a convaincu de réessayer avec les dernières mises à jour et un mod pour améliorer le visuel. Après une dizaine d’heures de jeu, j’ai donc décidé de réécrire cette évaluation.

Avant de poursuivre, je précise que le jeu à 7 ans. Même avec l’ajout d’un mod, certains aspects ont pris un petit coup de vieux et sont difficilement reprochables aujourd'hui : les graphismes, l’interface des menus, l’optimisation du contrôleur… Je m’attarderai donc ici uniquement sur le gameplay et les sensations de jeu.

1.	POINTS NÉGATIFS

Pour commencer, la prise en main n’est vraiment pas évidente. La configuration des touches par défaut est loin d’être instinctive. Tout est bien sûr paramétrable mais vu le nombre de boutons et de combinaisons, il faut compter 30 bonnes minutes pour avoir une config acceptable. Même constat qu’il y a 5 ans : l’attribution des touches est une vraie usine à gaz.

En cause certains choix de gameplay qui, même s’ils m’ont été expliqués par ManuTOO, apportent plus de complexité à mon sens qu’une réelle plus-value :
-	Attribuer des touches différentes pour les coups courts et les coups longs (alors que la direction du stick pourrait suffire)
-	Différencier les lobs offensifs et défensifs
-	Je ne vois toujours pas l’intérêt de la frappe automatique. Non seulement on ne s'en sert jamais, mais je la trouve pénalisante : Il m’est arrivé plusieurs fois de frapper une balle que je voulais laisser sortir.

Dernier point : l’apprentissage des services. Autant pendant l’échange on dispose de pas mal d’aides visuelles pour apprendre à se placer ou à viser, autant pour les services c’est le néant. J’ai testé plusieurs timing bouton/direction, j’ai l’impression que le résultat est assez aléatoire.


2.	POINTS POSITIFS

Ces quelques constats faits, j’ai mis mes certitudes de côté et j’ai fait l’effort de dépasser les 2 premières heures de difficulté. Car oui, c’est difficile. La précision n’est pas facile à acquérir. Les joueurs ont une inertie un peu perturbante au début et il n’est pas toujours évident de se placer.

Mais une fois qu’on commence à comprendre les mécanismes du jeu et à les maîtriser, on a de vraies bonnes sensations manette en main. Au point que les échanges se font plus variés, plus tactiques, plus construits... En un mot, plus réalistes.

C’est appréciable d’avoir un jeu de tennis où les coups surpuissants dans des positions improbables ne sont pas la norme ; où il ne suffit pas de croiser sa balle à chaque échange jusqu’à ce que l’adversaire soit à la rue.


CONCLUSION

Contrairement à ma première éval, et même si je n’adhère pas à tous les choix de gameplay, j’ai cette fois pris du plaisir à jouer à Tennis Elbow 2013. Et ça reste l’essentiel. Une vraie simulation exigeante, mais qui récompense ceux qui prennent le temps de la maîtriser.

C’est indépendant du jeu en lui-même mais j’ai aussi beaucoup apprécié la démarche de ManuTOO. Ça fait plaisir d’avoir un développeur qui va au contact des joueurs pour avoir leur retour.
developer_response:
1- La frappe automatique est justement plus réaliste : aucun joueur ne laisse passer la balle sans la frapper ; par ailleurs, cela ouvre tout un tas de possibilité qui n'existent pas dans les jeux où il faut relâcher pour taper dans la balle : principalement, cela permet de préparer son coup jusqu'à tout dernier 20ième de seconde.

2- En vrai, c'est plutôt le contraire, 80-90% des coups sont faits en position ou en fin de course, les 2 étant parfaitement retranscris par le jeu ; les coups en course ne sont fait que pour contrer les grosses attaques.
Par ailleurs, tu peux changer d'avis sur ton coup jusqu'au dernier moment avant la frappe ; tu perds la qualité de ta préparation si tu change de coup, mais pas si tu changes de direction (càd viser à droite au lieu d'à gauche).
Et une fois de plus, en vrai, tu ne changes pas de coup au tout dernier moment, car c'est techniquement très pénalisant, voir impossible (ce qui est donc retranscris dans le jeu par la perte la qualité de la préparation).
Le timing de frappe dans la balle est un concept de jeu vidéo, mais totalement irréaliste : je n'ai jamais vu aucun joueur se plaindre de frapper la balle trop tôt ou trop tard, à part peut-être de gros débutants ; et si tu fais un tour dans une école de tennis tu n'entendras jamais "tu tapes trop tôt/trop tard" dans la bouche des entraîneurs.

3- A partir du moment où tous les coups sont configurables, je vois mal le problème, mais le haut/bas sont logiques, et ce par 2 fois :
- haut/bas sont fait comme pour piloter un avion => pousser = haut = plonger, donc balle plus courte
- pour faire une balle plus courte sur un vrai court, il faut la recouvrir un peu plus, et donc monter un poil la raquette, donc => haut
Tu peux jouer avec 9 boutons sans problème ; l'avantage du B1+B2, c'est d'avoir le bout du pouce sur B1 avec le mileu du pouce sur B2, et donc de choisir son coup sans jamais bouger le doigt.
La différence entre un lob d'attaque et de défense n'est pas la longueur de la balle, mais sa hauteur, plus bas pour un lob d'attaque, et son lift, nettement plus important pour le lob d'attaque ; techniquement & en terme d'objectif, c'est donc très différent. Là encore, rien ne t'empêche d'assigner ces 2 coups comme il te convient.

4- Là c'est possible que tu n'as pas compris que la vitesse de visée gauche/droite dépend de ta position sur le terrain : le plus proche du filet tu te trouves, le plus rapidement cela vise gauche/droite ; un peu plus d'entraînement avec l'indicateur de visée devrait te permettre de mieux saisir comment tout marche (au début, c'est sûr que ce n'est pas évident!). Par ailleurs, plus haut tu souhaitais avoir du timing, là avec la visée tu as une bonne dose de timing à maîtriser ! ;-)
Sinon, aucun coup n'est moins bon avec plus de préparation. Là encore, certains mécanismes qui influent la qualité des coups ont du t'échapper : l'indicateur de Zone de Danger est là pour t'aider à les apprendre.

Voilà j'espère qu'avec tous ces conseils tu auras envie de donner une seconde chance au jeu !

author: {'steamid': '76561198006538268', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1573, 'last_played': 1528215164}
review:
Très bonne simulation de tennis avec un gameplay réaliste, une difficulté amplement configurable, un mode carrière riche et une base de données énorme. 
Pour un jeu qui pèse à peine 100mo, il ne faut pas s'attendre à des graphismes de toute dernière génération, mais les animations sont crédibles, et toutes les configs peuvent en profiter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003315544', 'num_games_owned': 870, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1427508217}
review:
Fantastic tennis game, just:

- Do not expect it to be like Virtua Tennis or other arcade tennis, because it's not.
- Do not expect to just start winning, the system takes getting use to.
- Do read the modding forum on here and install mods early on (you even get an achievement for it!).
- Do read the manual, available at the website. Seriously, it makes the control system make more sense.
- Do turn on ALL of the PREVIEWS when you first start. It's a wonderful crutch for learning.
- Do not expect graphics to be wonderful, but did you come to play tennis, or look at pretty things?

Once all that is done, and you lose your first few matches horribly, it starts making sense and getting fun!

review: Played lots of tennis games, VT, TS etc. Tennis Elbow is far superior in terms of gameplay and realism. Yes the graphics aren't good, and the UI is ugly. But it feels like playing tennis. Buy this game if you have ever played tennis for real. You will  feel and play like you do on a real court.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022214830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1458993837}
review:
Having played this for a few years away from Steam, what I have to say is that if you can get past the horrific graphics, the horrible animations, the poor presentation and maddening music and focus only on the gameplay...


...you'll find the best tennis game of all time. Definitely not a casual game, however, and it will take a while to get to grips with how it works. But once it clicks, it clicks and you won't look back. The last great tennis game, Top Spin 3, pales in comparison - you simply won't be able to recreate such variety in rallies and shotmaking that this game offers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007359710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1563, 'last_played': 1588517332}
review:
Excellent jeu de tennis. Il est très axé sur le réalisme, mais de multiples aides sont là pour nous aider à mieux appréhender les très nombreuses subtilités du jeu.
Il doit y avoir une dizaine de variétés de coups possibles, et pourtant tout a été conçu pour pouvoir y jouer avec deux touches, et je pense que cela résume bien l'effort réalisé pour associer le réalisme et le fun.
Quasi tout est configurable (si vous voulez utiliser plus de deux touches, modifier la durée des matches et les graphismes, par exemple...). Il est possible de jouer sur le circuit féminin, en double, en entrainement, et la carrière comprte pas mal d'éléments qui s'approchent le plus possible des conditions réelles.

Le jeu s'intitule "2013" mais est régulièrement mis à jour -dernère maj fin janvier 2015- et plusieurs mods sont disponibles. Il vaut vraiment son prix pour un amateur de jeu de tennis.

edit : dernière maj oct 2017...

author: {'steamid': '76561198016026827', 'num_games_owned': 1974, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1426334314}
review:
[b]5/10[/b] 
[b][i]"Would it be 2005 a great game, in 2015 sadly not."[/i][/b] 
Oh boy, totally a game where I should've checked out a demo at first. I love tennis games and I know there are so few out there. But unfortunately I cannot recommend this game to you. Tennis Elbow might be the best tennis sim out there for some, but for others it's just not contemporary in many aspects. I can see why people like it (pure tennis sim enthusiasts who can see over things), but I can feel the people (TopSpin players) who have/will spent 20 bucks (=15%off) and got/get "that/this".

[u]Pros:[/u]
+ great complexity
+ very good controls
+ good gameplay "idea"
+ good amount of features
+ very close community
+ very responsive author/producer
+ 49 MB download (dial-up modem compatible)

[u]Cons:[/u]
- missing atmosphere
- very bad graphics & animations 
- very bad sound quality 
- controls are not for everyone
- no official player license 
- very bad ui
- very bad control (gamepad) settings
- no default XBOX One/360 controller scheme
- 92MB on hdd
...I'd love to "gift" this game 10GB on my hardrive & at least 2GB VRAM on my GPU

[u]Wish:[/u]
?! The use of either the UnrealEngine(v4) / Unity(v5) / CryEngine(v3)

[u]Verdict:[/u]
[b]Tennis Elbow is like a really bad looking sim-version of VirutaTennis/TopSpin, but it's definitely more than that - for enthusiasts.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198079361622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1534966725}
review:
Il migliore gioco tennistico in circolazione su tutte le piattaforme, probabilmente il gioco "standard" dopo un pò può apparire ripetitivo perchè si gioca sempre su campi fatti con lo stampo l'un l'altro ma se andate sul forum ufficiale troverete moltissime patch che vi mettono tutti i campi e tutti i tornei ATP e WTA con le animazione realistiche dei giocatori più famosi come Federer, Djokovic, Murray, gli Scoreboard, i Kit sportivi ecc... Una volta installate le mod il gioco ti tiene incollato per ore e ore. Farete di tutto pur di vedere il vostro giocatore aggiudicarsi ogni singolo Slam. Vi elenco le migliori patch in circolazione

Atp patch 2013 by Phucnguyen0209: Migliore patch per la carriera offline (ATP World Tour) a mio parere
ITST Tour Patch: Patch per fare la carriera online (maggiori info sull sito ufficiale della mod Intertopspintour)
Sam Atp Megapatch 2013: Altra ottima patch per la carriera offline (ATP World Tour)

Nonostante sia del 2013 il gioco e le patch vengono aggiornati frequentemente quindi non noterete alcuno "stacco" in termini grafici 2013-2015

9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197972697803', 'num_games_owned': 609, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 21400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1443, 'last_played': 1682004850}
review:
Le meilleur jeu de tennis auquel j'ai pu jouer !
Aussi fun que Virtua Tennis, encore plus pointu que Top Spin.
Etant joueur de tennis, jamais je n'ai autant ressenti de réalisme dans un jeu de tennis.
Tout y est, du mode carrière, a l'entrainement.
3 ans que j'y joue, il est enfin disponible sur Steam, et pour tout fan de tennis, l'essayer c'est l'adopter !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960641110', 'num_games_owned': 860, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1192, 'last_played': 1627105990}
review:
I've played this game for a few years now and I am glad it's finally on Steam! The developer's hard work has finally paid off and the game will finally get the recognition it deserves.

Tennis Elbow 2013 offers gameplay unlike any other tennis game; it's an amazing simulation that is realistic, fluid, challenging, and most importantly, fun. It will take a bit getting used to at first as the game is not forgiving when it comes to placement and timing of shots. However, once you get the hang of it, hitting clean winners becomes so overwhelmingly satisfying. 

The game comes with a LOT of character customization similar to RPGs by allowing you to choose your character's playstyle and increase your stats/effectiveness in various aspects such as: forehand, backhand, serving, volley, etc.

Mods are also an option which greatly enhances the quality of the game. The addition of newer and cleaner 2D/3D courts as well as player models, swing animations, sound effects, clothing, and rackets allow you to customize the game the way you want it to look and play.

The most common complaint that I would expect to hear from people viewing the trailers are the quality of the graphics. Though it may not be up to par to the other tennis games out there, the game play is what compensates for it. As mentioned before, you can install mods that makes the game more visually appealing. If you can look past this flaw, I can reassure that you will love the actual game play.

Tennis Elbow 2013 is a MUST for tennis fans.

10/10
